https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/224.mp3	thrust out from under the quilt was growing cold on the bare floor as if to celebrate a victory over everybody a cricket chirped in a crack in the wall a cock crowed far off and another replied near by

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/228.mp3	it was her own heart sinking with alarm and terror and overflowing with love she opened the door and stepped across the threshold and onto the cold damp earthen floor of the passage the cold she felt refreshed her

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/243.mp3	had been fairly warm and he had remained in the caleche but at mytishchi the wounded man himself asked to be taken out and given some tea the pain caused by his removal into the hut had made him groan aloud and again lose consciousness

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/262.mp3	a healthy man can tear himself away from the deepest reflections to say a civil word to someone who comes in and can then return again to his own thoughts

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/303.mp3	the administration of government in its largest sense comprehends all the operations of the body politic whether legislative executive or judiciary but in its most usual and perhaps its most precise signification
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/304.mp3	it is limited to executive details and falls peculiarly within the province of the executive department the actual conduct of foreign negotiations the preparatory plans of finance
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/305.mp3	the application and disbursement of the public moneys in conformity to the general appropriations of the legislature the arrangement of the army and navy the directions of the operations of war
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/306.mp3	these and other matters of a like nature constitute what seems to be most properly understood by the administration of government the persons therefore to whose immediate management these different matters are committed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/307.mp3	ought to be considered as the assistants or deputies of the chief magistrate and on this account they ought to derive their offices from his appointment at least from his nomination and ought to be subject to his superintendence
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/308.mp3	this view of the subject will at once suggest to us the intimate connection between the duration of the executive magistrate in office and the stability of the system of administration to reverse and undo what has been done by a predecessor
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/309.mp3	the person substituted is warranted in supposing that the dismission of his predecessor has proceeded from a dislike to his measures and that the less he resembles him the more he will recommend himself to the favor of his constituents
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/310.mp3	these considerations and the influence of personal confidences and attachments would be likely to induce every new president to promote a change of men to fill the subordinate stations
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/311.mp3	and these causes together could not fail to occasion a disgraceful and ruinous mutability in the administration of the government with a positive duration of considerable extent i connect the circumstance of re eligibility
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/312.mp3	the first is necessary to give to the officer himself the inclination and the resolution to act his part well and to the community time and leisure to observe the tendency of his measures and thence to form an experimental estimate of their merits
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/313.mp3	the last is necessary to enable the people when they see reason to approve of his conduct to continue him in his station in order to prolong the utility of his talents and virtues and to secure to the government the advantage of permanency
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/314.mp3	in a wise system of administration nothing appears more plausible at first sight nor more ill founded upon close inspection than a scheme which in relation to the present point has had some respectable advocates i mean
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/315.mp3	that of continuing the chief magistrate in office for a certain time and then excluding him from it either for a limited period or forever after this exclusion whether temporary or perpetual would have nearly the same effects
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/316.mp3	when they were conscious that the advantages of the station with which it was connected must be relinquished at a determinate period than when they were permitted to entertain a hope of obtaining
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/317.mp3	is to make their interests coincide with their duty even the love of fame the ruling passion of the noblest minds which would prompt a man to plan and undertake extensive and arduous enterprises for the public benefit
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/318.mp3	and must commit that together with his own reputation to hands which might be unequal or unfriendly to the task the most to be expected from the generality of men in such a situation is the negative merit of not doing harm
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/319.mp3	instead of the positive merit of doing good another ill effect of the exclusion would be the temptation to sordid views to peculation and in some instances to usurpation
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/320.mp3	an avaricious man who might happen to fill the office looking forward to a time when he must at all events yield up the emoluments he enjoyed would feel a propensity not easy to be resisted by such a man
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/321.mp3	to make the best use of the opportunity he enjoyed while it lasted and might not scruple to have recourse to the most corrupt expedients to make the harvest as abundant as it was transitory though the same man probably with a different prospect before him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/322.mp3	might content himself with the regular perquisites of his situation and might even be unwilling to risk the consequences of an abuse of his opportunities his avarice might be a guard upon his avarice
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/323.mp3	add to this that the same man might be vain or ambitious as well as avaricious and if he could expect to prolong his honors by his good conduct he might hesitate to sacrifice his appetite for them to his appetite for gain
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/324.mp3	but with the prospect before him of approaching an inevitable annihilation his avarice would be likely to get the victory over his caution his vanity or his ambition an ambitious man too
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/325.mp3	when he found himself seated on the summit of his country's honors when he looked forward to the time at which he must descend from the exalted eminence for ever and reflected that no exertion of merit on his part could save him from the unwelcome reverse
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/326.mp3	and sighing for a place which they were destined never more to possess a third ill effect of the exclusion would be
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/327.mp3	in the exercise of his office that experience is the parent of wisdom is an adage the truth of which is recognized by the wisest as well as the simplest of mankind what more desirable or more essential than this quality in the governors of nations
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/328.mp3	where more desirable or more essential than in the first magistrate of a nation can it be wise to put this desirable and essential quality under the ban of the constitution and to declare that the moment it is acquired its possessor shall be compelled
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/329.mp3	to abandon the station in which it was acquired and to which it is adapted this nevertheless is the precise import of all those regulations which exclude men from serving their country
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/330.mp3	by the choice of their fellowcitizens after they have by a course of service fitted themselves for doing it with a greater degree of utility a fourth ill effect of the exclusion would be the banishing men from stations in which
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/331.mp3	in certain emergencies of the state their presence might be of the greatest moment to the public interest or safety there is no nation which has not at one period or another experienced an absolute necessity of the services of particular men
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/332.mp3	in particular situations perhaps it would not be too strong to say to the preservation of its political existence how unwise therefore must be every such self denying ordinance as serves to prohibit a nation from making use of its own citizens
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/333.mp3	in the manner best suited to its exigencies and circumstances without supposing the personal essentiality of the man it is evident that a change of the chief magistrate at the breaking out of a war or at any similar crisis for another
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/334.mp3	even of equal merit would at all times be detrimental to the community inasmuch as it would substitute inexperience to experience and would tend to unhinge and set afloat the already settled train of the administration
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/335.mp3	a fifth ill effect of the exclusion would be that it would operate as a constitutional interdiction of stability in the administration by necessitating a change of men in the first office of the nation
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/336.mp3	it would necessitate a mutability of measures it is not generally to be expected that men will vary and measures remain uniform the contrary is the usual course of things
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/337.mp3	and we need not be apprehensive that there will be too much stability while there is even the option of changing nor need we desire to prohibit the people from continuing their confidence where they think it may be safely placed and where by constancy on their part
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/338.mp3	they may obviate the fatal inconveniences of fluctuating councils and a variable policy these are some of the disadvantages which would flow from the principle of exclusion they apply most forcibly to the scheme of a perpetual exclusion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/339.mp3	but when we consider that even a partial exclusion would always render the readmission of the person a remote and precarious object the observations which have been made will apply nearly as fully to one case as to the other
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/340.mp3	what are the advantages promised to counterbalance these disadvantages they are represented to be first greater independence in the magistrate
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/341.mp3	unless the exclusion be perpetual there will be no pretense to infer the first advantage but even in that case may he have no object beyond his present station to which he may sacrifice his independence
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/342.mp3	on the arrival of which he not only may but must be exposed to their resentments upon an equal perhaps upon an inferior footing it is not an easy point to determine whether his independence would be most promoted or impaired by such an arrangement
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/343.mp3	as to the second supposed advantage there is still greater reason to entertain doubts concerning it if the exclusion were to be perpetual a man of irregular ambition of whom alone there could be reason in any case to entertain apprehension
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/344.mp3	would with infinite reluctance yield to the necessity of taking his leave forever of a post in which his passion for power and pre eminence had acquired the force of habit and if he had been fortunate or adroit enough to conciliate the good will of the people
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/345.mp3	there may be conceived circumstances in which this disgust of the people seconding the thwarted ambition of such a favorite might occasion greater danger to liberty than could ever reasonably be dreaded from the possibility of a perpetuation in office
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/346.mp3	by the voluntary suffrages of the community exercising a constitutional privilege there is an excess of refinement in the idea of disabling the people to continue in office men who had entitled themselves in their opinion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/347.mp3	the duration in office of the executive from the new york packet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/348.mp3	and to the stability of the system of administration which may have been adopted under his auspices with regard to the first it must be evident that the longer the duration in office the greater will be the probability of obtaining so important an advantage
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/349.mp3	it is a general principle of human nature that a man will be interested in whatever he possesses in proportion to the firmness or precariousness of the tenure by which he holds it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/350.mp3	and of course will be willing to risk more for the sake of the one than for the sake of the other this remark is not less applicable to a political privilege or honor or trust than to any article of ordinary property
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/351.mp3	the inference from it is that a man acting in the capacity of chief magistrate under a consciousness that in a very short time he must lay down his office will be apt to feel himself too little interested in it to hazard any material censure or perplexity
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/352.mp3	from the independent exertion of his powers or from encountering the ill humors however transient which may happen to prevail either in a considerable part of the society itself or even in a predominant faction in the legislative body
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/353.mp3	if the case should only be that he might lay it down unless continued by a new choice and if he should be desirous of being continued his wishes conspiring with his fears would tend still more powerfully to corrupt his integrity
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/354.mp3	either in the community or in the legislature as its best recommendation but such men entertain very crude notions as well of the purposes for which government was instituted as of the true means by which the public happiness may be promoted
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/355.mp3	the republican principle demands that the deliberate sense of the community should govern the conduct of those to whom they intrust the management of their affairs but it does not require an unqualified complaisance to every sudden breeze of passion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/356.mp3	or to every transient impulse which the people may receive from the arts of men who flatter their prejudices to betray their interests it is a just observation that the people commonly intend the public good
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/357.mp3	this often applies to their very errors but their good sense would despise the adulator who should pretend that they always reason right about the means of promoting it they know from experience that they sometimes err and the wonder is
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/358.mp3	that they so seldom err as they do beset as they continually are by the wiles of parasites and sycophants by the snares of the ambitious the avaricious the desperate by the artifices
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/359.mp3	of men who possess their confidence more than they deserve it and of those who seek to possess rather than to deserve it when occasions present themselves in which the interests of the people are at variance with their inclinations
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/360.mp3	in which a conduct of this kind has saved the people from very fatal consequences of their own mistakes and has procured lasting monuments of their gratitude to the men who had courage and magnanimity enough to serve them at the peril of their displeasure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/361.mp3	but however inclined we might be to insist upon an unbounded complaisance in the executive to the inclinations of the people we can with no propriety contend for a like complaisance to the humors of the legislature
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/362.mp3	the latter may sometimes stand in opposition to the former and at other times the people may be entirely neutral in either supposition it is certainly desirable that the executive should be in a situation to dare to act his own opinion with vigor and decision
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/363.mp3	the same rule which teaches the propriety of a partition between the various branches of power teaches us likewise that this partition ought to be so contrived as to render the one independent of the other
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/364.mp3	to what purpose separate the executive or the judiciary from the legislative if both the executive and the judiciary are so constituted as to be at the absolute devotion of the legislative such a separation must be merely nominal
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/365.mp3	and another to be dependent on the legislative body the first comports with the last violates the fundamental principles of good government and whatever may be the forms of the constitution unites all power in the same hands
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/366.mp3	the tendency of the legislative authority to absorb every other has been fully displayed and illustrated by examples in some preceding numbers in governments purely republican this tendency is almost irresistible the representatives of the people
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/367.mp3	they often appear disposed to exert an imperious control over the other departments and as they commonly have the people on their side
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/368.mp3	they always act with such momentum as to make it very difficult for the other members of the government to maintain the balance of the constitution it may perhaps be asked how the shortness of the duration in office
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/369.mp3	can affect the independence of the executive on the legislature unless the one were possessed of the power of appointing or displacing the other one answer to this inquiry may be drawn from the principle already remarked
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/370.mp3	though not more conclusive will result from the consideration of the influence of the legislative body over the people which might be employed to prevent the re election of a man who by an upright resistance to any sinister project of that body should have made himself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/371.mp3	obnoxious to its resentment it may be asked also whether a duration of four years would answer the end proposed and if it would not whether a less period which would at least be recommended by greater security against ambitious designs
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/372.mp3	would not for that reason be preferable to a longer period which was at the same time too short for the purpose of inspiring the desired firmness and independence of the magistrate it cannot be affirmed that a duration of four years or any other limited duration
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/373.mp3	there would always be a considerable interval in which the prospect of annihilation would be sufficiently remote not to have an improper effect upon the conduct of a man indued with a tolerable portion of fortitude
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/374.mp3	and in which he might reasonably promise himself that there would be time enough before it arrived to make the community sensible of the propriety of the measures he might incline to pursue though it be probable that as he approached the moment
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/375.mp3	of establishing himself in the esteem and good will of his constituents he might then hazard with safety in proportion to the proofs he had given of his wisdom and integrity and to the title he had acquired to the respect and attachment of his fellow citizens
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/376.mp3	as on the one hand a duration of four years will contribute to the firmness of the executive in a sufficient degree to render it a very valuable ingredient in the composition so on the other it is not enough to justify any alarm for the public liberty
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/377.mp3	if a british house of commons from the most feeble beginnings from the mere power of assenting or disagreeing to the imposition of a new tax
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/378.mp3	have by rapid strides reduced the prerogatives of the crown and the privileges of the nobility within the limits they conceived to be compatible with the principles of a free government while they raised themselves to the rank and consequence of a coequal branch of the legislature
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/379.mp3	all the ancient establishments as well in the church as state if they have been able on a recent occasion to make the monarch tremble at the prospect
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/380.mp3	what but that he might be unequal to the task which the constitution assigns him i shall only add that if his duration be such as to leave a doubt of his firmness that doubt is inconsistent with a jealousy of his encroachments
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/381.mp3	the mode of appointment of the chief magistrate of the united states is almost the only part of the system of any consequence which has escaped without severe censure or which has received the slightest mark of approbation from its opponents
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/382.mp3	the most plausible of these who has appeared in print
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/383.mp3	and hesitate not to affirm that if the manner of it be not perfect it is at least excellent
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/384.mp3	but to men chosen by the people for the special purpose and at the particular conjuncture it was equally desirable that the immediate election should be made by men most capable of analyzing the qualities adapted to the station
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/385.mp3	and acting under circumstances favorable to deliberation and to a judicious combination of all the reasons and inducements which were proper to govern their choice a small number of persons
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/386.mp3	selected by their fellow citizens from the general mass will be most likely to possess the information and discernment requisite to such complicated investigations
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/387.mp3	but the precautions which have been so happily concerted in the system under consideration promise an effectual security against this mischief the choice of several to form an intermediate body of electors
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/388.mp3	will be much less apt to convulse the community with any extraordinary or violent movements than the choice of one who was himself to be the final object of the public wishes and as the electors chosen in each state
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/389.mp3	are to assemble and vote in the state in which they are chosen this detached and divided situation will expose them much less to heats and ferments which might be communicated from them to the people than if they were all to be convened
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/390.mp3	at one time in one place nothing was more to be desired than that every practicable obstacle should be opposed to cabal intrigue and corruption
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/391.mp3	these most deadly adversaries of republican government might naturally have been expected to make their approaches from more than one quarter but chiefly from the desire in foreign powers to gain an improper ascendant in our councils
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/392.mp3	how could they better gratify this than by raising a creature of their own to the chief magistracy of the union but the convention have guarded against all danger of this sort with the most provident and judicious attention
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/393.mp3	they have not made the appointment of the president to depend on any preexisting bodies of men who might be tampered with beforehand to prostitute their votes but they have referred it in the first instance to an immediate act of the people of america
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/394.mp3	to be exerted in the choice of persons for the temporary and sole purpose of making the appointment and they have excluded from eligibility to this trust all those who from situation might be suspected of too great devotion to the president in office
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/395.mp3	no senator representative or other person holding a place of trust or profit under the united states can be of the numbers of the electors thus without corrupting the body of the people the immediate agents in the election
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/396.mp3	will at least enter upon the task free from any sinister bias their transient existence and their detached situation already taken notice of afford a satisfactory prospect of their continuing so to the conclusion of it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/397.mp3	the business of corruption when it is to embrace so considerable a number of men requires time as well as means nor would it be found easy suddenly to embark them dispersed as they would be over thirteen states
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/398.mp3	in any combinations founded upon motives which though they could not properly be denominated corrupt might yet be of a nature to mislead them from their duty
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/399.mp3	on all but the people themselves
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/400.mp3	this advantage will also be secured by making his re election to depend on a special body of representatives deputed by the society for the single purpose of making the important choice all these advantages will happily combine in the plan devised by the convention
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/401.mp3	which is that the people of each state shall choose a number of persons as electors equal to the number of senators and representatives of such state in the national government who shall assemble within the state and vote for some fit person as president
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/402.mp3	and the person who may happen to have a majority of the whole number of votes will be the president but as a majority of the votes might not always happen to centre in one man and as it might be unsafe to permit less than a majority to be conclusive
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/403.mp3	it is provided that in such a contingency the house of representatives shall select out of the candidates who shall have the five highest number of votes the man who in their opinion may be best qualified for the office
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/404.mp3	the process of election affords a moral certainty that the office of president will never fall to the lot of any man who is not in an eminent degree endowed with the requisite qualifications talents for low intrigue
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/405.mp3	and the little arts of popularity may alone suffice to elevate a man to the first honors in a single state but it will require other talents and a different kind of merit to establish him in the esteem and confidence of the whole union
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/406.mp3	or of so considerable a portion of it as would be necessary to make him a successful candidate for the distinguished office of president of the united states it will not be too strong to say that there will be a constant probability of seeing the station filled by characters
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/407.mp3	pre eminent for ability and virtue and this will be thought no inconsiderable recommendation of the constitution by those who are able to estimate the share which the executive in every government must necessarily have in its good or ill administration
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/408.mp3	though we cannot acquiesce in the political heresy of the poet who says for forms of government let fools contest that which is best administered is best yet we may safely pronounce
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/409.mp3	that the true test of a good government is its aptitude and tendency to produce a good administration the vice president is to be chosen in the same manner with the president with this difference that the senate is to do in respect to the former
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/410.mp3	what is to be done by the house of representatives in respect to the latter the appointment of an extraordinary person as vice president has been objected to as superfluous if not mischievous
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/411.mp3	the other consideration is that as the vice president may occasionally become a substitute for the president in the supreme executive magistracy all the reasons which recommend the mode of election prescribed for the one
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/412.mp3	apply with great if not with equal force to the manner of appointing the other it is remarkable that in this as in most other instances the objection which is made would lie against the constitution of this state we have a lieutenant governor
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/413.mp3	the council of buccaneers had lasted some time when one of them re entered the house and with a repetition of the same salute which had in my eyes an ironical air begged for a moment's loan of the torch silver briefly agreed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/414.mp3	and this emissary retired again leaving us together in the dark there's a breeze coming jim said silver who had by this time adopted quite a friendly and familiar tone i turned to the loophole nearest me and looked out
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/415.mp3	the embers of the great fire had so far burned themselves out and now glowed so low and duskily that i understood why these conspirators desired a torch about half way down the slope to the stockade they were collected in a group
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/416.mp3	one held the light another was on his knees in their midst and i saw the blade of an open knife shine in his hand with varying colours in the moon and torchlight
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/417.mp3	i could just make out that he had a book as well as a knife in his hand and was still wondering how anything so incongruous had come in their possession when the kneeling figure rose once more to his feet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/418.mp3	and the whole party began to move together towards the house here they come said i and i returned to my former position for it seemed beneath my dignity that they should find me watching them well let em come lad let em come
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/419.mp3	i've still a shot in my locker the door opened and the five men standing huddled together just inside pushed one of their number forward in any other circumstances it would have been comical to see his slow advance
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/420.mp3	hesitating as he set down each foot but holding his closed right hand in front of him step up lad cried silver i won't eat you
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/421.mp3	you'll all swing now i reckon what soft headed lubber had a bible it was dick said one dick was it then dick can get to prayers said silver
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/422.mp3	he's seen his slice of luck has dick and you may lay to that but here the long man with the yellow eyes struck in
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/423.mp3	well what is it anyway ah deposed' that's it is it very pretty wrote to be sure like print i swear your hand o write george

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/425.mp3	you're a funny man by your account but you're over now and you'll maybe step down off that barrel and help vote i thought you said you knowed the rules returned silver contemptuously
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/426.mp3	oh replied george you don't be under no kind of apprehension we're all square we are first you've made a hash of this cruise you'll be a bold man to say no to that second

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/540.mp3	revolves very slowly on its axis so that our world makes fifteen times as many revolutions as this planet it requires but little arithmetic to figure out that the people of brief do not see the sun rise very often
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/541.mp3	on this world of brief all vegetables mature in periods so short that one marvels when he hears it think of cereals reaching maturity in seven or eight of our days or during one day of brief
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/542.mp3	early in the morning certain crops are planted and are harvested at night two or more days are required for maturing other crops actually the people of brief raise their crops with less labor than is required amongst us
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/543.mp3	if you were permitted to look upon the public and private life of this incredible world your first sensation would be dizziness not to mention the weirdness of all sights that would confront you at every turn
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/544.mp3	and if by lease of strength they pass on toward an age of four years it is but an evidence of their exceptional vitality it seems to be true that the experiences of a long life of sixty or eighty years is crowded into a narrow compass of four years
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/545.mp3	there being no competition no time or space is required for sensational trash thus if nothing of importance occurs nothing need be transmitted the official news censors decide as to the relative importance of occurrences
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/546.mp3	there need not be a certain amount of news telegraphed each hour the government verifies as much as possible all reports before they are transmitted there are indeed some advantages in the government being in constant touch with each home under its care
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/547.mp3	the advertising department pays nearly all expenses of this whole system of journalism announcements for private gain are paid at a regular rate it costs more to advertise at certain periods than at other times
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/548.mp3	they never think of covering the feet under any change of climate if one of the briefites were to step upon the shores of our rugged earth and see the cotton or wool and leather that lies around our feet it would appear to him as the most ridiculous thing imaginable
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/549.mp3	neither the men women nor children seem to seek this means for self beautifying they seem to think that beauty of character has a radiance more to be desired than the flash of opals or the luster of silks their garments partake of the loose flowing order
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/550.mp3	for instance a strong fabric of chosen shade is fastened at the neck hip knee and ankle and lies carelessly over the parts between the females never graduated to the corset degree and while they do not cut a scientific figure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/551.mp3	transportation the methods of traveling are so contrary to our conceptions and practices that i almost forbear to attempt any description
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/552.mp3	when an exchange of seats is necessary it is all done so easily and so quickly that you would wonder why we tolerate trolley cars in traveling from city to city a system is in use that i will call the toboggan slide system
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/553.mp3	although the cars run on wheels the car is raised in a shaft about one hundred feet and then by gravity it dashes two or more miles according to the lay of the land traversed then another rise more or less than one hundred feet is experienced
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/554.mp3	and then another wild dash i have no words of praise for this system although the briefites can cover considerable territory in an hour they look upon this gravity system as a wonderful achievement for it has not been in operation for more than three hundred years
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/555.mp3	the power of steam has never been utilized no genius of all this active world of brief ever conceived the idea that almost unlimited power lies wrapped up in thin vapory water but they have discovered what we would call gaseous oil
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/556.mp3	and have learned to put it to work so that it is the main force employed in hoisting and all other purposes where power is required nothing like a traveling locomotive has ever been made although i learned that a bright wizard was experimenting
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/557.mp3	and that he prophesied great changes when his gas propelled vehicle was perfected think of how much value an ordinary citizen of our world would be to these briefites if he could step upon their world and communicate with them concerning the magic wonders of steam
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/558.mp3	and the manner of constructing stationary and movable engines to say nothing of the hidden wonders of electricity quadrupeds that take the place of our horses are used for drayage although nothing except the two wheeled class of vehicles was ever used until some eighty seven years ago
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/559.mp3	public highways these interesting people excel us in their style and manner of home building fencing and making public highways we are heathenish in our progress along the line of road making especially
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/560.mp3	in all my vast journey among the worlds i found only a few comparatively whereon the roads were inferior to ours in the world of brief the state prescribes the manner of public highways and each citizen must contribute his share to their creation and maintenance
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/561.mp3	very intricate and elaborate problems are solved by these people of a few years they are inferior to us in a hundred ways in the broad fields of manufacture and invention they lag a long distance in the rear this is principally due to their lack of time
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/562.mp3	religious life the religious life of the people of brief is on an average of a higher type than is found in our world their belief in immortality has run parallel with their existence as a people
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/563.mp3	the most faithful translation of this word into our language would be god affluence kerm cher or god breath appeared upon brief full grown
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/564.mp3	similar to christ he confirmed his identity by unanswerable miracles many however disbelieved in kerm cher and held to the old axiomatic truths thus creeds were prevalent and they remain until now
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/565.mp3	only there is much less variety than is found amongst us kerm cher set up a new reign and accepted a temporal throne for a season he finally announced that his ambassadorship would soon cease
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/566.mp3	and that his followers would lose the throne of civil power that they would be tested for a season in the valley of humiliation and by the fires of terrible persecution and that they who would endure unto the end would be glorified
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/567.mp3	moisture from the night's rain hung on the tree leaves clung in globules to rynch's sweating body he lay on a wide branch trying to control the heavy panting which supplied his laboring lungs
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/568.mp3	and he could still hear the echoes of the startled cries which had come from the men who had threaded through the woods to the up pointed tail fins of the l b now he tried to reason why he had run they were his own kind
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/569.mp3	they would take him out of the loneliness of a world heretofore empty of his species but that tall man the one who had led the party into the irregular clearing about the life boat rynch shivered
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/570.mp3	dug his nails into the wood on which he lay at the sight of that man dream and reality had crashed together sending him into panic stricken flight that was the man from the room
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/571.mp3	the man with the cup as his heart quieted he began to think more coherently first he had not been able to find the strong jaws's den
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/572.mp3	then the marks on the ground at the point from which he had fallen and the l b were here just as he remembered but not far from the small ship he had discovered something more a campsite with a shelter fashioned out of spalls and vines
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/573.mp3	to go back to the ship clearing was to risk capture but he had to know rynch looked with more attention at his present surroundings deep mold under the trees here would hold tracks there might just be another way to move
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/574.mp3	though it was balled in upon itself he was sure the creature was fully as large as he and the menacing claws suggested it was a formidable opponent when it made no move to follow him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/575.mp3	rynch began to hope it had only been defending its own hiding place for its present attitude suggested concealment still facing that featureless blob in the tree the man retreated alert for the first sign of advance on the part of the creature above
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/576.mp3	none came and he dared to slip around the bole of the tree under which he stood listening intently for any corresponding movement overhead now he was facing that survivor's camp
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/577.mp3	another object crouched in the dark of the lean to shelter just as its fellow was on sentry duty in the tree only this one did not have the self color of the foliage to disguise it four limbed its long forearms curved about its bent knees
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/578.mp3	and the sense organs of eyes and nose squeezed together on the lower quarter of the rounded portion with a line of wide mouth to split the blunt round of the muzzle dark pits for eyes showed no pupil iris or cornea
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/579.mp3	the nose was a black perfectly rounded tube jutting an inch or so beyond the cheek surface grotesque alien and terrifying it made no hostile move and since it had not turned its head he could not be sure it had even sighted him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/580.mp3	but it knew he was there he was certain of that and was waiting for what as the long seconds crawled by rynch began to believe that it was not waiting for him heartened he pulled at the vine loop
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/581.mp3	climbed back into the tree minutes later he discovered that there were more than two of the beasts waiting quietly about the camp and that their sentry line ran between him and the clearing of the l b he withdrew farther into the wood
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/582.mp3	intent upon finding a detour which would bring him out into the open lands now he wanted to join forces with his own kind whether those men were potential enemies or not as time passed the beasts closed about the clearing of the camp
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/583.mp3	afternoon was fading into evening when he reached a point several miles downstream near the river since he had come into the open he had not sighted any of the watchers he hoped they did not willingly venture out of the trees where the leaves were their protection
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/584.mp3	rynch went flat on the stream bank made a worm's progress up the slope to crouch behind a bush and survey the land immediately ahead there stood an off world spacer fins down nose skyward

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/586.mp3	rynch was curiously reluctant to do the sensible thing to rise out of concealment and walk up to that fire to claim rescue by his own kind the man he sought stood by the fire
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/587.mp3	shrugging his arms into a webbing harness which brought a box against his chest having made that fast he picked up a needler by its sling by their gestures the others were arguing with him but he shook his head came on
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/588.mp3	that idea made sense and in the meantime he would let the other past him follow along behind until he was far enough from the camp so that his friends could not interfere then they would have a meeting
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/589.mp3	in spite of his caution rynch was close to betrayal as he edged around a clump of vegetation growing half in half out of the stream only a timely rustle told him that the other had sat down on a drift log waiting for him rynch froze
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/590.mp3	so startled that he could not think clearly for a second then he noted that the outline of the other's body was visible growing brighter by the moment minute particles of pale greenish radiance were gathering about the other the dark shadow of an arm flapped the radiance swirled
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/591.mp3	but they no longer gathered in strength enough to light his presence now he could see they drifted about the vegetation about the log where the man sat about rocks and reeds only they were thicker about the stranger as if his body were a magnet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/592.mp3	he continued to keep them whirling by means of waving hand and arm but there was enough light to show rynch the fingers of his other hand busy on the front panel of the box he wore that fingering stopped then rynch's head came up as he heard a very faint sound
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/593.mp3	not a beast's cry or was it again those fingers moved on the panel was the other sending a message by that means rynch watched him check the webbing count the equipment at his belt settle the needler in the crook of his arm
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/594.mp3	however the other was as wary of that dark as if he suspected what might lie in wait there he angled along northward avoiding clumps of scattered brush keeping in the open where rynch dared not tail him too closely
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/595.mp3	their course parallel to the woods brought them at last to a second stream the size of a river into which the first creek emptied here the other settled down between two rocks with every indication of remaining there for a period
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/596.mp3	thankfully rynch found his own lurking place from which he could keep the other in sight the light points gathered hung in a small luminous cloud over the rocks but rynch had prudently withdrawn under a bush
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/597.mp3	and the scent of its aromatic leaves must have discouraged the sparks for no such crown came to his sentry post drugged with fatigue the younger man slept awaking to full day a fog of bewilderment
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/598.mp3	what was the purpose of the other's expedition was he going to use the open cut through which the river ran as a way of penetrating the wooded country now rynch considered the problem from his own angle the man from the spacer had made no effort to conceal his trail
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/599.mp3	in fact it would almost seem that he had deliberately gone out of his way to leave boot prints on favorable stretches of ground did he guess that rynch lurked behind was now leading him on for some purpose of his own

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/646.mp3	they had undergone a remarkable change since our arrival at the butcher's shop they now wandered about fat sleek and contented and their former voracity had completely disappeared
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/647.mp3	as regards ourselves a day or two longer made no difference our most important article of diet the pemmican was practically left untouched as for the time being dog had completely taken its place
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/648.mp3	there was thus no great sign of depression to be noticed when we came back into the tent after finishing our work and had to while away the time as i went in i could descry wisting a little way off kneeling on the ground
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/649.mp3	and engaged in the manufacture of cutlets the dogs stood in a ring round him and looked on with interest the north east wind whistled and howled the air was thick with driving snow and wisting was not to be envied
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/650.mp3	to whatever age i may live in the course of the night the wind had gone back to the north and increased to a gale it was blowing and snowing so that when we came out in the morning we could not see the sledges they were half snowed under
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/651.mp3	the temperature was not so very low
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/652.mp3	we had all taken a turn outside to look at the weather and were sitting on our sleeping bags discussing the poor prospect it's the devil's own weather here at the butcher's said one it looks to me as if it would never get any better
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/653.mp3	this is the fifth day and it's blowing worse than ever we all agreed there's nothing so bad as lying weather bound like this continued another it takes more out of you than going from morning to night personally i was of the same opinion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/654.mp3	one day may be pleasant enough but two three four
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/655.mp3	no it was awful shall we try it no sooner was the proposal submitted than it was accepted unanimously and with acclamation when i think of my four friends of the southern journey
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/656.mp3	it is the memory of that morning that comes first to my mind all the qualities that i most admire in a man were clearly shown at that juncture courage and dauntlessness without boasting or big words
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/657.mp3	amid joking and chaff everything was packed and then out into the blizzard it was practically impossible to keep one's eyes open the fine drift snow penetrated everywhere
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/658.mp3	the dogs were not much inclined to start and it took time to get them into their harness but at last we were ready one more glance over the camping ground to see that nothing we ought to have with us had been forgotten
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/659.mp3	which we now thought would not be required were left behind the last thing to be done was planting a broken ski upright by the side of the depot it was wisting who did this thinking presumably that an extra mark would do no harm
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/660.mp3	that it was a happy thought the future will show and then we were off it was a hard pull to begin with both for men and beasts as the high sastrugi continued towards the south
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/661.mp3	and made it extremely difficult to advance those who had sledges to drive had to be very attentive and support them so that they did not capsize on the big waves and we who had no sledges found great difficulty in keeping our feet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/662.mp3	as we had nothing to lean against we went on like this slowly enough but the main thing was that we made progress the ground at first gave one the impression of rising though not much the going was extremely heavy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/663.mp3	it was like dragging oneself through sand meanwhile the sastrugi grew smaller and smaller and finally they disappeared altogether and the surface became quite flat the going also improved by degrees
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/664.mp3	for what reason it is difficult to say as the storm continued unabated and the drift now combined with falling snow was thicker than ever it was all the driver could do to see his own dogs the surface
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/665.mp3	which had become perfectly level had the appearance at times of sinking in any case one would have thought so from the pace of the sledges now and again the dogs would set off suddenly at a gallop the wind aft no doubt helped the pace somewhat
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/666.mp3	but it alone could not account for the change i did not like this tendency of the ground to fall away in my opinion we ought to have done with anything of that sort after reaching the height at which we were a slight slope upward
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/667.mp3	possibly but down no that did not agree with my reckoning so far the incline had not been so great as to cause uneasiness but if it seriously began to go downhill we should have to stop and camp
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/668.mp3	would be madness we might risk falling into some chasm before we had time to pull up hanssen as usual was driving first strictly speaking i should now have been going in advance but the uneven surface at the start
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/669.mp3	and the rapid pace afterwards had made it impossible to walk as fast the dogs could pull i was therefore following by the side of wisting's sledge and chatting with him suddenly i saw hanssen's dogs shoot ahead
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/670.mp3	and downhill they went at the wildest pace wisting after them i shouted to hanssen to stop
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/671.mp3	by twisting his sledge the others who were following stopped when they came up to him we were in the middle of a fairly steep descent what there might be below was not easy to decide nor would we try to find out in that weather
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/672.mp3	we trampled down a place for the tent in the loose snow and soon got it up it was not a long day's march that we had done eleven and three quarter miles but we had put an end to our stay at the butcher's shop and that was a great thing
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/673.mp3	the boiling point test that evening showed that we were ten thousand three hundred feet above the sea and that we had thus gone down six hundred twenty feet from the butcher's we turned in and went to sleep as soon as it brightened
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/674.mp3	one has to seize every opportunity in these regions if one neglects to do so it may mean a long wait and much may be lost we therefore all slept with one eye open
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/675.mp3	and we knew well that nothing could happen without our noticing it at three in the morning the sun cut through the clouds and we through the tent door to take in the situation was more than the work of a moment
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/676.mp3	the sun showed as yet like a pat of butter and had not succeeded in dispersing the thick mists the wind had dropped somewhat but was still fairly strong this is after all the worst part of one's job
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/677.mp3	turning out of one's good warm sleeping bag and standing outside for some time in thin clothes watching the weather we knew by experience that a gleam like this a clearing in the weather might come suddenly and then one had to be on the spot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/678.mp3	the gleam came it did not last long but long enough we lay on the side of a ridge that fell away pretty steeply the descent on the south was too abrupt but on the south east it was better and more gradual
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/679.mp3	and ended in a wide level tract we could see no crevasses or unpleasantness of any kind it was not very far that we could see though only our nearest surroundings of the mountains we saw nothing
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/680.mp3	had now broken loose again and the north easter was doing all it could
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/681.mp3	since we had discovered the nature of our immediate surroundings if we once got down to the plain we knew that we could always feel our way on after putting ample brakes on the sledge runners
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/682.mp3	we started off downhill in a south easterly direction the slight idea of the position that we had been able to get in the morning proved correct the descent was easy and smooth and we reached the plain without any adventure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/683.mp3	we could now once more set our faces to the south and in thick driving snow we continued our way into the unknown with good assistance from the howling north easterly gale we now recommenced the erection of beacons
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/684.mp3	which had not been necessary during the ascent
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/685.mp3	the last of them that we encountered the surface was now fine enough smooth as a floor and without a sign of sastrugi if our progress was nevertheless slow and difficult this was due to the wretched going
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/686.mp3	which was real torture to all of us a sledge journey through the sahara could not have offered a worse surface to move over
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/687.mp3	the weather improved in the course of the day and when we camped in the afternoon it looked quite smiling the sun came through and gave a delightful warmth after the last few bitter days it was not yet clear
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/688.mp3	so that we could see nothing of our surroundings the distance according to our three sledge meters was eighteen and a half miles taking the bad going into consideration we had reason to be well satisfied with it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/689.mp3	our altitude came out at nine thousand four hundred seventy five feet above the sea or a drop of eight hundred twenty five feet in the course of the day this surprised me greatly what did it mean
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/690.mp3	instead of rising gradually we were going slowly down

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/692.mp3	the night was filled with sharp gusts from the north the morning came with a slack wind but accompanied by mist and snowfall this was abominable here we were advancing over absolutely virgin ground and able to see nothing
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/693.mp3	the surface remained about the same possibly rather more undulating that it had been blowing here at some time and violently too was shown by the under surface which was composed of sastrugi as hard as iron
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/694.mp3	luckily for us the snowfall of the last few days had filled these up so as to present a level surface it was heavy going though better than on the previous day as we were advancing still blindly
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/695.mp3	and fretting at the persistently thick weather one of us suddenly called out hullo look there a wild dark summit rose high out of the mass of fog to the east south east it was not far away
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/696.mp3	on the contrary it seemed threateningly near and right over us we stopped and looked at the imposing sight but nature did not expose her objects of interest for long the fog rolled over again thick heavy and dark
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/697.mp3	and blotted out the view we knew now that we had to be prepared for surprises after we had gone about ten miles the fog again lifted for a moment and we saw quite near a mile or so away
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/698.mp3	two long narrow mountain ridges to the west of us running north and south and completely covered with snow these
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/699.mp3	they were between nine thousand and ten thousand feet high and would probably serve as excellent landmarks on the return journey there was no connection to be traced between these mountains and those lying to the east of them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/700.mp3	they gave us the impression of being entirely isolated summits as we could not make out any lofty ridge running east and west
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/701.mp3	we continued our course in the constant expectation of finding some surprise or other in our line of route the air ahead of us was as black as pitch as though it concealed something
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/702.mp3	it could not be a storm or it would have been already upon us but we went on and on and nothing came our day's march was eighteen and a half miles i see that my diary for november twenty eighth
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/703.mp3	does not begin very promisingly fog fog and again fog also fine falling snow which makes the going impossible poor beasts they have toiled hard to get the sledges forward to day
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/704.mp3	but the day did not turn out so badly after all as we worked our way out of this uncertainty and found out what was behind the pitch dark clouds during the forenoon the sun came through and thrust aside the fog for a while and there
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/705.mp3	to the south east not many miles away lay an immense mountain mass from this mass right across our course ran a great ancient glacier the sun shone down upon it and showed us a surface full of huge irregularities
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/706.mp3	on the side nearest to the mountain these disturbances were such that a hasty glance was enough to show us the impossibility of advancing that way but right in our line of route straight on to the glacier
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/707.mp3	and waited for decently clear weather so that we might survey the ground at our ease and choose the best way going forward without an idea of what the ground was like was not very pleasant
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/708.mp3	but how long should we have to wait for clear weather that question was unanswerable possibly a week or even a fortnight and we had no time for that better go straight on then and take what might come
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/709.mp3	what we could see of the glacier appeared to be pretty steep but it was only between the south and south east under the new land that the fog now and again lifted sufficiently to enable us to see anything

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/712.mp3	as hard as glass in a short time an immense erection of adamantine blocks of snow rose into the air containing provisions for five men for six days and for eighteen dogs for five days
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/713.mp3	a number of small articles were also left behind while we were thus occupied the fog had been coming and going some of the intervals had been quite clear and had given me a good view of the nearest part of the range
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/714.mp3	it appeared to be quite isolated and to consist of four mountains one of these mount helmer hanssen lay separated from the rest the other three mounts oscar wisting

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/716.mp3	and the summits of a colossal mountain mass appeared our first impression was that this mountain mount thorvald nilsen must be something over twenty thousand feet high it positively took our breath away

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/718.mp3	they were not very grand but better ones were not to be obtained for that matter the site of the depot was so well marked by its position under the foot of the glacier that we agreed it would be impossible to miss it

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/722.mp3	and a fine light snow was falling we had taken a bearing of the line of glacier that was most free of crevasses and so we moved on again
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/723.mp3	the crevasses at its foot were not large but we had no sooner entered upon the ascent than the fun began there was something uncanny about this perfectly blind advance among crevasses and chasms on all sides
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/724.mp3	we examined the compass from time to time and went forward cautiously
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/725.mp3	but that after all was not much of a help to our drivers

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/727.mp3	to have to cross such a surface as the effect of light and shade is usually to show up the edges of these insidious pitfalls but on a day like this when everything looked alike one's advance is doubtful we kept it going however
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/728.mp3	by using the utmost caution wisting came near to sounding the depth of one of these dangerous crevasses with sledge dogs and all as the bridge he was about to cross gave way thanks to his presence of mind
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/729.mp3	and a lightning like movement some would call it luck he managed to save himself in this way we worked up about two hundred feet but then we came upon such a labyrinth of yawning chasms and open abysses
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/730.mp3	that we could not move there was nothing to be done but to find the least disturbed spot and set the tent there as soon as this was done hanssen and i set out to explore we were roped and therefore safe enough

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/732.mp3	in all directions and evoked a picture of violent confusion thank god we were not here while this was going on i thought to myself as i stood looking out over this battlefield it must have been a spectacle like doomsday
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/733.mp3	and not on a small scale either to advance in that direction then was hopeless but that was no great matter since our way was to the south on the south we could see nothing the fog lay thick and heavy there
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/734.mp3	this ridge led us on to an icewave about twenty five feet high a formation which was due to the pressure having ceased before the wave had been forced to break and form hummocks
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/735.mp3	we saw well enough that this would be a difficult place to pass with sledges and dogs but in default of anything better it would have to be done from the top of this wave formation we could see down on the other side
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/736.mp3	which had hitherto been hidden from us the fog prevented our seeing far but the immediate surroundings were enough to convince us that with caution we could beat up farther from the height on which we stood
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/737.mp3	as we saw absolutely nothing our object was to make tracks for the following day's journey the language we used about the glacier as we went was not altogether complimentary we had endless tacking and turning to get on
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/738.mp3	a fissure had opened making a gateway about six feet wide this formation like every thing else on the glacier was obviously very old and for the most part filled with snow

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/742.mp3	and this idea did not arouse any particular enthusiasm in my diary i see that i conclude the day with the following words what will the next surprise be i wonder it was in fact
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/743.mp3	an extraordinary journey that we were undertaking through new regions new mountains glaciers and so on without being able to see
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/744.mp3	what i liked least about this feeling one's way forward in the dark was that it would be difficult very difficult indeed to recognize the ground again on the way back but with this glacier lying straight across our line of route
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/745.mp3	a mistake there might be serious enough and it will appear later in this narrative that my fear of our not being able to recognize the way was not entirely groundless the beacons we had put up came to our aid
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/746.mp3	and for our final success we owe a deep debt of gratitude to our prudence and thoughtfulness in adopting this expedient next morning november twenty ninth brought considerably clearer weather
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/747.mp3	and allowed us a very good survey of our position we could now see that the two mountain ranges
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/748.mp3	with summits from ten thousand to fifteen thousand feet mount thorvald nilsen was the most southerly we could see from this point mounts hanssen wisting bjaaland and hassel formed as we had thought the day before
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/749.mp3	a group by themselves and lay separated from the main range the drivers had a warm morning's work they had to drive with great circumspection and patience to grapple with the kind of ground we had before us
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/750.mp3	a slight mistake might be enough to send both sledge and dogs with lightning rapidity into the next world it took nevertheless a remarkably short time to cover the distance we had explored on the previous evening before we knew it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/751.mp3	we were at hell's gate bjaaland took an excellent photograph here which gives a very good idea of the difficulties this part of the journey presented in the foreground
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/752.mp3	below the high snow ridge that forms one side of a very wide but partly filled up crevasse the marks of ski can be seen in the snow this was the photographer who in passing over this snow bridge
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/753.mp3	struck his ski into it to try the strength of the support close to the tracks can be seen an open piece of the crevasse it is a pale blue at the top but ends in the deepest black in a bottomless abyss
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/754.mp3	the photographer got over the bridge and back with a whole skin but there could be no question of risking sledges and dogs on it and it can be seen in the photograph that the sledges have been turned right round to try another way
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/755.mp3	but taking into account all the turns and circuits we had been compelled to make it was not so short after all we set our tent on a good solid foundation and were well pleased with the day's work
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/756.mp3	the altitude was eight thousand nine hundred sixty feet above the sea the sun was now in the west and shining directly upon the huge mountain masses it was a fairy landscape in blue and white
