https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1306.mp3	they should not be complete rest or complete change of life for any length of time but a continuation of the life for which adjustment has been learned with a reasonable reduction of the demands and stimulations
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1307.mp3	the intellectual worker ought to decrease his work the overbusy society woman ought to stay in bed one day in the week the man in the midst of the rush of life ought to cut down his obligations
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1308.mp3	but probably each of them does better to go on than simply to swear off altogether their rest ought to have the character of vacation that means interruptions without the usual activity ought to be short periods spent with the distinct feeling
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1309.mp3	that they are interruptions of that which must last and that they are not themselves to become lasting states
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1310.mp3	strenuosity must not mean an external rush with the gestures of overbusy excitement but certainly the doctrine of the lazy life is wretched psychotherapy as long as no serious illness is in question
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1311.mp3	by far the best alteration is therefore even in the periods of interruption not simply rest but new engagements which awaken new interests and stimulate neglected mental factors disburdening the over strained elements of mental life
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1312.mp3	the most effective agency for this task is contact with beauty beauty in nature and life beauty in art and literature and music
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1313.mp3	to enjoy a landscape ought to be not merely a negative rest for the man of the office building and good literature or music absorbs the mental energies and harmonizes them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1314.mp3	in the second place come games and sport which may enter into their right if fatigue can be avoided harmonious joyful company as different as possible from the depressing company of the sanitariums will add its pleasantness
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1315.mp3	while the advice of the physician ought thus to emphasize the positive elements which work not towards rest but toward a harmonious mental activity we must not forget some essential negative prescriptions
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1316.mp3	everything is to be avoided which interferes with the night's sleep
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1317.mp3	chapter thirteen the boomerang the lawn fete was a tremendous success and every farmer's wife was proud of her satin badge bearing the monogram w p l and the words
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1318.mp3	forbes for representative certain edibles such as charlotte russe spanish cream wine jellies and mousses to say nothing of the caviars and anchovies were wholly unknown to them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1319.mp3	but they ate the dainties with a wise disregard of their inexperience and enjoyed them immensely the old butler was a general in his way and in view of the fact that the staff of servants at elmhurst
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1320.mp3	was insufficient to cope with such a throng he allowed louise to impress several farmers daughters into service and was able to feed everyone without delay and in an abundant and satisfactory manner
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1321.mp3	after luncheon began the speech making interspersed with music by the band louise made the preliminary address and although her voice was not very strong
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1322.mp3	the silent attention of her hearers permitted her to be generally understood she called attention to the fact that this campaign was important because it promised more beautiful and attractive houses for the farmers and townsmen alike
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1323.mp3	we had all grown so accustomed to advertising signs she said that we failed to notice how thick they were becoming or how bold and overpowering from a few scattered announcements on fence boards
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1324.mp3	they had crowded themselves into more prominent places until the barns and sheds and the very rocks were daubed with glaring letters asking us to buy the medicines soaps tobaccos and other wares the manufacturers were anxious to sell
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1325.mp3	every country road became an advertising avenue scarcely a country house was free from signs of some sort yet the people tamely submitted to this imposition because they knew no way to avoid it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1326.mp3	when mister forbes began his campaign to restore the homesteads to their former beauty and dignity a cry was raised against him but this was because the farmers did not understand how much this reform meant to them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1327.mp3	so we gave them an object lesson we painted out all the signs in this section at our own expense that you might see how much more beautiful your homes are without them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1328.mp3	we believe that none of you will ever care to allow advertising signs on your property again and that the quiet refinement of this part of the country will induce many other places to follow our example
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1329.mp3	until advertisers are forced to confine themselves to newspapers magazines and circulars their only legitimate channels this much mister forbes has already done for you and he will now tell you what else if he is elected

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1524.mp3	and shone full on the face of the dying prince the water was up to his neck will you kiss me princess said he feebly the nonchalance was all gone now
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1525.mp3	yes i will answered the princess and kissed him with a long sweet cold kiss now said he with a sigh of content i die happy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1526.mp3	he did not speak again the princess gave him some wine for the last time he was past eating then she sat down again and looked at him the water rose and rose
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1527.mp3	it touched his chin it touched his lower lip it touched between his lips he shut them hard to keep it out the princess began to feel strange it touched his upper lip
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1528.mp3	he breathed through his nostrils the princess looked wild it covered his nostrils her eyes looked scared and shone strange in the moonlight his head fell back the water closed over it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1529.mp3	and the bubbles of his last breath bubbled up through the water the princess gave a shriek and sprang into the lake she laid hold first of one leg and then of the other and pulled and tugged but she could not move either she stopped to take breath
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1530.mp3	and that made her think that he could not get any breath she was frantic she got hold of him and held his head above the water which was possible now his hands were no longer on the hole but it was of no use for he was past breathing
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1531.mp3	love and water brought back all her strength she got under the water and pulled and pulled with her whole might till at last she got one leg out the other easily followed how she got him into the boat she never could tell
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1532.mp3	but when she did she fainted away coming to herself she seized the oars kept herself steady as best she could and rowed and rowed though she had never rowed before round rocks and over shallows and through mud she rowed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1533.mp3	till she got to the landing stairs of the palace by this time her people were on the shore for they had heard her shriek she made them carry the prince to her own room and lay him in her bed and light a fire and send for the doctors
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1534.mp3	but the lake your highness said the chamberlain who roused by the noise came in in his nightcap go and drown yourself in it she said this was the last rudeness of which the princess was ever guilty
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1535.mp3	and one must allow that she had good cause to feel provoked with the lord chamberlain had it been the king himself he would have fared no better but both he and the queen were fast asleep and the chamberlain went back to his bed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1536.mp3	somehow the doctors never came so the princess and her old nurse were left with the prince but the old nurse was a wise woman and knew what to do they tried everything for a long time without success
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1537.mp3	the princess was nearly distracted between hope and fear but she tried on and on one thing after another and everything over and over again at last when they had all but given it up just as the sun rose

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1632.mp3	to sin and misery i'm not deceiving you adam said mister irwine arthur donnithorne is not come back was not come back when i left i have left a letter for him he will know
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1633.mp3	he will know he will suffer long and bitterly he has a heart and a conscience i can't be entirely deceived in his character i am convinced
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1634.mp3	he may be weak but he is not callous not coldly selfish i am persuaded
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1635.mp3	all his life why do you crave vengeance in this way no amount of torture that you could inflict on him could benefit her no o god no adam groaned out sinking on his chair again
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1636.mp3	but then that's the deepest curse of all that's what makes the blackness of it it can never be undone my poor hetty she can never be my sweet hetty again the prettiest thing god had made
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1637.mp3	smiling up at me i thought she loved me and was good adam's voice had been gradually sinking into a hoarse undertone as if he were only talking to himself but now he said abruptly looking at mister irwine
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1638.mp3	but she isn't as guilty as they say you don't think she is sir she can't ha done it that perhaps can never be known with certainty adam mister irwine answered gently
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1639.mp3	in these cases we sometimes form our judgment on what seems to us strong evidence and yet for want of knowing some small fact our judgment is wrong but suppose the worst you have no right to say
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1640.mp3	that the guilt of her crime lies with him and that he ought to bear the punishment it is not for us men to apportion the shares of moral guilt and retribution we find it impossible to avoid mistakes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1641.mp3	even in determining who has committed a single criminal act and the problem
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1642.mp3	you have a mind that can understand this fully adam when you are calm don't suppose i can't enter into the anguish that drives you into this state of revengeful hatred but
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1643.mp3	for it is passion and you deceive yourself in calling it justice it might be with you precisely as it has been with arthur nay worse your passion might lead you yourself into a horrible crime
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1644.mp3	no not worse said adam bitterly i don't believe it's worse i'd sooner do it i'd sooner do a wickedness as i could suffer for by myself than ha brought her to do wickedness
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1645.mp3	and then stand by and see em punish her while they let me alone and all for a bit o pleasure as if he'd had a man's heart in him he'd ha cut his hand off sooner than he'd ha taken it what if he didn't foresee what's happened
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1646.mp3	he foresaw enough he'd no right to expect anything but harm and shame to her
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1647.mp3	not half so hateful as that let a man do what he will if he knows he's to bear the punishment himself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1648.mp3	and knows all the while the punishment ll fall on somebody else there again you partly deceive yourself adam there is no sort of wrong deed of which a man can bear the punishment alone you can't isolate yourself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1649.mp3	i feel the terrible extent of suffering this sin of arthur's has caused to others but so does every sin cause suffering to others besides those who commit it an act of vengeance on your part against arthur would simply be another evil
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1650.mp3	added to those we are suffering under you could not bear the punishment alone you would entail the worst sorrows on every one who loves you you would have committed an act of blind fury that would leave all the present evils just as they were
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1651.mp3	as long as you do not see that to fix your mind on arthur's punishment is revenge and not justice you are in danger of being led on to the commission of some great wrong remember what you told me about your feelings
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1652.mp3	after you had given that blow to arthur in the grove adam was silent the last words had called up a vivid image of the past and mister irwine left him to his thoughts
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1653.mp3	while he spoke to bartle massey about old mister donnithorne's funeral and other matters of an indifferent kind but at length adam turned round and said in a more subdued tone
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1654.mp3	is dinah morris come to em sir seth said they'd sent for her no mister poyser tells me she was not come when he left they're afraid the letter has not reached her

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1658.mp3	you never saw her sir did you yes i did i had a conversation with her she pleased me a good deal and now you mention it i wish she would come for it is possible that a gentle mild woman like her
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1659.mp3	if i'd thought of it earlier i would have taken some measures for finding her out said mister irwine but it's too late now i fear well adam i must go now try to get some rest to night
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1660.mp3	there was great rejoicing in the little village in the pond when brownie beaver returned with the good news that there would be no more hunting and fishing and when old grandaddy beaver said that everybody ought to take a holiday to celebrate the occasion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1661.mp3	all the villagers said it was a fine idea so they stopped working for once and began to plan the celebration they thought that there ought to be swimming races and tree felling contests
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1662.mp3	and brownie beaver said that after the holiday was over he would suggest that someone be chosen to go down and thank farmer green for putting the notice on the tree the whole village agreed to brownie's proposal
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1663.mp3	brownie beaver himself passed his hat around to take up the votes and it was quickly found that every vote was for brownie beaver he had even voted for himself but no one seemed to care about that
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1664.mp3	and another in which each person who took part had to stay beneath the surface as long as he could that last race caused some trouble a young scamp called slippery sam won it and many people thought that he had swum up inside his house
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1665.mp3	where he could get air without being seen but no one could prove it so he won the race just the same next came the tree felling contest there were six including brownie beaver that took part in it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1666.mp3	grandaddy beaver had picked out six trees of exactly the same size each person in the contest had to try to bring his tree to the ground first and that caused some trouble too because some claimed that their trees were of harder wood than others
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1667.mp3	and more difficult to gnaw while others complained that the bark of their trees tasted very bitter and of course that made their task unpleasant those six trees falling one after another made such a racket
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1668.mp3	that old mister crow heard the noise miles away and flew over to see what was happening after everybody crept out of his hiding place some time afterward everyone had to hide for a while you know

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1670.mp3	then they told him about the celebration and mister crow began to laugh what are you going to do next he asked we're a going to send brownie beaver over to pleasant valley
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1671.mp3	to thank farmer green for his kindness in putting an end to hunting and fishing said old grandaddy beaver and he's a going to start right away mister crow looked around and there was brownie beaver

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1685.mp3	walker had already advertised in the new orleans papers that he would be there at a stated time with a prime lot of able bodied slaves ready for field service together with a few extra ones between the ages of fifteen and twenty five

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1703.mp3	and everything indicated that a steamboat race was at hand nothing can exceed the excitement attendant upon a steamboat race on the mississippi river by the time the boats had reached memphis they were side by side
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1704.mp3	and each exerting itself to keep the ascendancy in point of speed the night was clear the moon shining brightly and the boats so near to each other that the passengers were calling out from one boat to the other
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1705.mp3	on board the patriot the firemen were using oil lard butter and even bacon with the wood for the purpose of raising the steam to its highest pitch the blaze mingled with the black smoke showed plainly that the other boat was burning more than wood
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1706.mp3	the two boats soon locked so that the hands of the boats were passing from vessel to vessel and the wildest excitement prevailed throughout amongst both passengers and crew

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1735.mp3	forgetful of our own slave trade the ocean pirate's fiend like form shall sink beneath the vengeance storm his heart of steel shall quake before the battle din and havoc roar
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1736.mp3	the knave shall die the law hath said while it protects our own slave trade what earthly eye presumes to scan the wily proteus heart of man what potent hand will e'er unroll
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1737.mp3	the mantled treachery of his soul o where is he who hath surveyed the horrors of our own slave trade there is an eye that wakes in light there is a hand of peerless might which soon or late
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1738.mp3	shall yet assail and rend dissimulation's veil
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1739.mp3	after mister crow flew back to pleasant valley to gather news for him brownie beaver carefully counted each day that passed since mister crow had agreed to be his newspaper and come each saturday afternoon to tell him everything that had happened during the week
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1740.mp3	brownie was in a great hurry for saturday to arrive in order to make no mistake he put aside a stick in which he gnawed a notch each day and in that way he knew exactly when saturday came
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1741.mp3	that was probably the longest day in brownie beaver's life at least it seemed so to him whenever he saw a bird soaring above the tree tops he couldn't help hoping it was mister crow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1742.mp3	brownie beaver dropped whatever he happened to be doing expecting that mister crow would flap into sight at any moment brownie had many disappointments but mister crow really came at last
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1743.mp3	he lighted right on top of brownie beaver's house and called paper down the chimney just like that brownie happened to be inside his house and in a wonderfully short time his head appeared
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1744.mp3	above the water and he soon crawled up beside mister crow well i am glad to see you he told mister crow peter mink caught a monstrous eel in the duck pond on monday mister crow said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1745.mp3	being a newspaper he thought he ought to say nothing except what was news not even good afternoon mister rabbit of pine ridge with his wife and fourteen children is visiting his brother mister jeremiah rabbit
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1746.mp3	mister crow continued to relate in a singsong voice goodness gracious brownie beaver exclaimed fatty coon mister crow said fatty coon was confined to his house by illness tuesday night
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1747.mp3	he ate too many dried apples well well brownie beaver murmured and he started to ask mister crow a question but mister crow interrupted him with more news
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1748.mp3	missus bear had a birthday on wednesday an enjoyable time was had by all except the pig pig brownie beaver asked what pig the pig they ate said mister crow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1749.mp3	and he went right on talking on thursday mister woodchuck went to visit his cousins in the west missus woodchuck is worried what's she worried about brownie inquired she's afraid he's coming back again
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1750.mp3	mister crow explained i have heard he was lazy brownie said what happened on friday tommy fox made a visit but he didn't have a good time at all mister crow reported
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1751.mp3	and he left faster than he came brownie beaver wanted to know where tommy fox made his visit at farmer green's hen house mister crow explained why did he hurry away brownie asked
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1752.mp3	old dog spot chased him mister crow replied but you mustn't ask questions he complained you can't ask questions of a newspaper you know well what happened on saturday
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1753.mp3	another question i declare i don't believe you ever took a newspaper before did you brownie beaver admitted that he never had then said mister crow then don't interrupt me again please
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1754.mp3	i'll tell you all the news i've brought and when i've finished i'll stop being a newspaper and be myself for a while and then we can talk but not before he insisted brownie beaver nodded his head
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1755.mp3	he was afraid that if he said another word mister crow would grow angry and fly away without telling him any more news
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1756.mp3	jimmy rabbit almost cut off frisky squirrel's tail mister crow paused and looked at brownie beaver out of the corner of his eye he knew that brownie would want to know what prevented the accident but he was in no hurry to tell him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1757.mp3	for a few moments brownie waited to hear the rest but a few moments was more than he could endure why didn't jimmy cut off his tail brownie asked eagerly there said mister crow you've done just as i told you not to
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1758.mp3	so i shall not tell you the rest until next saturday you see you have a few things to learn about taking a newspaper
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1759.mp3	was not the only village to be seen from blue mountain there was another which farmer green seldom visited because it lay beyond the mountain and was a long distance from his house though he owned the land where it stood
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1760.mp3	those that lived there thought they had every right to stay there as long as they pleased without being disturbed it was in this village that brownie beaver and his neighbors lived it was a different sort of town too
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1761.mp3	from the one where farmer green went each week over beyond blue mountain all the houses were built in a pond and all their doors were under water but nobody minded that because like brownie beaver
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1762.mp3	everybody that dwelt there was a fine swimmer years and years before brownie's time his forefathers had come there and finding that there were many trees in the neighborhood with the sort of bark they liked to eat
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1763.mp3	such as poplars willows and box elders they had decided that it was a good place to live there was a small stream too which was really the beginning of swift river
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1764.mp3	and by damming it those old settlers made a pond in which they could build their houses they had ideas of their own as to what a house should be like
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1765.mp3	though you perhaps might not care for them at all they wanted their houses to be surrounded by water because they thought they were safer when built in that manner and they always insisted that a door leading into a house
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1766.mp3	should be far beneath the surface of the water for they believed that that made a house safer too to you such an idea may seem very strange but if you were chased by an enemy you might be glad to be able to swim under water
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1767.mp3	down to the bottom of a pond and slip inside a door which led to a winding hall
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1768.mp3	of course your enemy might be able to swim as well as you but maybe he would think twice or even three times before he went prowling through your crooked hall for if you had enormous strong sharp teeth
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1769.mp3	with which you could gnaw right through a tree he would not care to have you seize him as he poked his head around a corner in a dark passage of a strange house it was in a house of that kind that brownie beaver lived
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1770.mp3	and he built it himself because he said he would rather have a neat new house than one of the big old dwellings that had been built many years before when his great great grandfather had helped throw the dam across the stream the dam was there still
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1771.mp3	it was so old that trees were growing on it and there was an odd thing about it it was never finished though brownie beaver was a young chap he worked on the dam sometimes like all his neighbors
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1772.mp3	you see the villagers kept making the dam wider and since it was built of sticks and mud the water sometimes washed bits of it away so it had to be kept in repair if brownie beaver and his friends had neglected their dam
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1773.mp3	and without any water to hide their doorways they would have been safe no longer they would have had no place either to store their winter's food for they were in the habit of cutting down trees and saving the bark and branches too
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1774.mp3	in order to have plenty to eat when cold weather came and the ice closed their pond some of their food they carried into their houses through a straight hall which was made for that very purpose
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1775.mp3	and some of the branches they fastened under water near the dam it was just like putting green things into a refrigerator so they will keep now you see why brownie beaver would no more have thought of building his house on dry land
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1776.mp3	than you would think of building one in a pond everybody likes his own way best and it never once occurred to brownie beaver that his way was the least bit strange
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1777.mp3	and their mother was leda who after the twin brothers had another child born to her helen for whose sake the sons of many of jason's friends were to wage war against the great city of troy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1778.mp3	in quest of the golden fleece and then there came one who had both welcome and reverence from jason this one came without spear or bow bearing in his hands a lyre only he was orpheus
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1779.mp3	and he knew all the ways of the gods and all the stories of the gods when he sang to his lyre the trees would listen and the beasts would follow him

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1782.mp3	two who were famous for their hunting no two could be more different than these two were the first was arcas he was dressed in the skin of a bear he had red hair and savage looking eyes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1783.mp3	and for arms he carried a mighty bow with bronze tipped arrows the folk were watching an eagle as he came into the city an eagle that was winging its way far far up in the sky arcas drew his bow and with one arrow he brought the eagle down
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1784.mp3	and then he was the oldest of the heroes in the camp of agamemnon two brothers came who were to be special friends of jason's peleus and telamon both were still youthful and neither had yet achieved any notable deed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1785.mp3	another who came was admetus afterward he became a famous king the god apollo once made himself a shepherd and he kept the flocks of king admetus and there came two brothers twins who were a wonder to all who beheld them

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1809.mp3	looking at the man attentively recognized him as a retainer whom he had had in his employ the year before and said this is a curious meeting pray what have you been about since you left my service at any rate

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1811.mp3	i am living in a poor and humble house but if your lordship at your leisure would honour me with a visit well it's a lucky chance that has brought us together and i certainly will go and see you besides i want you to do something for me

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1813.mp3	i will take my leave for to night good night then we shall meet the day after to morrow and so the two parted and went their several ways to rest on the appointed day genzaburo made his preparations and went in disguise without any retainers
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1814.mp3	to call upon sazen who met him at the porch of his house and said this is a great honour my lord genzaburo is indeed welcome my house is very mean but let me invite your lordship to come into an inner chamber
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1815.mp3	pray replied genzaburo don't make any ceremony for me don't put yourself to any trouble on my account and so he passed in and sazen called to his wife to prepare wine and condiments and they began to feast
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1816.mp3	at last genzaburo looking sazen in the face said there is a service which i want you to render me a very secret service but as if you were to refuse me i should be put to shame before i tell you what that service is

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1819.mp3	and so genzaburo drew a lamentable picture of his state of despair sazen listened patiently to his story and after reflecting for a while replied well sir it's not a difficult matter to set right
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1820.mp3	when genzaburo heard this he felt greatly relieved and recommending sazen to do his best in the matter took his leave and returned home that very night sazen after thinking over all that genzaburo had told him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1821.mp3	laid his plans accordingly and went off to the house of kihachi the eta chief and told him the commission with which he had been entrusted kihachi was of course greatly astonished and said some time ago sir chokichi came here

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1823.mp3	so when chokichi came and told me the errand upon which he had been sent i had no alternative but to announce to my daughter that she must give up all thought of his lordship since that time she has been fretting and pining and starving for love

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1826.mp3	it is chokichi who has been throwing obstacles in the way at last his lordship has secretly sent a man called kaji sazen a fortune teller to arrange an interview between you so now my child you may cheer up
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1827.mp3	and go to meet your lover as soon as you please when o koyo heard this she was so happy that she thought it must all be a dream and doubted her own senses kihachi in the meanwhile rejoined sazen in the other room and

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1831.mp3	she recovered her spirits at once and saying that she would go with sazen immediately joyfully made her preparations then sazen having once more warned kihachi to keep the matter secret from chokichi and to act upon the letter which he should send him

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1833.mp3	said to himself that it was no wonder that genzaburo had fallen in love with her then as it was getting late he advised her to go to rest and after showing her to her apartments went to his own room and wrote his letter to kihachi
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1834.mp3	containing the scheme which he had devised when kihachi received his instructions he was filled with admiration at sazen's ingenuity and putting on an appearance of great alarm and agitation
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1835.mp3	went off immediately to call on chokichi and said to him oh master chokichi such a terrible thing has happened pray let me tell you all about it indeed what can it be oh sir answered kihachi
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1836.mp3	pretending to wipe away his tears my daughter o koyo mourning over her separation from my lord genzaburo at first refused all sustenance and remained nursing her sorrows until last night her woman's heart failing to bear up against her great grief
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1837.mp3	she drowned herself in the river leaving behind her a paper on which she had written her intention when chokichi heard this he was thunderstruck and exclaimed can this really be true and when i think that it was i who first introduced her to my lord
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1838.mp3	i am ashamed to look you in the face oh say not so misfortunes are the punishment due for our misdeeds in a former state of existence i bear you no ill will this money which i hold in my hand was my daughter's
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1839.mp3	to you through whose intervention she became allied with a nobleman

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1842.mp3	and as luck would have it it was the very letter which contained sazen's instructions to kihachi and in which the whole story which had just affected him so much was made up when he perceived the trick that had been played upon him he was very angry and exclaimed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1843.mp3	and all in vain well they've gulled me once but i'll be even with them yet and hinder their game before it is played out
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1844.mp3	and went off secretly to prowl about sazen's house to watch for o koyo determined to pay off genzaburo and sazen for their conduct to him in the meanwhile sazen who did not for a moment suspect what had happened
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1845.mp3	when the day which had been fixed upon by him and genzaburo arrived made o koyo put on her best clothes smartened up his house and got ready a feast against genzaburo's arrival the latter came punctually to his time
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1846.mp3	and going in at once said to the fortune teller
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1847.mp3	lost heart entirely and made up his mind to go home again sazen however pressed him so eagerly that at last he went upstairs to see this vaunted beauty and sazen drawing aside a screen showed him o koyo who was sitting there
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1848.mp3	pray don't mention it sir but as it is a long time since you have met the young lady you must have a great deal to say to one another so i will go downstairs and if you want anything pray call me and so he went downstairs and left them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1849.mp3	then genzaburo addressing o koyo said ah it is indeed a long time since we met how happy it makes me to see you again why your face has grown quite thin poor thing have you been unhappy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1850.mp3	and o koyo with the tears starting from her eyes for joy hid her face and her heart was so full that she could not speak but genzaburo passing his hand gently over her head and back and comforting her said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1851.mp3	come sweetheart there is no need to sob so talk to me a little and let me hear your voice at last o koyo raised her head and said ah
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1852.mp3	and thought that i should never meet you again how tenderly i thought of you
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1853.mp3	sazen came with a message from you i thought it was all a dream and as she spoke she bent her head and sobbed again and in genzaburo's eyes she seemed more beautiful than ever
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1854.mp3	with her pale delicate face and he loved her better than before then she said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1855.mp3	i should never stop yes replied genzaburo i too have suffered much and so they told one another their mutual griefs and from that day forth they constantly met at sazen's house
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1856.mp3	one day as they were feasting and enjoying themselves in an upper storey in sazen's house chokichi came to the house and said i beg pardon but does one master sazen live here certainly sir i am sazen at your service
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1857.mp3	and my name is chokichi i beg to bespeak your goodwill for myself i hope we may be friends sazen was not a little taken aback at this however he put on an innocent face as though he had never heard of chokichi before and said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1858.mp3	i never heard of such a thing why i thought you were some respectable person and you have the impudence to tell me that your name is chokichi
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1859.mp3	to think of such a shameless villain coming and asking to be friends with me forsooth get you gone the quicker the better
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1860.mp3	why i thought you must be one of us insolent knave begone as fast as possible
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1861.mp3	you had better get rid of o koyo as well i suppose she must equally be a pollution to it this put sazen rather in a dilemma however he made up his mind not to show any hesitation and said what are you talking about
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1862.mp3	there is no o koyo here and i never saw such a person in my life chokichi quietly drew out of the bosom of his dress the letter from sazen to kihachi which he had picked up a few days before and showing it to sazen replied
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1863.mp3	and as he pretended to leave the house sazen at his wits end cried out stop stop
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1864.mp3	pray stop and listen quietly it is quite true as you said that o koyo is in my house and really your indignation is perfectly just come let us talk over matters a little
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1865.mp3	in order that i may be revenged for the fraud that was put upon me won't you accept twenty five riyos twenty five riyos no indeed i will not take a fraction less than a hundred and if i cannot get them i will report the whole matter at once
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1866.mp3	sazen after a moment's consideration hit upon a scheme and answered smiling
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1867.mp3	you shall have the hundred riyos you ask for but as i have not so much money by me at present i will go to genzaburo's house and fetch it it's getting dark now but it's not very late
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1868.mp3	so i'll trouble you to come with me and then i can give you the money to night chokichi consenting to this the pair left the house together now sazen who as a ronin wore a long dirk in his girdle
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1869.mp3	kept looking out for a moment when chokichi should be off his guard in order to kill him but chokichi kept his eyes open and did not give sazen a chance at last chokichi as ill luck would have it stumbled against a stone and fell
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1870.mp3	and sazen profiting by the chance drew his dirk and stabbed him in the side and as chokichi taken by surprise tried to get up he cut him severely over the head until at last he fell dead
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1871.mp3	sazen then looking around him and seeing to his great delight that there was no one near returned home the following day chokichi's body was found by the police and when they examined it they found nothing upon it save a paper which they read
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1872.mp3	and which proved to be the very letter which sazen had sent to kihachi and which chokichi had picked up the matter was immediately reported to the governor and sazen having been summoned an investigation was held
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1873.mp3	sazen cunning and bold murderer as he was lost his self possession when he saw what a fool he had been not to get back from chokichi the letter which he had written and when he was put to a rigid examination under torture
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1874.mp3	confessed that he had hidden o koyo at genzaburo's instigation and then killed chokichi who had found out the secret upon this the governor after consulting about genzaburo's case decided that
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1875.mp3	as he had disgraced his position as a hatamoto by contracting an alliance with the daughter of an eta his property should be confiscated his family blotted out and himself banished as for kihachi the eta chief and his daughter o koyo
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1876.mp3	and by him they too were banished while sazen against whom the murder of chokichi had been fully proved was executed according to law note at asakusa in yedo there lives a man called danzayemon
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1877.mp3	this man traces his pedigree back to minamoto no yoritomo
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1878.mp3	the thirty sixth law provides as follows all wandering mendicants such as male sorcerers female diviners hermits blind people beggars and tanners etas have had from of old their respective rulers
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1879.mp3	be not disinclined however to punish any such who give rise to disputes or who overstep the boundaries of their own classes and are disobedient to existing laws
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1880.mp3	and if they are very poor they wander from house to house working as cobblers mending old shoes and leather and so earn a scanty livelihood besides this their daughters and young married women gain a trifle as wandering minstrels called torioi
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1881.mp3	playing on the shamisen a sort of banjo and singing ballads they never marry out of their own fraternity but remain apart a despised and shunned race at executions by crucifixion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1882.mp3	and besides this they have to perform all sorts of degrading offices about criminals such as carrying sick prisoners from their cells to the hall of justice and burying the bodies of those that have been executed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1883.mp3	thus their race is polluted and accursed and they are hated accordingly now this is how the etas came to be under the jurisdiction of danzayemon when minamoto no yoritomo was yet a child his father minamoto no yoshitomo
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1884.mp3	but kiyomori desiring to destroy the family of yoshitomo root and branch ordered his retainers to divide themselves into bands and seek out the children at last they were found but tokiwa was so exceedingly beautiful
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1885.mp3	that kiyomori was inflamed with love for her and desired her to become his own concubine then tokiwa told kiyomori that if he would spare her little ones she would share his couch
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1886.mp3	but that if he killed her children she would destroy herself rather than yield to his desire when he heard this kiyomori bewildered by the beauty of tokiwa spared the lives of her children but banished them from the capital
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1887.mp3	and when he grew up and became a man he married the daughter of a peasant after a while yoritomo left the province and went to the wars leaving his wife pregnant and in due time she was delivered of a male child
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1888.mp3	to the delight of her parents who rejoiced that their daughter should bear seed to a nobleman but she soon fell sick and died and the old people took charge of the babe and when they also died the care of the child fell to his mother's kinsmen

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1911.mp3	by degrees i made a discovery of still greater moment i found that these people possessed a method of communicating their experience and feelings to one another by articulate sounds
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1912.mp3	i perceived that the words they spoke sometimes produced pleasure or pain smiles or sadness in the minds and countenances of the hearers this was indeed a godlike science and i ardently desired to become acquainted with it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1913.mp3	but i was baffled in every attempt i made for this purpose
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1914.mp3	not having any apparent connection with visible objects i was unable to discover any clue by which i could unravel the mystery of their reference by great application however
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1915.mp3	and after having remained during the space of several revolutions of the moon in my hovel i discovered the names that were given to some of the most familiar objects of discourse i learned and applied the words fire milk bread and wood
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1916.mp3	but the old man had only one which was father the girl was called sister or agatha and the youth felix brother or son i cannot describe the delight i felt

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1918.mp3	as yet to understand or apply them such as good dearest unhappy i spent the winter in this manner the gentle manners and beauty of the cottagers greatly endeared them to me

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1928.mp3	he read to the old man and agatha this reading had puzzled me extremely at first but by degrees i discovered that he uttered many of the same sounds when he read as when he talked i conjectured therefore
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1929.mp3	that he found on the paper signs for speech which he understood and i ardently longed to comprehend these also but how was that possible when i did not even understand the sounds for which they stood as signs i improved however sensibly in this science

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1940.mp3	that it might be in my power to restore happiness to these deserving people when i slept or was absent the forms of the venerable blind father

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1943.mp3	greatly altered the aspect of the earth men who before this change seemed to have been hid in caves dispersed themselves and were employed in various arts of cultivation

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1947.mp3	by degrees i remember a stronger light pressed upon my nerves so that i was obliged to shut my eyes darkness then came over me and troubled me but hardly had i felt this when by opening my eyes as i now suppose
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1948.mp3	the light poured in upon me again i walked and i believe descended but i presently found a great alteration in my sensations before dark and opaque bodies had surrounded me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1949.mp3	the light became more and more oppressive to me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1950.mp3	this was the forest near ingolstadt and here i lay by the side of a brook resting from my fatigue until i felt tormented by hunger and thirst this roused me from my nearly dormant state
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1951.mp3	i slaked my thirst at the brook and then lying down was overcome by sleep it was dark when i awoke i felt cold also and half frightened

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1953.mp3	i had covered myself with some clothes but these were insufficient to secure me from the dews of night
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1954.mp3	i knew and could distinguish nothing but feeling pain invade me on all sides i sat down and wept soon a gentle light stole over the heavens and gave me a sensation of pleasure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1955.mp3	the moon i gazed with a kind of wonder it moved slowly but it enlightened my path and i again went out in search of berries i was still cold when under one of the trees i found a huge cloak
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1956.mp3	no distinct ideas occupied my mind all was confused i felt light and hunger and thirst and darkness innumerable sounds rang in my ears and on all sides various scents saluted me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1957.mp3	the only object that i could distinguish was the bright moon and i fixed my eyes on that with pleasure several changes of day and night passed and the orb of night had greatly lessened when i began to distinguish my sensations from each other
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/1958.mp3	i gradually saw plainly the clear stream that supplied me with drink and the trees that shaded me with their foliage

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2399.mp3	so says saint nicholas that's a piece of work well done then he tossed the hazel nut under the roots of an oak tree near by and went his way and that is how this story begins well
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2400.mp3	nobody met with ill luck but one day who should come travelling that way
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2401.mp3	and phst pop out came ill luck along with it plague take the fiddler say i listen says ill luck it has been many a long day that i have been in that hazel nut and you are the man that has let me out
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2402.mp3	for once in a way i will do a good turn to a poor human body therewith and without giving the fiddler time to speak a word ill luck caught him up by the belt and whiz away he flew like a bullet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2403.mp3	then away he flew to attend to other matters of greater need when the fiddler had gathered his wits together and himself to his feet he saw that he lay in a beautiful garden of flowers and fruit trees and marble walks and what not
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2404.mp3	all built of white marble with a fountain in front and peacocks strutting about on the lawn well the fiddler smoothed down his hair and brushed his clothes a bit and off he went to see what was to be seen at the grand house at the end of the garden
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2405.mp3	he entered the door and nobody said no to him then he passed through one room after another and each was finer than the one he left behind many servants stood around but they only bowed and never asked whence he came
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2406.mp3	the table was spread with a feast that smelled so good that it brought tears to the fiddler's eyes and water to his mouth and all the plates were of pure gold the little old man sat alone but another place was spread
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2407.mp3	do not say that sit down to the table and eat and when i have told you all you will say it was not ill luck but good luck that brought you the fiddler had his own mind about that but all the same down he sat at the table
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2408.mp3	and fell to with knife and fork at the good things as though he had not had a bite to eat for a week of sundays i am the richest man in the world says the little old man after a while i am glad to hear it says the fiddler you may well be said the old man
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2409.mp3	and without wife or child and this morning i said to myself that the first body that came to my house i would take for a son or a daughter as the case might be you are the first
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2410.mp3	and so you shall live with me as long as i live and after i am gone everything that i have shall be yours the fiddler did nothing but stare with open eyes and mouth as though he would never shut either again
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2411.mp3	everything the fiddler wanted came to his hand he lived high and slept soft and warm and never knew what it was to want either more or less or great or small in all of those three or four days he did nothing but enjoy himself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2412.mp3	with might and main but by and by he began to wonder where all the good things came from then before long he fell to pestering the old man with questions about the matter at first the old man put him off with short answers
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2413.mp3	but the fiddler was a master hand at finding out anything he wanted to know he dinned and drummed and worried until flesh and blood could stand it no longer so at last the old man said that he would show him the treasure house where all his wealth came from
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2414.mp3	and at that the fiddler was tickled beyond measure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2415.mp3	there in a corner by the wall was a great trap door of iron the old man fitted the key to the lock and turned it he lifted the door and then went down a steep flight of stone steps and the fiddler followed close at his heels
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2416.mp3	down below it was as light as day for in the centre of the room hung a great lamp that shone with a bright light

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2418.mp3	and out into the sunlight again it took him maybe an hour to count all the money and jewels he had brought up with him after he had done that he began to wonder what was inside of the little door at the back of the room first he wondered
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2419.mp3	perhaps i can see what is there without opening the door so down he took the key and off he marched to the garden he opened the trap door and went down the steep steps to the room below there was the door at the end of the room

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2422.mp3	so he entered the passageway and closed the door behind him he went on and on and the spark of light kept growing larger and larger and by and by pop out he came at the other end of the passage sure enough
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2423.mp3	there he stood on the sea shore with the waves beating and dashing on the rocks he stood looking and wondering to find himself in such a place when all of a sudden something came with a whiz and a rush and caught him by the belt and away he flew like a bullet

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2509.mp3	into the house they hauled the poor servant and into the same room where he had been before and there sat the young man at a grand feast with his wife and all his friends around him but when the young man saw the poor serving man he came to him

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2522.mp3	two little crayfishes quarrel the day after the eels left the pond people talked of nothing else it was not that they were so much missed for the eels you know do not swim around in the daytime
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2523.mp3	the larger people had been sorry to have them go and some of them felt that without the eels awake and stirring the pond was hardly a safe place at night i think it is a good deal safer remarked a minnow who usually said what she thought
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2524.mp3	of course i do not know why didn't you ask them said a stickleback why replied the minnow if i had gone to the eels and asked them that

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2528.mp3	it would be better for me not to tell what i think i used to live near them this showed that the wise old crayfish had been well brought up and knew he should not say unpleasant things about people if he could help it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2529.mp3	when there was need of it he could tell unpleasant truths and indeed that very evening he did say what he thought of the eels that was when he was teaching some young crayfishes his pupils
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2530.mp3	their mother had brought up a large family and was not strong she had just cast the shell which she had worn for a year and now she was weak and helpless until the new one should harden on her it is such a bother she said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2531.mp3	but it is a comfort to think that the new one will last a year when i do get it while their mother was so weak the wise old crayfish amused the children and taught them things which all crayfishes should know every evening
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2532.mp3	they gathered around him some of them swimming to him some walking forward some sidewise and some backward it made no difference to them which way they came they were restless pupils and their teacher could not keep them from looking behind them

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2538.mp3	are long slender sharp nosed slippery people with a fringe of fins along their backs and another fringe along their bellies they breathe through very small gill openings in the backs of their heads

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2591.mp3	the minks were a very dark brown and scattered through their close soft fur were long shining hairs of an even darker shade which made their coats very beautiful indeed the fur was darker on their backs than on the under part of their bodies
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2592.mp3	and their tapering bushy tails were almost black their under jaws were white and they were very proud of them perhaps it was because they had so little white fur that they thought so much of it you know that is often the way
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2593.mp3	we think most of those things which are scarce or hard to get there was one old mink by the river who had a white tip on his tail and that is something which many people have never seen it is even more uncommon
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2594.mp3	than for minks to have white upper lips and that happens only once in a great while this mink was a bachelor and nobody knew why some people said it was because he was waiting to find a wife with a white tip on her tail
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2595.mp3	yet that could not have been for he was too wise to wait for something which might never happen however it was he lived alone and fished and hunted just for himself he could dive more quickly
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2596.mp3	stay under water longer and hunt by scent better than any other mink round there his fur was sleeker and more shining than that of his friends and it is no wonder that the sisters of his friends thought that he ought to marry
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2597.mp3	when the minks visited together somebody was sure to speak of the bachelor's luck they said that whatever he did he was always lucky it is all because of a white tip on his tail they said

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2599.mp3	and told them that it was not the tip of his tail
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2600.mp3	and the brothers were bigger than the sisters as mink brothers always are although they were all the same age one was very much larger than any of the rest and so they called him big brother
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2601.mp3	he thought there was never such a fine mink as the bachelor and he used to follow him around
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2602.mp3	he wished to be just like him in every way but one he did not want to be a bachelor the other young minks laughed at big brother and asked him if he thought his tail would turn white if he followed the bachelor long enough
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2603.mp3	big brother stood it very patiently for a while then he snarled at them and showed his teeth without smiling and said he would fight anybody who spoke another word about it minks are very brave and very fierce
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2604.mp3	and never know when to stop if they have begun to fight so after that nobody dared tease big brother by saying anything more about the bachelor sometimes they did look at his tail and smile but they never spoke
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2605.mp3	and he pretended not to know what they meant by it a few days after this the bachelor was caught in a trap a common clumsy wooden trap put together with nails and twine
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2606.mp3	it was not near the river and none of his friends would have found him if big brother had not happened along he could hardly believe what he saw was it possible that a trap had dared to catch a mink with a white tipped tail
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2607.mp3	then he heard the bachelor groan and he knew that it was so he hurried up to where the trap was can't you get out said he no said the bachelor i can't the best way to get
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2608.mp3	out is not to get in and i've gotten in can't you do something with your lucky tail to make the trap open asked big brother i could do something with my teeth answered the bachelor if they were only where the tip of my tail is
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2609.mp3	why are minks always walking into traps he was trying hard not to be cross but his eyes showed how he felt and that was very cross indeed then big brother became much excited
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2610.mp3	i have good teeth said he tell me what to do if you will help me out said the bachelor i will give you my luck and what shall i do with the tail i have asked the young mink
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2611.mp3	who thought that the bachelor was to give him his white tipped tail never mind now answered the bachelor and he told the young mink just where to gnaw for a long time there was no sound but that of the young mink's teeth on the wood of the trap
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2612.mp3	the bachelor was too brave to groan or make a fuss when he knew there was anybody around to hear big brother's mouth became very sore and his stomach became very empty but still he kept at work he was afraid somebody would
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2613.mp3	come for the trap and the mink in it before he finished now try it said he after he had gnawed for quite a while the bachelor backed out as far as he could but his body stuck in the hole
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2614.mp3	you are rumpling your beautiful fur cried the young mink never mind the fur answered the bachelor i can smooth that down afterward you will have to gnaw a little on this side

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2637.mp3	the utility to that person of that thing or service for that particular moment falls it may be even to zero to keep wants satisfied is impossible we cannot do next year's reading or next week's eating now
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2638.mp3	in its power to gratify wants the closer the correspondence between the two series that of wants and that of goods the greater will be the total of gratification

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2645.mp3	men make use of other goods while they are storing up a supply of wood or coal it may be looked upon as the income but they may burn it to help grow hothouse plants
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2646.mp3	while they gather flowers with one hand they destroy fuel with the other only the net increase in value can be accounted income in the second period
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2647.mp3	the goods that come into a man's possession in any period are of many sorts to get some he has destroyed many previously existing goods
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2648.mp3	while to get others he has not needed to use up the accumulations of the past or to mortgage the future the one kind is gross the other net income

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2733.mp3	it is said that lace machinery is sometimes thrown out of use for several years until a sudden renewal of the demand for lace causes the rental to equal in two years
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2734.mp3	more than the original cost at such times the value of factories increases greatly but after a few years of prosperity business again collapses
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2735.mp3	such prosperous periods are the opportunity of the business man and of the promoter to sell the factory at its highest price machinery adapted only for a special product
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2736.mp3	will not sell as readily when less needed for its special use as that which like a turning lathe can be used for many purposes but the more special the appliances needed for a certain product the higher
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2737.mp3	more abnormal will be their temporary value when they are suddenly needed land near the site of an exposition takes on a very
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2738.mp3	puts a check or sets a limit to the rise in this search for new devices the man who can see most quickly and clearly has a key to wealth
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2739.mp3	some kinds of agents as rare minerals or tools that can be produced only by highly skilled labor cannot be increased rapidly in number and remain high in price for a long period
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2740.mp3	and favorably located building sites illustrate the same principle in some cases it is true the demand may be due to some temporary cause
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2741.mp3	waterworks gas works street railways ferries and wharves this evidently is only a special illustration of the principle just stated where it is not easy to find a substitute for certain agents
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2742.mp3	public franchises entitle the owners to special sometimes exclusive privileges and protect them legally from competition not all franchises are valuable
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2743.mp3	many street railways are unfortunate ventures the earnings being insufficient to pay expenses to say nothing of interest on the investment but when they pay greatly
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2744.mp3	their high value is due to the impossibility of competition the cars mules dynamos steam engines
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2745.mp3	due to accidental and social causes raising the rents of wealth the term unearned increment may be defined as an increase in rents or value of agents
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2746.mp3	due to something other than the efforts or merits of the owner in fact it is that of which we have been speaking in some cases powerful or wealthy men
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2747.mp3	can bring about social changes in entirely legitimate ways the owner of a large factory moving it into the country may buy up surrounding land and found a city converting pasture lands and corn fields
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2748.mp3	is powerless to affect the result he can only adapt his conduct in some measure so as to reap an advantage he can strive to increase the number and quality
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/2749.mp3	as well as of gain the term unearned increment has been frequently used in recent years

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3319.mp3	who had never taken his eyes off his companion passed his hand behind his back and opened a long spanish knife which he always carried with him to be ready in case of need
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3320.mp3	the two friends as we see were worthy of and understood one another andrea's hand left his pocket inoffensively and was carried up to the red mustache which it played with for some time
