https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3328.mp3	you would not like me to risk taking cold but what am i to do you oh you are young while i am beginning to get old au revoir benedetto
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3329.mp3	and running into a court he disappeared alas said andrea sighing
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3330.mp3	we have recognized in representative government the ideal type of the most perfect polity for which in consequence any portion of mankind are better adapted in proportion to their degree of general improvement as they range lower and lower in development
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3331.mp3	that form of government will be generally speaking less suitable to them though this is not true universally for the adaptation of a people to representative government does not depend so much upon the place they occupy in the general scale of humanity
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3332.mp3	as upon the degree in which they possess certain special requisites requisites however so closely connected with their degree of general advancement that any variation between the two is rather the exception than the rule
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3333.mp3	that they should be willing and able to fulfill the duties and discharge the functions which it imposes on them the willingness of the people to accept representative government only becomes a practical question when an enlightened ruler or a foreign nation or nations
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3334.mp3	who have gained power over the country are disposed to offer it the boon to individual reformers the question is almost irrelevant since if no other objection can be made to their enterprise than that the opinion of the nation is not yet on their side
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3335.mp3	they have the ready and proper answer that to bring it over to their side is the very end they aim at when opinion is really adverse its hostility is usually to the fact of change rather than to representative government in itself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3336.mp3	the contrary case is not indeed unexampled there has sometimes been a religious repugnance to any limitation of the power of a particular line of rulers but in general the doctrine of passive obedience meant only submission to the will of the powers that be
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3337.mp3	whether monarchical or popular in any case in which the attempt to introduce representative government is at all likely to be made indifference to it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3338.mp3	rather than positive opposition are the obstacles to be expected these however are as fatal and may be as hard to be got rid of as actual aversion it being easier in most cases to change the direction of an active feeling than to create one
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3339.mp3	in a state previously passive when a people have no sufficient value for and attachment to a representative constitution they have next to no chance of retaining it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3340.mp3	and is in direct contact with the public to it principally the hopes and fears of individuals are directed and by it both the benefits and the terrors and prestige of government are mainly represented to the public eye
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3341.mp3	unless therefore the authorities whose office it is to check the executive are backed by an effective opinion and feeling in the country the executive has always the means of setting them aside or compelling them to subservience
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3342.mp3	and is sure to be well supported in doing so representative institutions necessarily depend for permanence upon the readiness of the people to fight for them in case of their being endangered if too little valued for this
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3343.mp3	they seldom obtain a footing at all and if they do are almost sure to be overthrown as soon as the head of the government or any party leader who can muster force for a coup de main is willing to run some small risk for absolute power
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3344.mp3	these considerations relate to the first two causes of failure in a representative government the third is when the people want either the will or the capacity to fulfill the part which belongs to them in a representative constitution
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3345.mp3	when nobody or only some small fraction feels the degree of interest in the general affairs of the state necessary to the formation of a public opinion the electors will seldom make any use of the right of suffrage but to serve their private interest or the interest of their locality
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3346.mp3	or of some one with whom they are connected as adherents or dependents the small class who in this state of public feeling gain the command of the representative body for the most part use it solely as a means of seeking their fortune if the executive is weak
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3347.mp3	the country is distracted by mere struggles for place if strong it makes itself despotic at the cheap price of appeasing the representatives or such of them as are capable of giving trouble by a share of the spoil
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3348.mp3	and the only fruit produced by national representation is that in addition to those who really govern there is an assembly quartered on the public and no abuse in which a portion of the assembly are interested is at all likely to be removed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3349.mp3	when however the evil stops here the price may be worth paying for the publicity and discussion which though not an invariable are a natural accompaniment of any even nominal representation
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3350.mp3	that the place hunters who chiefly compose the representative assembly though they contribute little or nothing directly to good government nor even much temper the arbitrary power of the executive
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3351.mp3	which exists in that country this benefit however is entirely dependent on the coexistence with the popular body of an hereditary king if instead of struggling for the favors of the chief ruler these selfish and sordid factions struggled for the chief place itself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3352.mp3	they would certainly as in spanish america keep the country in a state of chronic revolution and civil war a despotism not even legal but of illegal violence would be alternately exercised by a succession of political adventurers
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3353.mp3	and the name and forms of representation would have no effect but to prevent despotism from attaining the stability and security by which alone its evils can be mitigated or its few advantages realized
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3354.mp3	there are others in which it possibly might exist but in which some other form of government would be preferable these are principally when the people in order to advance in civilization have some lesson to learn some habit not yet acquired
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3355.mp3	to the acquisition of which representative government is likely to be an impediment the most obvious of these cases is the one already considered in which the people have still to learn the first lesson of civilization that of obedience
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3356.mp3	a race who have been trained in energy and courage by struggles with nature and their neighbors but who have not yet settled down into permanent obedience to any common superior would be little likely to acquire this habit under the collective government of their own body
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3357.mp3	a representative assembly drawn from among themselves would simply reflect their own turbulent insubordination it would refuse its authority to all proceedings which would impose on their savage independence any improving restraint
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3358.mp3	a military leader is the only superior to whom they will submit except occasionally some prophet supposed to be inspired from above or conjurer regarded as possessing miraculous power these may exercise a temporary ascendancy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3359.mp3	but as it is merely personal it rarely effects any change in the general habits of the people unless the prophet like mohammed is also a military chief and goes forth the armed apostle of a new religion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3360.mp3	or unless the military chiefs ally themselves with his influence and turn it into a prop for their own government a people are no less unfitted for representative government by the contrary fault to that last specified by extreme passiveness
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3361.mp3	and ready submission to tyranny if a people thus prostrated by character and circumstances could obtain representative institutions they would inevitably choose their tyrants as their representatives and the yoke would be made heavier on them by the contrivance which
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3362.mp3	might be expected to lighten it on the contrary many a people has gradually emerged from this condition by the aid of a central authority whose position has made it the rival and has ended by making it the master of the local despots
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3363.mp3	even when the king was scarcely so powerful as many of his chief feudatories the great advantage which he derived from being but one has been recognized by french historians to him the eyes of all the locally oppressed were turned
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3364.mp3	he was the object of hope and reliance throughout the kingdom while each local potentate was only powerful within a more or less confined space at his hands refuge and protection were sought from every part of the country against first one
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3365.mp3	then another of the immediate oppressors his progress to ascendancy was slow but it resulted from successively taking advantage of opportunities which offered themselves only to him it was therefore sure and in proportion as it was accomplished
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3366.mp3	it abated in the oppressed portion of the community the habit of submitting to oppression the king's interest lay in encouraging all partial attempts on the part of the serfs to emancipate themselves from their masters and place themselves in immediate subordination to himself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3367.mp3	under his protection numerous communities were formed which knew no one above them but the king
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3368.mp3	and the monarch was long compelled by necessities of position to exert his authority as the ally rather than the master of the classes whom he had aided in affecting their liberation in this manner a central power despotic in principle
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3369.mp3	though generally much restricted in practice was mainly instrumental in carrying the people through a necessary stage of improvement which representative government if real would most likely have prevented them from entering upon

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3387.mp3	i'm crazy about mysteries as you know and if there really is one about that rock house i want to try to solve it she said no more about it just then as they had reached the old ghost town of gleeson
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3388.mp3	in the long ago days when the town had been teeming with life picturesque looking miners and ranchers had sat there tilted back smoking pipes and swapping yarns today the chairs were empty an old man shriveled

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3391.mp3	dora exclaimed as she rode close to the porch thanks a lot she called brightly up to the old man who was handing the packet down over the sagging wooden rail his friendly toothless smile was directed at the smaller girl

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3400.mp3	its broad porch and adobe pillars here her mother had come as a bride here mary had been born eight happy years they had spent together before her mother died after mary had been taken east to school her father had returned
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3401.mp3	then glancing up at the nurse who had appeared from her father's bedroom she asked eagerly may i tell dad an adventure we've had missus farley middle aged kind faced shook her head smiling down at the girl not tonight please won't tomorrow do
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3402.mp3	it looks big and important and it makes a great noise even people a long way up in the scale of civilization are in the habit of taking these attributes perhaps not as the essential ones of leadership but at all events as those by which a leader may be recognized
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3403.mp3	the pointsman moves a handle and the foaming giant that would it may be have sped on to his destruction and that of the passive crew who follow in his rear is shunted to another line running in a different direction and to a more desirable goal
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3404.mp3	the great intellectual pointsman of our age the man who has done more than any other of this generation to give direction to the thought of his contemporaries has passed away and we are left to measure the loss to humanity by the result of his labors
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3405.mp3	mister mill's achievements in both branches of philosophy are such as to give him the foremost place in either whether we regard him as an expounder of the philosophy of mind or the philosophy of society he is
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3406.mp3	the structure raised by adam smith malthus and ricardo but raised it at least one story higher his inestimable system of logic was a revolution it hardly needs of course to be said that he owed much to his predecessors
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3407.mp3	that he borrowed from whewell much of his classification from brown the chief lines of his theory of causation from sir john herschel the main principles of the inductive methods those who think this a disparagement of his work must have very little conception
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3408.mp3	of the mass of original thought that still remains to mister mill's credit the great critical power that could gather valuable truths from so many discordant sources and the wonderful synthetic ability required to weld these and his own contributions
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3409.mp3	into one organic whole when mister mill commenced his labors the only logic recognized was the syllogistic
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3410.mp3	in deducing from general propositions other propositions less general it was even asserted confidently that nothing more was to be expected that an inductive logic was impossible this conception of logical science necessitated
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3411.mp3	some general propositions to start with and these general propositions being ex
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3412.mp3	incapable of being proved from other propositions it followed that if they were known to us at all they must be original data of consciousness here was a perfect paradise of question begging the ultimate major premise in every argument being assumed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3413.mp3	it could of course be fashioned according to the particular conclusion it was called in to prove thus an artificial ignorance as locke calls it was produced which had the effect of sanctifying prejudice by recognizing so called necessities of thought
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3414.mp3	as the only bases of reasoning it is true that outside of the logic of the schools great advances had been made in the rules of scientific investigation but these rules were not only imperfect in themselves but their connection with the law of causation
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3415.mp3	was but imperfectly realized and their true relation to syllogism hardly dreamt of mister mill altered all this he demonstrated that the general type of reasoning is neither from generals to particulars nor from particulars to generals but from particulars to particulars
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3416.mp3	but are now dead we are entitled to conclude that all human beings are mortal we might surely without any logical inconsequence have concluded at once from those instances that the duke of wellington is mortal
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3417.mp3	the mortality of john thomas and others is after all the whole evidence we have for the mortality of the duke of wellington not one iota is added to the proof by interpolating a general proposition
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3418.mp3	we not only may according to mister mill reason from some particular instances to others but we frequently do so as however the instances which are sufficient to prove one fresh instance
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3419.mp3	the work of deduction is the interpretation of these formulas and therefore strictly speaking is not inferential at all the real inference was accomplished when the universal proposition was arrived at
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3420.mp3	all reasoning is shown to be at bottom inductive inductions and their interpretation make up the whole of logic and to induction accordingly mister mill devoted his chief attention for the first time induction was treated as the opus magnum of logic
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3421.mp3	and the fundamental principles of science traced to their inductive origin it was this taken with his theory of the syllogism which worked the great change both his system of logic and his examination of sir william hamilton's philosophy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3422.mp3	are for the most part devoted to fortifying this position and demolishing beliefs inconsistent with it as a systematic psychologist mister mill has not done so much as either professor bain or mister herbert spencer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3423.mp3	the perfection of his method its application and the uprooting of prejudices which stood in its way this was the task to which mister mill applied himself with an ability and success rarely matched and never surpassed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3424.mp3	the biggest lion in the path was the doctrine of so called necessary truth this doctrine was especially obnoxious to him as it set up a purely subjective standard of truth and a standard as he was easily able to show
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3425.mp3	varying according to the psychological history of the individual such thinkers as doctor whewell and mister herbert spencer had to be met in intellectual combat doctor whewell held not that the inconceivability
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3426.mp3	of the contradictory of a proposition is a proof of its truth co equal with experience but that its value transcends experience experience may tell us what is but it is by the impossibility of conceiving it otherwise
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3427.mp3	in his examination of sir william hamilton's philosophy mister mill gives battle to this mode of thought after reviewing in an opening chapter the various views which have been held respecting the relativity of human knowledge
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3428.mp3	as mister mill says the name of god is veiled under two extremely abstract phrases infinite and the absolute so profound and friendly a thinker as the late mister grote held this raising of the veil inexpedient but he proved
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3429.mp3	by a mistake he fell into the necessity of looking at the matter in the concrete he acknowledged the force of mister mill's argument that the infinite must include a farrago of contradictions
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3430.mp3	in which these contradictory attributes inhere but it was against a corresponding being the infinite that mister mill was arguing it is this that he calls a

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3432.mp3	and prescribe to him a rule of life that person has a religion and though every one naturally prefers his own religion to any other all must admit that if the object of his attachment and of this feeling of duty is the aggregate of our fellow creatures

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3727.mp3	tore themselves up by the roots wherever a dragon's tooth had fallen there stood a man armed for battle they made a clangor with their swords against their shields and eyed one another fiercely

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3831.mp3	the fishermen are well paid aren't they hardly professor in panama they make just one dollar per week in most places they earn only a penny for each oyster that has a pearl and they bring up so many that have none
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3832.mp3	only one penny to those poor people who make their employers rich that's atrocious on that note professor captain nemo told me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3833.mp3	and if by chance some eager fisherman arrives early well we can watch him at work that suits me captain by the way professor aronnax you aren't afraid of sharks are you sharks i exclaimed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3834.mp3	this struck me as a pretty needless question to say the least well captain nemo went on i admit captain i'm not yet on very familiar terms with that genus of fish we're used to them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3835.mp3	the rest of us captain nemo answered and in time you will be too anyhow we'll be armed and on our way we might hunt a man eater or two it's a fascinating sport so professor i'll see you tomorrow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3836.mp3	bright and early this said in a carefree tone captain nemo left the lounge if you're invited to hunt bears in the swiss mountains you might say oh good i get to go bear hunting tomorrow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3837.mp3	if you're invited to hunt lions on the atlas plains or tigers in the jungles of india you might say ha now's my chance to hunt lions and tigers but if you're invited to hunt sharks in their native element
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3838.mp3	you might want to think it over before accepting as for me i passed a hand over my brow where beads of cold sweat were busy forming let's think this over i said to myself and let's take our time
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3839.mp3	hunting otters in underwater forests as we did in the forests of crespo island is an acceptable activity
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3840.mp3	that's another story i know that in certain countries particularly the andaman islands negroes don't hesitate to attack sharks dagger in one hand and noose in the other
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3841.mp3	but i also know that many who face those fearsome animals don't come back alive besides i'm not a negro and even if i were a negro in this instance i don't think a little hesitation on my part would be out of place
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3842.mp3	and there i was fantasizing about sharks envisioning huge jaws armed with multiple rows of teeth and capable of cutting a man in half i could already feel a definite pain around my pelvic girdle
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3843.mp3	and how i resented the offhand manner in which the captain had extended his deplorable invitation
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3844.mp3	thank heavens i said to myself conseil will never want to come along and that'll be my excuse for not going with the captain as for ned land i admit i felt less confident of his wisdom
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3845.mp3	danger however great held a perennial attraction for his aggressive nature i went back to reading sirr's book but i leafed through it mechanically between the lines i kept seeing fearsome wide open jaws
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3846.mp3	just then conseil and the canadian entered with a calm even gleeful air little did they know what was waiting for them ye gods sir ned land told me your captain nemo the devil take him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3847.mp3	has just made us a very pleasant proposition oh i said you know about with all due respect to master conseil replied the nautilus's commander has invited us together with master
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3848.mp3	for a visit tomorrow to ceylon's magnificent pearl fisheries he did so in the most cordial terms and conducted himself like a true gentleman he didn't tell you anything else nothing sir the canadian replied
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3849.mp3	he said you'd already discussed this little stroll indeed i said but didn't he give you any details on not a one mister naturalist you will be going with us right me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3850.mp3	why yes certainly of course i can see that you like the idea mister land yes it will be a really unusual experience and possibly dangerous i added in an insinuating tone
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3851.mp3	dangerous ned land replied a simple trip to an oysterbank assuredly
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3852.mp3	for my part i stared at them with anxious eyes as if they were already missing a limb or two should i alert them yes surely but i hardly knew how to go about it would master
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3853.mp3	conseil said to me give us some background on pearl fishing on the fishing itself i asked or on the occupational hazards that on the fishing the canadian replied before we tackle the terrain it helps to be familiar with it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3854.mp3	all right sit down my friends
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3855.mp3	ned and conseil took seats on a couch and right off the canadian said to me sir just what is a pearl exactly my gallant ned i replied for poets a pearl is a tear from the sea
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3856.mp3	for orientals it's a drop of solidified dew for the ladies it's a jewel
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3857.mp3	necks and ears that's oblong in shape glassy in luster and formed from mother of pearl for chemists it's a mixture of calcium phosphate and calcium carbonate with a little gelatin protein
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3858.mp3	and finally for naturalists it's a simple festering secretion from the organ that produces mother of pearl in certain bivalves branch mollusca conseil said class
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3859.mp3	acephala order testacea correct my scholarly conseil now then those testacea capable of producing pearls include rainbow abalone
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3860.mp3	turbo snails giant clams and saltwater scallops briefly all those that secrete mother of pearl in other words that blue azure violet or white substance
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3861.mp3	lining the insides of their valves are mussels included too the canadian asked yes the mussels of certain streams in scotland wales ireland saxony bohemia and france
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3862.mp3	good the canadian replied from now on we'll pay closer attention to em but i went on for secreting pearls the ideal mollusk is the pearl oyster meleagrina margaritifera
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3863.mp3	that valuable shellfish pearls result simply from mother of pearl solidifying into a globular shape either they stick to the oyster's shell or they become embedded in the creature's folds
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3864.mp3	on the valves a pearl sticks fast on the flesh it lies loose but its nucleus is always some small hard object say a sterile egg or a grain of sand
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3865.mp3	around which the mother of pearl is deposited in thin concentric layers over several years in succession can one find several pearls in the same oyster conseil asked yes my boy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3866.mp3	they even mention one oyster about which i remain dubious
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3867.mp3	ned land yelped did i say sharks i exclaimed hastily i meant one hundred fifty pearls sharks wouldn't make sense indeed conseil said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3868.mp3	but will master now tell us how one goes about extracting these pearls one proceeds in several ways and often when pearls stick to the valves fishermen even pull them loose with pliers
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3869.mp3	thus they die in the open air and by the end of ten days they've rotted sufficiently next they're immersed in huge tanks of salt water then they're opened up and washed at this point the sorters begin their twofold task
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3870.mp3	first they remove the layers of mother of pearl which are known in the industry by the names legitimate silver bastard white or bastard black
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3871.mp3	then they remove the oyster's meaty tissue boil it and finally strain it in order to extract even the smallest pearls do the prices of these pearls differ depending on their size conseil asked not only on their size i replied
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3872.mp3	but also according to their shape their water in other words their color and their orient in other words that dappled shimmering glow that makes them so delightful to the eye the finest pearls are called virgin pearls or paragons
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3873.mp3	they form in isolation within the mollusk's tissue they're white often opaque but sometimes of opalescent transparency and usually spherical or pear shaped the spherical ones are made into bracelets
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3874.mp3	the pear shaped ones into earrings and since they're the most valuable they're priced individually the other pearls that stick to the oyster's shell are more erratically shaped and are priced by weight finally classed in the lowest order
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3875.mp3	the smallest pearls are known by the name seed pearls they're priced by the measuring cup and are used mainly in the creation of embroidery for church vestments but it must be a long hard job sorting out these pearls by size
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3876.mp3	the canadian said no my friend that task is performed with eleven strainers or sieves that are pierced with different numbers of holes those pearls staying in the strainers with twenty to eighty holes are in the first order
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3877.mp3	those not slipping through the sieves pierced with one hundred to eight hundred holes are in the second order finally those pearls for which one uses strainers pierced with nine hundred to one thousand holes make up the seed pearls
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3878.mp3	how ingenious conseil said to reduce dividing and classifying pearls to a mechanical operation and could master tell us the profits brought in by harvesting these banks of pearl oysters according to sirr's book i replied

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3915.mp3	but i don't think any man ever ventured to ask mister mildmay time had done much for him in consolidating his authority and perhaps the present world is less reticent in its eagerness than it was in his younger days i doubt however
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3916.mp3	whether it is more dishonest and whether struggles were not made quite as disgraceful to the strugglers as anything that is done now you can't alter the men and you must use them the younger duke sat down and sighed over the degenerate patriotism of the age
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3917.mp3	but at last even the rattlers and robys were fixed if not satisfied and a complete list of the ministry appeared in all the newspapers though the thing had been long a doing still it had come suddenly
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3918.mp3	so that at the first proposition to form a coalition ministry the newspapers had hardly known whether to assist or to oppose the scheme there was no doubt in the minds of all these editors and contributors the teaching of a tradition that coalitions of this kind have been generally feeble
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3919.mp3	sometimes disastrous and on occasions even disgraceful when a man perhaps through a long political life has bound himself to a certain code of opinions how can he change that code at a moment
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3920.mp3	and when at the same moment together with the change he secures power patronage and pay how shall the public voice absolve him but then again men who have by the work of their lives grown into a certain position in the country
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3921.mp3	and have unconsciously but not therefore less actually made themselves indispensable either to this side in politics or to that cannot free themselves altogether from the responsibility of managing them when a period comes such as that now reached
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3922.mp3	this also the newspapers perceived and having since the commencement of the session been very loud in exposing the disgraceful collapse of government affairs could hardly refuse their support to any attempt at a feasible arrangement
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3923.mp3	when it was first known that the duke of omnium had consented to make the attempt they had both on one side and the other been loud in his praise going so far as to say that he was the only man in england who could do the work
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3924.mp3	but when the newspapers told him that he was the only man for the occasion how could he be justified in crediting himself in preference to them the work in parliament began under the new auspices with great tranquillity
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3925.mp3	and further education questions all men knew who knew anything but for the moment for the month even perhaps for the session there was to be peace with full latitude for the performance of routine duties there was so to say no opposition
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3926.mp3	and at first it seemed that one special bench in the house of commons would remain unoccupied but after a day or two on one of which mister daubeny had been seen sitting just below the gangway that gentleman returned to the place usually held by the prime minister's rival
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3927.mp3	saying with a smile that it might be for the convenience of the house that the seat should be utilised mister gresham at this time had with declared purpose asked and obtained the speaker's leave of absence and was abroad who should lead the house

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3929.mp3	was at last assigned to sir orlando drought it will never do said mister rattler to mister roby i don't mean to say anything against drought who has always been a very useful man to your party but he lacks something of the position

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3932.mp3	for myself i'd have sooner stayed out as an independent member but daubeny said that he thought i was bound to make myself useful i told the duke from the beginning said rattler that i didn't think that i could be of any service to him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3933.mp3	of course i would support him but i had been too thoroughly a party man for a new movement of this kind but he said just the same that he considered i was bound to join him i asked gresham and when gresham said so too of course i had no help for it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/3934.mp3	a meaning to a man's words exactly opposite to that which another tone would convey or if he does lie in doing so he does not know that he lies mister rattler had gone back to his old office at the treasury

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4273.mp3	but i am sorry that you did not tell me of your father's death when i came for though i was a little tired i certainly was not so tired that i should have found difficulty in doing my duty as a priest had you told me i could have performed the service before your departure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4274.mp3	as it is i shall perform the service after you have gone away and i shall stay by the body until morning i do not know what you mean by your words about the danger of staying here alone
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4275.mp3	then the other members of the family and the folk assembled in the adjoining room having been told of the priest's kind promises came to thank him after which the master of the house said now reverend sir much as we regret to leave you alone we must bid you farewell
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4276.mp3	by the rule of our village none of us can stay here after midnight we beg kind sir that you will take every care of your honorable body while we are unable to attend upon you and if you happen to hear or see anything strange during our absence please tell us of the matter when we return in the morning
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4277.mp3	all then left the house except the priest who went to the room where the dead body was lying the usual offerings had been set before the corpse and a small buddhist lamp tomyo was burning
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4278.mp3	the priest recited the service and performed the funeral ceremonies after which he entered into meditation so meditating he remained through several silent hours and there was no sound in the deserted village
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4279.mp3	but when the hush of the night was at its deepest there noiselessly entered a shape vague and vast and in the same moment muso found himself without power to move or speak
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4280.mp3	he saw that shape lift the corpse as with hands devour it more quickly than a cat devours a rat beginning at the head and eating everything the hair and the bones and even the shroud and the monstrous thing having thus consumed the body
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4281.mp3	turned to the offerings and ate them also then it went away as mysteriously as it had come when the villagers returned next morning they found the priest awaiting them at the door of the headman's dwelling all in turn saluted him and when they had entered
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4282.mp3	and looked about the room no one expressed any surprise at the disappearance of the dead body and the offerings but the master of the house said to muso reverent sir you have probably seen unpleasant things during the night
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4283.mp3	all of us were anxious about you but now we are very happy to find you alive and unharmed gladly we would have stayed with you if it had been possible but the law of our village as i told you last evening obliges us to quit our houses after a death has taken place
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4284.mp3	and to leave the corpse alone whenever this law has been broken heretofore some great misfortune has followed whenever it is obeyed we find that the corpse and the offerings disappear during our absence perhaps you have seen the cause
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4285.mp3	then muso told of the dim and awful shape that had entered the death chamber to devour the body and the offerings no person seemed to be surprised by his narration and the master of the house observed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4286.mp3	what you have told us reverend sir agrees with what has been said about this matter from ancient time muso then inquired does not the priest on the hill sometimes perform the funeral service for your dead what priest the young man asked
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4287.mp3	the priest who yesterday evening directed me to this village answered muso i called at his anjitsu on the hill yonder he refused me lodging but told me the way here the listeners looked at each other as in astonishment
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4288.mp3	and after a moment of silence the master of the house said reverend sir there is no priest and there is no anjitsu on the hill for the time of many generations there has not been any resident priest in this neighborhood muso said nothing more on the subject
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4289.mp3	for it was evident that his kind hosts supposed him to have been deluded by some goblin but after having bidden them farewell and obtained all necessary information as to his road he determined to look again for the hermitage on the hill and so to ascertain whether he had really been deceived
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4290.mp3	and this time its aged occupant invited him to enter when he had done so the hermit humbly bowed down before him exclaiming ah i am ashamed i am very much ashamed i am exceedingly ashamed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4291.mp3	you need not be ashamed for having refused me shelter said muso you directed me to the village yonder where i was very kindly treated and i thank you for that favor i can give no man shelter the recluse made answer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4292.mp3	so in that time the bodies of the mountain folk who died used to be brought here sometimes from great distances in order that i might repeat over them the holy service but i repeated the service and performed the rites only as a matter of business
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4293.mp3	i thought only of the food and the clothes that my sacred profession enabled me to gain and because of this selfish impiety i was reborn immediately after my death into the state of a jikininki
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4294.mp3	since then i have been obliged to feed upon the corpses of the people who die in this district every one of them i must devour in the way that you saw last night now reverend sir
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4295.mp3	help me by your prayers i entreat you so that i may be soon able to escape from this horrible state of existence no sooner had the hermit uttered this petition than he disappeared and the hermitage also disappeared at the same instant
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4296.mp3	even to day in the courts of certain japanese temples you may see heaps of old bronze mirrors contributed for such a purpose the largest collection of this kind that i ever saw was in the court of a temple of the jodo sect at hakata in kyushu
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4297.mp3	who presented her mirror to the temple to be used for bell metal but afterwards she much regretted her mirror she remembered things that her mother had told her about it and she remembered that it had belonged not only to her mother but to her mother's mother and grandmother and she remembered some happy smiles which it had reflected
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4298.mp3	but she had not the money necessary whenever she went to the temple she saw her mirror lying in the court yard behind a railing among hundreds of other mirrors heaped there together she knew it by the sho chiku bai in relief on the back of it those three fortunate emblems of pine bamboo and plumflower
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4299.mp3	which delighted her baby eyes when her mother first showed her the mirror she longed for some chance to steal the mirror and hide it that she might thereafter treasure it always but the chance did not come and she became very unhappy felt as if she had foolishly given away a part of her life
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4300.mp3	a saying mystically expressed by the chinese character for soul upon the backs of many bronze mirrors and she feared that it was true in weirder ways than she had before imagined but she could not dare to speak of her pain to anybody
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4301.mp3	evidently the woman who had given that mirror to the temple must have regretted the giving she had not presented her offering with all her heart and therefore her selfish soul remaining attached to the mirror kept it hard and cold in the midst of the furnace
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4302.mp3	of course everybody heard of the matter and everybody soon knew whose mirror it was that would not melt and because of this public exposure of her secret fault the poor woman became very much ashamed and very angry and as she could not bear the shame she drowned herself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4303.mp3	after having written a farewell letter containing these words when i am dead it will not be difficult to melt the mirror and to cast the bell but to the person who breaks that bell by ringing it great wealth will be given by the ghost of me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4304.mp3	but the bell proved to be a good bell and it bravely withstood their assaults nevertheless the people were not easily discouraged day after day at all hours they continued to ring the bell furiously caring nothing whatever for the protests of the priests
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4305.mp3	so the ringing became an affliction and the priests could not endure it and they got rid of the bell by rolling it down the hill into a swamp the swamp was deep and swallowed it up and that was the end of the bell
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4306.mp3	or bell of mugen now there are queer old japanese beliefs in the magical efficacy of a certain mental operation implied though not described by the verb
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4307.mp3	the word itself cannot be adequately rendered by any english word for it is used in relation to many kinds of mimetic magic as well as in relation to the performance of many religious acts of faith
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4308.mp3	to compare to liken but the esoteric meaning is to substitute in imagination one object or action for another so as to bring about some magical or miraculous result
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4309.mp3	for example you cannot afford to build a buddhist temple but you can easily lay a pebble before the image of the buddha with the same pious feeling that would prompt you to build a temple if you were rich enough to build one the merit of so offering the pebble becomes equal or almost equal to the merit of erecting a temple
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4310.mp3	you cannot read the six thousand seven hundred and seventy one volumes of the buddhist texts but you can make a revolving library containing them turn round by pushing it like a windlass
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4311.mp3	so much will perhaps suffice to explain the religious meanings of nazoraeru the magical meanings could not all be explained without a great variety of examples but for present purposes the following will serve if you should make a little man of straw
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4312.mp3	for the same reason that sister helen made a little man of wax and nail it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4313.mp3	that would illustrate one signification of nazoraeru or let us suppose that a robber has entered your house during the night and carried away your valuables if you can discover the footprints of that robber in your garden and then promptly burn a very large moxa on each of them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4314.mp3	the soles of the feet of the robber will become inflamed and will allow him no rest until he returns of his own accord to put himself at your mercy that is another kind of mimetic magic expressed by the term nazoraeru
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4315.mp3	after the bell had been rolled into the swamp there was of course no more chance of ringing it in such wise as to break it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4316.mp3	but persons who regretted this loss of opportunity would strike and break objects imaginatively substituted for the bell thus hoping to please the spirit of the owner of the mirror that had made so much trouble one of these persons was a woman called umegae
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4317.mp3	while the pair were traveling together kajiwara one day found himself in great straits for want of money and umegae remembering the tradition of the bell of mugen took a basin of bronze and mentally representing it to be the bell beat upon it until she broke it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4318.mp3	crying out at the same time for three hundred pieces of gold a guest of the inn where the pair were stopping
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4319.mp3	afterwards a song was made about umegae's basin of bronze and that song is sung by dancing girls even to this day umegae no chozubachi tataite
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4320.mp3	if by striking upon the wash basin of umegae i could make honorable money come to me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4321.mp3	became great and many people followed the example of umegae thereby hoping to emulate her luck
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4322.mp3	as it deserves to be answered take therefore this jar so saying she put the jar into his hands and disappeared into his house the happy man rushed to tell his wife the good news he set down in front of her the covered jar which was heavy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4323.mp3	and they opened it together and they found that it was filled up to the very brim with
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4324.mp3	all the capacities of a daring and skillful soldier
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4325.mp3	but as he had never sought distinction for his own sake alone and as his heart remained true to his former lord he preferred to give up the world so he cut off his hair and became a traveling priest taking the buddhist name of kwairyo
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4326.mp3	as in other years he had laughed at peril so now also he scorned danger
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4327.mp3	so he resigned himself to pass the night under the stars and having found a suitable grassy spot by the roadside he lay down there and prepared to sleep
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4328.mp3	he had always welcomed discomfort and even a bare rock was for him a good bed when nothing better could be found and the root of a pine tree an excellent pillow his body was iron and he never troubled himself about dews or rain or frost or snow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4329.mp3	scarcely had he lain down when a man came along the road carrying an axe and a great bundle of chopped wood this woodcutter halted on seeing kwairyo lying down
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4330.mp3	and after a moment of silent observation said to him in a tone of great surprise what kind of a man can you be good sir that you dare to lie down alone in such a place as this there are haunters about here many of them are you not afraid of hairy things
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4331.mp3	my friend cheerfully answered kwairyo i am only a wandering priest a cloud and water guest as folks call it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4332.mp3	as for lonesome places i like them they are suitable for meditation i am accustomed to sleeping in the open air and i have learned never to be anxious about my life
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4333.mp3	to lie down here this place has a bad name a very bad name but as the proverb has it kunshi ayayuki ni chikayorazu the superior man does not needlessly expose himself to peril
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4334.mp3	and i must assure you sir that it is very dangerous to sleep here therefore although my house is only a wretched thatched hut let me beg of you to come home with me at once in the way of food i have nothing to offer you but there is a roof at least and you can sleep under it without risk
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4335.mp3	accepted this modest offer the woodcutter guided him along a narrow path leading up from the main road through mountain forest it was a rough and dangerous path sometimes skirting precipices sometimes offering nothing but a network of
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4336.mp3	slippery roots for the foot to rest upon sometimes winding over or between masses of jagged rock but at last kwairyo found himself upon a cleared space at the top of a hill with a full moon shining overhead and he saw before him a small thatched cottage
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4337.mp3	and they must have been taught by some one well acquainted with the rules of propriety then turning to his host the aruji or house master as the others called him kwairyo said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4338.mp3	from the kindness of your speech and from the very polite welcome given me by your household i imagine that you have not always been a woodcutter perhaps you formerly belonged to one of the upper classes smiling the woodcutter answered sir you are not mistaken
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4339.mp3	though now living as you find me i was once a person of some distinction my story is the story of a ruined life ruined by my own fault i used to be in the service of a daimyo and my rank in that service was not inconsiderable
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4340.mp3	but i loved women and wine too well and under the influence of passion i acted wickedly
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4341.mp3	retribution followed me and i long remained a fugitive in the land now i often pray that i may be able to make some atonement for the evil which i did and to reestablish the ancestral home but i fear that i shall never find any way of so doing
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4342.mp3	kwairyo was pleased by this announcement of good resolve and he said to the aruji my friend i have had occasion to observe that man prone to folly in their youth may in after years become very earnest in right living
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4343.mp3	in the holy sutras it is written that those strongest in wrong doing can become by power of good resolve the strongest in right doing i do not doubt that you have a good heart and i hope that better fortune will come to you
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4344.mp3	to night i shall recite the sutras for your sake and pray that you may obtain the force to overcome the karma of any past errors with these assurances kwairyo bade the aruji good night and his host showed him to a very small side room where a bed had been made ready
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4345.mp3	then all went to sleep except the priest who began to read the sutras by the light of a paper lantern until a late hour he continued to read and pray
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4346.mp3	the night was beautiful there was no cloud in the sky there was no wind and the strong moonlight threw down sharp black shadows of foliage and glittered on the dews of the garden
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4347.mp3	and the sound of the neighboring cascade deepened with the night kwairyo felt thirsty as he listened to the noise of the water and remembering the bamboo aqueduct at the rear of the house he thought that he could go there and get a drink without disturbing the sleeping household
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4348.mp3	very gently he pushed apart the sliding screens that separated his room from the main apartment and he saw by the light of the lantern five recumbent bodies without heads
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4349.mp3	for one instant he stood bewildered imagining a crime but in another moment he perceived that there was no blood and that the headless necks did not look as if they had been cut then he thought to himself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4350.mp3	and remove the body to another place the head will never be able to join itself again to the neck and the book further says that when the head comes back and finds that its body has been moved it will strike itself upon the floor three times bounding like a ball and will pant as in great fear
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4351.mp3	and presently die now if these be rokuro kubi they mean me no good so i shall be justified in following the instructions of the book he seized the body of the aruji by the feet pulled it to the window and pushed it out
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4352.mp3	gently unbarring the door he made his way to the garden and proceeded with all possible caution to the grove beyond it he heard voices talking in the grove and he went in the direction of the voices stealing from shadow to shadow until he reached a good hiding place
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4353.mp3	then from behind a trunk he caught sight of the heads all five of them flitting about and chatting as they flitted they were eating worms and insects which they found on the ground or among the trees
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4354.mp3	presently the head of the aruji stopped eating and said ah that traveling priest who came to night how fat all his body is when we shall have eaten him our bellies will be well filled i was foolish to talk to him as i did
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4355.mp3	to go near him while he is reciting would be difficult and we cannot touch him so long as he is praying but as it is now nearly morning perhaps he has gone to sleep some one of you go to the house and see what the fellow is doing
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4356.mp3	another head the head of a young woman immediately rose up and flitted to the house lightly as a bat after a few minutes it came back and cried out huskily in a tone of great alarm that traveling priest is not in the house he is gone but that is not the worst of the matter
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4357.mp3	he has taken the body of our aruji and i do not know where he has put it at this announcement the head of the aruji distinctly visible in the moonlight assumed a frightful aspect its eyes opened monstrously its hair stood up bristling and its teeth gnashed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4358.mp3	since my body has been moved to rejoin it is not possible then i must die and all through the work of that priest
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4359.mp3	and there he is behind that tree hiding behind that tree see him the fat coward in the same moment the head of the aruji followed by the other four heads sprang at kwairyo
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4360.mp3	but the strong priest had already armed himself by plucking up a young tree and with that tree he struck the heads as they came knocking them from him with tremendous blows four of them fled away but the head of the aruji though battered again and again desperately continued to bound at the priest
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4361.mp3	and at last caught him by the left sleeve of his robe kwairyo however as quickly gripped the head by its topknot and repeatedly struck it it did not release its hold but it uttered a long moan and thereafter ceased to struggle it was dead
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4362.mp3	but its teeth still held the sleeve and for all his great strength kwairyo could not force open the jaws with the head still hanging to his sleeve he went back to the house and there caught sight of the other four rokuro kubi squatting together
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4363.mp3	with their bruised and bleeding heads reunited to their bodies but when they perceived him at the back door all screamed the priest the priest and fled through the other doorway out into the woods eastward the sky was brightening day was about to dawn
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4364.mp3	and kwairyo knew that the power of the goblins was limited to the hours of darkness he looked at the head clinging to his sleeve its face all fouled with blood and foam and clay and he laughed aloud as he thought to himself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4365.mp3	after which he gathered together his few belongings and leisurely descended the mountain to continue his journey right on he journeyed until he came to suwa
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4366.mp3	seized the priest and took him to jail for they supposed the head to be the head of a murdered man who in the moment of being killed had caught the murderer's sleeve in his teeth as the kwairyo he only smiled and said nothing when they questioned him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4367.mp3	so after having passed a night in prison he was brought before the magistrates of the district then he was ordered to explain how he a priest had been found with the head of a man fastened to his sleeve and why he had dared thus shamelessly to parade his crime in the sight of people
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4368.mp3	kwairyo laughed long and loudly at these questions and then he said sirs i did not fasten the head to my sleeve it fastened itself there much against my will and i have not committed any crime for this is not the head of a man it is the head of a goblin
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4369.mp3	but the magistrates did not laugh they judged him to be a hardened criminal and his story an insult to their intelligence therefore without further questioning they decided to order his immediate execution all of them except one

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4371.mp3	the old man turned it round and round carefully examined it and discovered on the nape of its neck several strange red characters he called the attention of his colleagues to these and also bade them observe that the edges of the neck nowhere presented the appearance of having been cut by any weapon

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4480.mp3	the mask seemed to increase the reckless diablerie of its wearer and enhance the fairness of the complexion while it added an air of mystery not at all unpleasing to the eye a few days later i dispatched it to the academy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4481.mp3	and waited patiently for the opening day when i experienced the mingled surprise and satisfaction of seeing it hung upon the line

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4484.mp3	i saw that he was haggard eyed and wild looking from his conversation i knew that time had not healed the wound in his heart i shall never be able to thank you sufficiently old chap for touching up my daub

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4500.mp3	and finds a fair margin of profit in shoving it there's a chance for everything you have learned from latin to poetry in the packing business though we don't use much poetry here except in our street car ads
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4501.mp3	and about the only time our products are given latin names is when the state board of health condemns them so i think you'll find it safe to go short a little on the frills of education if you want them bad enough you'll find a way to pick them up later after business hours
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4502.mp3	but i wanted you to form good mental habits just as i want you to have clean straight physical ones because i was run through a threshing machine when i was a boy and didn't begin to get the straw out of my hair till i was past thirty
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4503.mp3	i haven't any sympathy with a lot of these old fellows who go around bragging of their ignorance and saying that boys don't need to know anything except addition and the best policy brand of honesty we started in a mighty different world and we were all ignorant together
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4504.mp3	the lord let us in on the ground floor gave us corner lots and then started in to improve the adjacent property we didn't have to know fractions to figure out our profits now a merchant needs astronomy to see them and when he locates them they are out somewhere near the fifth decimal place
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4505.mp3	and there're just as many chances for a fellow as ever but they're a little gun shy and you can't catch them by any such coarse method as putting salt on their tails thirty years ago you could take an old muzzle loader and knock over plenty of ducks in the city limits
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4506.mp3	and chicago wasn't cook county then either you can get them still but you've got to go to kankakee and take a hammerless along and when i started in the packing business it was all straight sailing no frills just turning hogs into hog meat
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4507.mp3	dry salt for the niggers down south and sugar cured for the white folks up north everything else was sausage or thrown away but when we get through with a hog nowadays he's scattered through a hundred different cans and packages and he's all accounted for what we used to throw away is our profit
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4508.mp3	it takes doctors lawyers engineers poets and i don't know what to run the business and i reckon that improvements which call for parsons will be creeping in next naturally a young man who expects to hold his own when he is thrown in with a lot of men like these
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4509.mp3	must be as clean and sharp as a hound's tooth or some other fellow's simply going to eat him up the first college man i ever hired was old john durham's son jim that was a good many years ago when the house was a much smaller affair
