https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4787.mp3	it was with no slight sense of relief that we paid our modest bill and at last broke away from such ghastly associations an involuntary shudder overcame me as we passed the head of the island
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4788.mp3	at the foot of our host's orchard which he had described as a catch basin for human floaters our course still lay among large densely wooded islands many of them wholly given up to maples and willows
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4789.mp3	and deep cuts through sun baked mudbanks the color of adobe but occasionally there are low gloomy bottoms heavily forested and strewn with flood wood while beyond the land rises gradually into prairie stretches
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4790.mp3	in the bottoms the trees are filled with flocks of birds crows hawks blackbirds with stately blue herons and agile plovers foraging on the long gravel spits which frequently jut far into the stream
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4791.mp3	ducks are frequently seen sailing near the shores while divers silently dart and plunge ahead of the canoe safely out of gunshot reach a head wind this morning made rowing more difficult by counteracting the influence of the current
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4792.mp3	we were at lyndon at eleven o'clock there is a population of about two hundred clustered around a red paper mill the latter made a pretty picture standing out on the bold bank backed by a number of huge stacks of golden straw
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4793.mp3	we met here the first rapids worthy of record also an old abandoned mill dam in the last stages of decay stretching its whitened skeleton across the stream a harbor for driftwood
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4794.mp3	near the south bank the framework has been entirely swept away for a space several rods in width and through this opening the pent up current fiercely sweeps we went through the centre of the channel thus made with a swoop
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4795.mp3	that gave us an impetus which soon carried our vessel out of sight of lyndon and its paper mill and straw stacks prophetstown five miles below is prettily situated in an oak grove on the southern bank
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4796.mp3	only the gables of a few houses can be seen from the river whose banks of yellow clay and brown mud are here twenty five feet high during the first third of the present century this place was the site of a winnebago village whose chief
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4797.mp3	was white cloud a shrewd sinister savage half winnebago and half sac who claimed to be a prophet he was black hawk's evil genius during the uprising of eighteen thirty two and in many ways
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4798.mp3	was one of the most remarkable aborigines known to illinois history it was at the prophet's town as white cloud's village was known in pioneer days that black hawk rested upon his ill fated journey up the rock and from here
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4799.mp3	at the instigation of the wizard he bade the united states soldiery defiance there are rapids almost continually from a mile above prophetstown to erie ten miles below the river bed here has a sharper descent than customary
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4800.mp3	and is thickly strewn with bowlders many of them were visible above the surface at the low stage of water which we found but for the greater part they were covered for two or three inches what with these impediments
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4801.mp3	the snags that had been left as the legacy of last spring's flood and the frequent sand banks and gravel spits navigation was attended by many difficulties and some dangers four or five miles below prophetstown
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4802.mp3	a lone fisherman engaged in examining a traut line stretched between one of the numerous gloomy islands and the mainland kindly informed us of a mile long cut off the mouth of which was now in view that would save us several miles of rowing
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4803.mp3	here the high banks had receded with several miles of heavily wooded boggy bottoms intervening floods had held high carnival and the aspect of the country was wild and deserted the cut off was an ugly looking channel
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4804.mp3	but where our informant had gone through with his unwieldy hulk we considered it safe to venture with a canoe so readily responsive to the slightest paddle stroke
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4805.mp3	it was a scene of howling desolation rack and ruin upon every hand the muddy torrent at a velocity of fully eight miles an hour went eddying and whirling and darting and roaring among the gnarled and blackened stumps the prostrate trees
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4806.mp3	the twisted roots the huge bowlders which studded its course the stream was not wide enough for the oars the paddle was the sole reliance with eyes strained for obstructions we turned and twisted through the labyrinth
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4807.mp3	jumping along at a breakneck speed and when we finally rejoined the main river below were grateful enough for the run had been filled with continuous possibilities of a disastrous smash up miles away from any human habitation
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4808.mp3	the thunder storm which had been threatening since early morning soon burst upon us with a preliminary wind blast followed by drenching rain running ashore on the lee bank we wrapped the canvas awning around the baggage
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4809.mp3	and made for a thick clump of trees on the top of an island mudbank where we stood buttoned to the neck in rubber coats a vigorous halloo came sounding over the water looking up we saw for the first time a small tent on the opposite shore
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4810.mp3	a quarter of a mile away in front of which was a man shouting to us and beckoning us over it was getting uncomfortably muddy under the trees which had not long sufficed as an umbrella and the rubber coats were not warranted to withstand a deluge
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4811.mp3	so we accepted the invitation with alacrity and paddled over through the pelting storm our host was a young fisherman who helped us and our luggage up the slimy bank to his canvas quarters which we found to be dry although odorous of fish
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4812.mp3	while the storm raged without the young man who was a simple hearted fellow confided to us the details of his brief career he had been married but a year he said his little cabin lay a quarter of a mile back in the woods
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4813.mp3	and so as to be convenient to his lines he was camping on his own wood lot the greater part of his time was spent in fishing or hunting according to the season and peddling the product in neighboring towns
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4814.mp3	which had recently become enriched by the addition of an infant son the phenomenal powers of observation displayed by this first born youth were reported with much detail by the fond father who sat crouched upon a boat sail in one corner of the little tent
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4815.mp3	his head between his knees and smoking vile tobacco in a blackened clay pipe it seemed that his wife was a ferryman's daughter and her father had besought his son in law to follow the same steady calling to be sure our host declared ferries on the rock river netted their owners
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4816.mp3	which he considered a goodly sum and his father in law had offered to purchase an established plant for him but the young fellow said that ferrying was a dog's life and kept a feller home like barn chores
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4817.mp3	so rejected the offer and settled down avowedly for life in his present precarious occupation as a result the indignant old man had forbidden him to again enter the parental ferry house until he agreed to accept his proposals
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4818.mp3	and there was henceforth to be a standing family quarrel the fisherman having appealed to my judgment i endeavored with mild caution to argue him out of his position on the score of consideration for his wife and little one
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4819.mp3	and firmly though with admirable good nature persisted in defending his roving tendencies in the course of our conversation i learned that the ferrymen who are more numerous on the lower than on the upper rock pay an annual license fee of five dollars each
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4820.mp3	in consideration of which they are guarantied a monopoly of the business at their stands no other line being allowed within one mile of an existing ferry within an hour and a half the storm had apparently passed over and we continued our journey
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4821.mp3	but after supper another shower and a stiff head wind came up and we were well bedraggled by the time a ferry landing near the little village of erie was reached the bottoms are here a mile or two in width with occasional openings in the woods
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4822.mp3	where small fields are cultivated by the poorer class of farmers who were last spring much damaged by the flood which swept this entire country the ferryman a good natured young athlete
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4823.mp3	was landing a farm wagon and team as we pulled in upon the muddy roadway when questioned about quarters he smiled and pointing to his little cabin a few rods off in the bushes said we've four people to sleep in two rooms
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4824.mp3	it's sure we can't take ye i'd like to otherwise but erie's only a mile away we assured him that with these muddy swamp roads and in our wet condition nothing but absolute necessity would induce us to take a mile's tramp the parley
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4825.mp3	ended in our being directed to a small farm house a quarter of a mile inland where luckless travelers belated on the dreary bottoms were occasionally kept making the canoe fast for the night we strung our baggage packs upon the paddle which we carried between us
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4826.mp3	and set out along a devious way through a driving mist which blackened the twilight into dusk to find this place of public entertainment it is a little one story dilapidated farm house
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4827.mp3	standing a short distance from the country road amid a clump of poplar trees forcing our way through the hingeless gate the violent removal of which threatened the immediate destruction of several lengths of rickety fence
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4828.mp3	we walked up to the open front door and applied for shelter yes ma'am we sometimes keeps tavern ma'am replied a large greasy looking black haired woman of some forty years
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4829.mp3	as her hands folded within her up turned apron she courtesied to w we were at once shown into a frowsy apartment which served as parlor sitting room and parental dormitory
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4830.mp3	and cheap decorations peculiar in the country to all three classes of rooms the evidences of poverty shiftlessness and untasteful pretentiousness upon every side
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4831.mp3	a huge wheezy old cabinet organ was set diagonally in one corner and upon this as we entered a young woman was pounding and paddling with much vigor while giving us sidelong glances of curiosity
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4832.mp3	she was a neighbor on an evening visit decked out in a smart jockey cap with a green ostrich tip and bright blue ribbons and gay in a new calico dress
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4833.mp3	a yellow field thickly planted to purple pineapples a jaunty forward creature in pimples and curls she rattled away through a moody and sankey hymn book the wheezes and groans of the antique instrument
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4834.mp3	coming in like mournful ejaculations from the amen corner at a successful revival having exhausted her stock of tunes she wheeled around upon her stool and after declaring to her half dozen admiring auditors that her hands
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4835.mp3	were as tired as after the mornin's milkin abruptly accosted w ma'am kin ye play on the orgin w confessed her inability chiefly from lack of practice in the art of incessantly working the pedals
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4836.mp3	that's the trick o the hul business ma'am is the blowin it's all in gettin the bellers to work even like there's a good many what kin learn the playin part of it without no teacher but there has to be lessons to learn the bellers
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4837.mp3	w modestly confessed to never having possessed such an instrument down in these parts rejoined the young woman as she worked the bellers into a strain or two of hold the fort apparently to show how easy it came to trained feet

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4840.mp3	necessitating the use of the bed as a dressing place after the fashion of a sleeping car bunk this cubby hole of a room was also the wardrobe for the women of the household the walls above the bed being hung nearly two feet deep
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4841.mp3	with the oddest collection of calico and gingham gowns bustles hoopskirts hats bonnets and winter underwear i think i had ever laid eyes on much of this condition of affairs was not known however until next morning

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4843.mp3	than the creaky old cleat door was gently closed upon us and buttoned by our hostess upon the outside as the only means of keeping it shut and we were left free to grope about among these mysteries as best we might
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4844.mp3	we had hardly recovered from our astonishment at thus being locked into a dark hole the size of a fashionable lady's trunk and were quietly laughing over this odd adventure when the landlady applied her mouth to a crack and shouted as if she would have waked the dead hi there

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4847.mp3	there never was a prouder mamma than madam cluck when she led forth her family of eight downy little chicks chanticleer strut snowball speckle peep peck downy and blot were their names
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4848.mp3	and no sooner were they out of the shell than they began to chirp and scratch as gaily as if the big world in which they suddenly found themselves was made for their especial benefit it was a fine brood
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4849.mp3	but poor madam cluck had bad luck with her chicks for they were her first and she didn't know how to manage them old aunt cockletop told her that she didn't and predicted that those poor dears would come to bad ends
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4850.mp3	aunt cockletop was right as you will see when i have told the sad history of this unfortunate family the tragedy began with chanty who was the boldest little cockadoodle who ever tried to crow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4851.mp3	before he had a feather to his bit of a tail chanty began to fight and soon was known as the most quarrelsome chick in the farm yard having pecked his brothers and sisters he tried to do the same to his playmates
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4852.mp3	the ducklings goslings and young turkeys and was so disagreeable that all the fowls hated him one day a pair of bantams arrived pretty little white birds with red crests and nice yellow feet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4853.mp3	chanty thought he could beat mister bantam easily he was so small and invited him to fight mister b declined then chanty called him a coward and gave missus b a peck
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4854.mp3	which ended in chanty's utter defeat for he died from his wounds downy and snowball soon followed for the two sweet little things would swing on the burdock leaves that grew over the brook
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4855.mp3	sitting side by side the plump sisters were placidly swaying up and down over the clear brown water rippling below when ah sad to relate the stem broke and down went leaf

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4858.mp3	what a nice time speckle did have to be sure for the grasshoppers were lively and fat and aunt was in an unusually amiable mood never run away from anything but face danger and conquer it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4859.mp3	like a brave chick said the old biddy as she went clucking through the grass with her gray turban wagging in the wind speckle had hopped away from a toad with a startled chirp which caused aunt to utter that remark

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4863.mp3	for every fowl in the yard twitted her with the difference between her preaching and her practice
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4864.mp3	he was at it from morning till night and everyone was tired to death of hearing his shrill small voice making funny attempts to produce hoarse little crows as he sat on the wall and stretched his yellow neck
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4865.mp3	till his throat quite ached with the effort ah if i could only fly to the highest beam in the barn and give a splendid crow that everyone could hear i should be perfectly happy said this silly little fowl
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4866.mp3	so he tried every day to fly and crow and at last managed to get up then how he did strut and rustle his feathers while his playmates sat below and watched him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4867.mp3	you'll fall and get hurt said his sister blot hold your tongue you ugly little thing and don't talk to me i'm going to crow and can't be interrupted by any silly bit of a hen be quiet down there
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4868.mp3	and hear if i can't do it as well as daddy the chicks stopped scratching and peeping and sat in a row to hear strut crow perching himself on the beam he tried his best
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4869.mp3	came of it and all the chicks laughed that made strut mad and he resolved to crow even if he killed himself doing it he gave an angry cluck flapped his wings and tried again alas alas
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4870.mp3	for poor strut he leaned so far forward in his frantic effort to get a big crow out that he toppled over and fell bump on the hard barn floor killing himself instantly
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4871.mp3	for some time after this missus cluck kept her three remaining little ones close to her side watching over them with maternal care till they were heartily tired of her anxious cluckings peep and peck were always together
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4872.mp3	being very fond of one another peep was a most inquisitive chicken poking her head into every nook and corner and never satisfied till she had seen all there was to see peck was a glutton
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4873.mp3	eating everything she could find and often making herself ill by gobbling too fast and forgetting to eat a little gravel to help digest her food don't go out of the barn children i'm going to lay an egg
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4874.mp3	and can't look after you just now said their mother one day yes ma'am chirped the chickens and then as she went rustling into the hay mow they began to run about and enjoy themselves with all their might
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4875.mp3	peep found a little hole into the meal room and slipped in full of joy at the sight of the bags boxes and bins i'll eat all i want and then i'll call peck she said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4876.mp3	and having taken a taste of every thing she was about to leave when she heard the stableman coming and in her fright couldn't find the hole so flew into the meal bin and hid herself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4877.mp3	sam never saw her but shut down the cover of the bin as he passed and left poor peep to die no one knew what had become of her till some days later when she was found dead in the meal
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4878.mp3	with her poor little claws sticking straight up as if imploring help peck meanwhile got into mischief also
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4879.mp3	she strayed into the sheep shed and finding some salt ate as much as she liked not knowing that salt is bad for hens having taken all she wanted she ran back to the barn
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4880.mp3	and was innocently catching gnats when her mamma came out of the hay mow with a loud cut cut cut

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4882.mp3	there peck stopped suddenly rolled up her eyes and began to stagger about as if she was tipsy mercy on us what's the matter with the chick cried missus cluck in great alarm fits ma'am answered doctor drake
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4883.mp3	who just then waddled by oh what can i do screamed the distracted hen nothing ma'am it's fatal and the doctor waddled on to visit dame partlet's son who was ill of the pip my child my child
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4884.mp3	don't flap and stagger so let me hold you taste this mint leaf have a drop of water what shall i do as poor missus cluck sighed and sobbed her unhappy child went scuffling about on her back
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4885.mp3	gasping and rolling up her eyes in great anguish for she had eaten too much of the fatal salt and there was no help for her when all was over they buried the dead chicken under a currant bush covered the little grave with chickweed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4886.mp3	and the bereaved parent wore a black string round her leg for a month blot the last of that bright band needed no mourning for she was as black as a crow this was the reason why her mother never
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4887.mp3	had loved her as much as she did the others who were all white gray or yellow poor little blot had been much neglected by every one but now her lonely mamma discovered how good and affectionate a chicken she was
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4888.mp3	for blot was a great comfort to her never running away or disobeying in any way but always close to her side ready to creep under her wing or bring her a plump bug when the poor biddy's appetite failed her
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4889.mp3	they were very happy together till thanksgiving drew near when a dreadful pestilence seemed to sweep through the farm yard for turkeys hens ducks and geese fell a prey to it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4890.mp3	and were seen by their surviving relatives featherless pale and stiff borne away to some unknown place whence no fowl returned blot was waked one night by a great cackling and fluttering in the hen house
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4891.mp3	and peeping down from her perch saw a great hand glide along the roost clutch her beloved mother by the leg and pull her off screaming dolefully
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4892.mp3	aunt cockletop pecked and croaked fiercely but tough as she was the old biddy did not escape and many another amiable hen and gallant cockadoodle fell a victim to that mysterious hand
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4893.mp3	in the morning few remained and blot felt that she was a forlorn orphan a thought which caused her to sit with her head under her wing for several hours brooding over her sad lot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4894.mp3	and longing to join her family in some safe and happy land where fowls live in peace she had her wish very soon for one day when the first snowflakes began to flutter
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4895.mp3	blot saw a little kitten mewing pitifully as it sat under the fence what is the matter dear asked kind blot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4896.mp3	i live at the red farm house over the hill only i don't know which road to take i'll show you come at once for night is coming on and the snow will soon be too deep for us said blot so away they went
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4897.mp3	but it was a long way and dusk came on before the red farm house appeared now i'm safe thank you very much won't you come in and stay all night my mother will be glad to see you
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4898.mp3	said the kit rubbing her soft white face against blot's little black breast
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4899.mp3	so good by dear and off trotted blot along the snowy road hoping to get home before the hen house door was shut faster and faster fell the snow darker and darker grew the night
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4900.mp3	and colder and colder became poor blot's little feet as she waded through the drifts the firelight was shining out into the gloom
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4901.mp3	to find all doors shut and no shelter left for her but the bough of a leafless tree too stiff and weak to fly up she crept as close as possible to the bright glow which shone across the door step
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4902.mp3	and with a shiver put her little head under her wing trying to forget hunger weariness and the bitter cold and wait patiently for morning but when morning came little blot lay frozen stiff under a coverlet of snow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4903.mp3	being alone in london yet wishing to celebrate the day i decided to pay my respects to the lions at the zoological gardens a lovely place it was and i enjoyed myself immensely for may day in england is just what it should be
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4904.mp3	mild sunny flowery and spring like as i walked along the well kept paths between white and rosy hawthorn hedges i kept coming upon new and curious sights
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4905.mp3	for the birds and beasts are so skilfully arranged that it is more like travelling through a strange and pleasant country than visiting a menagerie the first thing i saw was a great american bison
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4906.mp3	and i was so glad to meet with any one from home that i'd have patted him with pleasure if he had shown any cordiality toward me he didn't however
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4907.mp3	and put down his immense head with a sullen snort as if he'd have tossed me with great satisfaction i did not blame him for the poor fellow was homesick doubtless for his own wide prairies and the free life he had lost
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4908.mp3	so i threw him some fresh clover and went on to the pelicans i never knew before what handsome birds they were not graceful but with such snowy plumage tinged with pale pink and faint yellow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4909.mp3	they had just had their bath and stood arranging their feathers with their great bills
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4910.mp3	when fed they gobbled up the fish never stopping to swallow it till the pouches under their bills were full then they leisurely emptied them and seemed to enjoy their lunch with the grave deliberation of regular englishmen
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4911.mp3	and there found a splendid sight six lions and lionesses in three or four different cages sitting or standing in dignified attitudes and eyeing the spectators with a mild expression in their fine eyes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4912.mp3	one lioness was ill and lay on her bed looking very pensive while her mate moved restlessly about her evidently anxious to do something for her and much afflicted by her suffering
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4913.mp3	i liked this lion very much for though the biggest he was very gentle and had a noble face the tigers were rushing about as tigers usually are some creeping noiselessly to and fro
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4914.mp3	some leaping up and down and some washing their faces with their velvet paws all looked and acted so like cats that i wasn't at all surprised to hear one of them purr when the keeper scratched her head
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4915.mp3	it was a very loud and large purr but no fireside pussy could have done it better and every one laughed at the sound there were pretty spotted leopards panthers and smaller varieties of the same species
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4916.mp3	i sat watching them a long time longing to let some of the wild things out for a good run they seemed so unhappy barred in those small dens suddenly the lions began to roar the tigers to snarl
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4917.mp3	and all to get very much excited about something sniffing at the openings thrusting their paws through the bars and lashing their tails impatiently i couldn't imagine what the trouble was till
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4918.mp3	this was their dinner and as they were fed but once a day they were ravenous such roars and howls and cries as arose while the man went slowly down the line
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4919.mp3	gave one a good idea of the sounds to be heard in indian forests and jungles the lions behaved best for they only paced up and down with an occasional cry but the tigers were quite frantic
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4920.mp3	for they tumbled one over the other shook the cages and tried to reach the bystanders

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4923.mp3	the tigers snarled and fought and tore and got so savage i was very grateful that they were safely shut up in a few minutes nothing but white bones remained and then they howled for more
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4924.mp3	one little leopard was better bred than the others for he went up on a shelf in the cage and ate his dinner in a quiet proper manner which was an example to the rest the lions ate in dignified silence

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4932.mp3	and kept trying to swing like the others forgetting that the strong curly end was what he held on with he would run up the bare boughs and give a jump expecting to catch and swing but the lame tail wouldn't hold him and down he'd go

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4975.mp3	that she hid him away from people all the dainties she brought down from the big house were for the blind child and she beat and cuffed her other children whenever she found them teasing him or trying to get his chicken bone away from him he began to talk early
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4976.mp3	and his mammy said he was n't all wrong she named him samson because he was blind but on the plantation he was known as yellow martha's simple child

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4980.mp3	though it did not occur to her that he might have more of it than other children one day samson was standing thus while miss nellie was playing her lesson to her music master the windows were open
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4981.mp3	talk a little while and then leave the room he heard the door close after them he crept up to the front windows and stuck his head in there was no one there he could always detect the presence of any one in a room
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4982.mp3	he put one foot over the window sill and straddled it his mother had told him over and over how his master would give him to the big mastiff if he ever found him meddling samson had got too near the mastiff's kennel once and had felt his terrible breath in his face
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4983.mp3	he thought about that but he pulled in his other foot through the dark he found his way to the thing to its mouth he touched it softly and it answered softly kindly he shivered and stood still
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4984.mp3	then he began to feel it all over ran his finger tips along the slippery sides embraced the carved legs tried to get some conception of its shape and size of the space it occupied in primeval night
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4985.mp3	it was cold and hard and like nothing else in his black universe he went back to its mouth began at one end of the keyboard and felt his way down into the mellow thunder as far as he could go
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4986.mp3	he seemed to know that it must be done with the fingers not with the fists or the feet he approached this highly artificial instrument through a mere instinct and coupled himself to it as if he knew it was to piece him out and make a whole creature of him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4987.mp3	that lay under the bones of his pinched conical little skull definite as animal desires the door opened miss nellie and her music master stood behind it but blind samson who was so sensitive to presences did not know they were there
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4988.mp3	he was feeling out the pattern that lay all ready made on the big and little keys when he paused for a moment because the sound was wrong and he wanted another miss nellie spoke softly he whirled about in a spasm of terror
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4989.mp3	leaped forward in the dark struck his head on the open window and fell screaming and bleeding to the floor he had what his mother called a fit the doctor came and gave him opium when samson was well again his young mistress led him back to the piano
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4990.mp3	several teachers experimented with him they found he had absolute pitch and a remarkable memory as a very young child he could repeat after a fashion any composition that was played for him no matter how many wrong notes he struck he never lost the intention of a passage
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/4991.mp3	as piano playing it was perhaps abominable but as music it was something real vitalized by a sense of rhythm that was stronger than his other physical senses that not only filled his dark mind but worried his body incessantly

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5358.mp3	nor are they ever recalled without bringing back with them myriads of slumbering feelings and half forgotten images we hear the sweet low voice of the mother singing soft lullabies to her darling
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5359.mp3	and see the kindly wrinkled face of the grandmother as she croons the old ditties to quiet our restless spirits one generation is linked to another by the everlasting spirit of song

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5361.mp3	are evidently drawn from a variety of sources while they are taken altogether a happy union of rhyme wit

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5364.mp3	are doubtless offshoots from ancient folk lore songs and have descended to us through many centuries the connection of mother goose with the rhymes which bear her name is difficult to determine and in fact three countries claim her for their own

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5373.mp3	tried what ridicule could effect and actually printed a book under the title songs of the nursery or mother goose's melodies for children on the title page was the picture of a goose with a very long neck and a mouth wide open and below this

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5382.mp3	through long years of service as nurse she came to be called mother gooch this good woman had one peculiarity she was accustomed to croon queer rhymes and jingles over the cradles of her charges and these rhymes

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5405.mp3	good morning mother can i do anything for you no dearie returned the woman in a cracked voice but i will sit by your side and rest for a time the girl made room on the mound beside her

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5423.mp3	but when she came near she stopped in amazement and held up her little hands with a pretty expression of dismay she had found them indeed but it made her heart bleed

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5428.mp3	and then she patted the child upon her head and walked away down the valley bo peep was much grieved over the loss that had befallen her dear sheep and so driving them before her she wandered around to see if by any chance she could find the lost tails

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5431.mp3	and those who met her wondered what had happened to make the sweet little maid so anxious but there is an end to all troubles no matter how severe they may seem to be and it happened one day as bo peep did stray unto a meadow hard by
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5432.mp3	the little shepherdess was overjoyed at this discovery and reaching up her crook she knocked the row of pretty white tails off the tree and gathered them up in her frock but how to fasten them onto her sheep again was the question
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5433.mp3	and after pondering the matter for a time she became discouraged and thinking she was no better off than before the tails were found she began to weep and to bewail her misfortune but amidst her tears she bethought herself of her needle and thread
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5434.mp3	why she exclaimed smiling again i can sew them on of course then she heaved a sigh and wiped her eye and ran o'er hill and dale oh and tried what she could as a shepherdess should to tack to each sheep its tail oh
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5435.mp3	but the very first sheep she came to refused to allow her to sew on the tail and ran away from her and the others did the same so that finally she was utterly discouraged she was beginning to cry again when the same old woman she had before met
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5436.mp3	came hobbling to her side and asked what are you doing with my cat tails your cat tails replied bo peep in surprise what do you mean why these tails are all cut from white pussycats and i put them on the tree to dry
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5437.mp3	what are you doing with them i thought they belonged to my sheep answered bo peep sorrowfully
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5438.mp3	i must hunt until i find those that belong to my sheep my dear said the old woman i have been deceiving you you said you knew all about your sheep and i wanted to teach you a lesson for however wise we may be
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5439.mp3	no one in this world knows all about anything sheep do not have long tails there is only a little stump to answer for a tail neither do rabbits have tails nor bears nor many other animals
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5440.mp3	and if you had been observing you would have known all this when i said the sheep would be wagging their tails behind them and then you would not have passed all those days in searching for what is not to be found
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5441.mp3	so now little one run away home and try to be more thoughtful in the future your sheep will never miss the tails
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5442.mp3	and now little bo peep no more did weep my tale of tails ends here
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5443.mp3	steventon is a small rural village upon the chalk hills of north hants situated in a winding valley about seven miles from basingstoke the south western railway crosses it by a short embankment
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5444.mp3	and as it curves round presents a good view of it on the left hand to those who are travelling down the line about three miles before entering the tunnel under popham beacon it may be known to some sportsmen as lying in one of the best portions of the vine hunt
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5445.mp3	it is certainly not a picturesque country it presents no grand or extensive views but the features are small rather than plain the surface continually swells and sinks but the hills are not bold nor the valleys deep
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5446.mp3	and though it is sufficiently well clothed with woods and hedgerows yet the poverty of the soil in most places prevents the timber from attaining a large size still it has its beauties the lanes wind along in a natural curve
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5447.mp3	continually fringed with irregular borders of native turf and lead to pleasant nooks and corners one who knew and loved it well very happily expressed its quiet charms when he wrote true taste is not fastidious
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5448.mp3	nor rejects because they may not come within the rule of composition pure and picturesque unnumbered simple scenes which fill the leaves of nature's sketch book of this somewhat tame country steventon from the fall of the ground and the abundance of its timber
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5449.mp3	is certainly one of the prettiest spots
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5450.mp3	compared with the broad river the rich valley and the noble hills which she had been accustomed to behold at her native home near henley upon thames the house itself stood in a shallow valley surrounded by sloping meadows well sprinkled with elm trees at the end of a small village of cottages
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5451.mp3	each well provided with a garden scattered about prettily on either side of the road it was sufficiently commodious to hold pupils in addition to a growing family and was in those times considered to be above the average of parsonages
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5452.mp3	no cornice marked the junction of wall and ceiling while the beams which supported the upper floors projected into the rooms below in all their naked simplicity covered only by a coat of paint or whitewash
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5453.mp3	and about forty five years ago it was pulled down for the purpose of erecting a new house in a far better situation on the opposite side of the valley
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5454.mp3	on the south side the ground rose gently and was occupied by one of those old fashioned gardens in which vegetables and flowers are combined flanked and protected on the east by one of the thatched mud walls common in that country and overshadowed by fine elms
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5455.mp3	along the upper or southern side of this garden ran a terrace of the finest turf
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5456.mp3	but the chief beauty of steventon consisted in its hedgerows a hedgerow in that country does not mean a thin formal line of quickset but an irregular border of copse wood and timber often wide enough to contain within it a winding footpath or a rough cart track
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5457.mp3	and now and then the unwelcome adder two such hedgerows radiated as it were from the parsonage garden one a continuation of the turf terrace proceeded westward forming the southern boundary of the home meadows
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5458.mp3	and was formed into a rustic shrubbery with occasional seats entitled the wood walk the other ran straight up the hill under the name of the church walk because it led to the parish church
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5459.mp3	who have for more than a century rented it together with the chief farm in the parish the church itself i speak of it as it then was before the improvements made by the present rector
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5460.mp3	might have appeared mean and uninteresting to an ordinary observer but the adept in church architecture would have known that it must have stood there some seven centuries and would have found beauty in the very narrow early english windows
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5461.mp3	while its solitary position far from the hum of the village and within sight of no habitation except a glimpse of the gray manor house through its circling screen of sycamores has in it something solemn and appropriate to the last resting place of the silent dead
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5462.mp3	sweet violets both purple and white grow in abundance beneath its south wall one may imagine for how many centuries the ancestors of those little flowers have occupied that undisturbed sunny nook
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5463.mp3	thick coming fancies rose in her mind and gradually assumed the forms in which they came forth to the world
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5464.mp3	the family was unbroken by death and seldom visited by sorrow their situation had some peculiar advantages beyond those of ordinary rectories steventon was a family living mister knight the patron was also proprietor of nearly the whole parish
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5465.mp3	they shared with the principal tenant the command of an excellent manor and enjoyed in this reflected way some of the consideration usually awarded to landed proprietors
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5466.mp3	they had enough to afford a good education to their sons and daughters to mix in the best society of the neighbourhood and to exercise a liberal hospitality to their own relations and friends a carriage and a pair of horses were kept
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5467.mp3	this might imply a higher style of living in our days than it did in theirs there were then no assessed taxes the carriage once bought entailed little further expense and the horses probably like mister bennet's were often employed on farm work
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5468.mp3	moreover it should be remembered that a pair of horses in those days were almost necessary if ladies were to move about at all

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5470.mp3	the family lived in close intimacy with two cousins edward and jane cooper the children of missus austen's eldest sister and doctor cooper the vicar of sonning near reading the coopers lived for some years at bath
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5471.mp3	i believe that cassandra and jane sometimes visited them there and that jane thus acquired the intimate knowledge of the topography and customs of bath which enabled her to write northanger abbey long before she resided there herself

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5503.mp3	but which the historian has the greatest difficulty in recovering at that time the dinner table presented a far less splendid appearance than it does now it was appropriated to solid food rather than to flowers fruits and decorations
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5504.mp3	nor was there much glitter of plate upon it for the early dinner hour rendered candlesticks unnecessary
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5505.mp3	though not less plentiful and savoury and the bill of fare in one house would not be so like that in another as it is now for family receipts were held in high estimation

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5507.mp3	one house would pride itself on its ham another on its game pie and a third on its superior furmity or tansey pudding beer and home made wines especially mead were more largely consumed vegetables were less plentiful and less various
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5508.mp3	potatoes were used but not so abundantly as now and there was an idea that they were to be eaten only with roast meat they were novelties to a tenant's wife who was entertained at steventon parsonage certainly less than a hundred years ago
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5509.mp3	and when missus austen advised her to plant them in her own garden she replied no no they are very well for you gentry but they must be terribly costly to rear but a still greater difference would be found in the furniture of the rooms
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5510.mp3	which would appear to us lamentably scanty there was a general deficiency of carpeting in sitting rooms bed rooms and passages a pianoforte or rather a spinnet or harpsichord was by no means a necessary appendage
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5511.mp3	it was to be found only where there was a decided taste for music not so common then as now or in such great houses as would probably contain a billiard table there would often be but one sofa in the house and that a stiff angular
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5512.mp3	uncomfortable article there were no deep easy chairs nor other appliances for lounging for to lie down or even to lean back was a luxury permitted only to old persons or invalids
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5513.mp3	and a model gentleman of his day that he would have made the tour of europe without ever touching the back of his travelling carriage but perhaps we should be most struck with the total absence of those elegant little articles which now embellish and encumber our drawing room tables

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5517.mp3	there must have been more dancing throughout the country in those days than there is now
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5518.mp3	as if it were a natural production with less fastidiousness as to the quality of music lights and floor many country towns had a monthly ball throughout the winter in some of which the same apartment served for dancing and tea room
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5519.mp3	to the music of a harpsichord in the house or a fiddle from the village this was always supposed to be for the entertainment of the young people
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5520.mp3	for she attributes this taste to her favourite heroines
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5521.mp3	and made of importance many things connected with the ball rooms of those days have now passed into oblivion the barbarous law which confined the lady to one partner throughout the evening must indeed have been abolished before jane went to balls
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5522.mp3	it must be observed however that this custom was in one respect advantageous to the gentleman inasmuch as it rendered his duties more practicable he was bound to call upon his partner the next morning
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5523.mp3	to gallop all the country over the last night's partner to behold and humbly hope she caught no cold but the stately minuet still reigned supreme and every regular ball commenced with it it was a slow and solemn movement
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5524.mp3	expressive of grace and dignity rather than of merriment it abounded in formal bows and courtesies with measured paces forwards backwards and sideways and many complicated gyrations
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5525.mp3	it was executed by one lady and gentleman amidst the admiration or the criticism of surrounding spectators in its earlier and most palmy days as when sir charles and lady grandison delighted the company by dancing it at their own wedding
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5526.mp3	the gentleman wore a dress sword and the lady was armed with a fan of nearly equal dimensions addison observes that women are armed with fans as men with swords and sometimes do more execution with them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5527.mp3	the graceful carriage of each weapon was considered a test of high breeding the clownish man was in danger of being tripped up by his sword getting between his legs
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5528.mp3	and i have been told that those ladies who intended to dance minuets used to distinguish themselves from others by wearing a particular kind of lappet on their head dress i have heard also of another curious proof of the respect in which this dance was held
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5529.mp3	gloves immaculately clean were considered requisite for its due performance while gloves a little soiled were thought good enough for a country dance and accordingly some prudent ladies provided themselves with two pairs for their several purposes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5530.mp3	the minuet expired with the last century but long after it had ceased to be danced publicly it was taught to boys and girls in order to give them a graceful carriage hornpipes cotillons and reels were occasionally danced
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5531.mp3	but the chief occupation of the evening was the interminable country dance in which all could join this dance presented a great show of enjoyment but it was not without its peculiar troubles
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5532.mp3	the ladies and gentlemen were ranged apart from each other in opposite rows so that the facilities for flirtation or interesting intercourse were not so great as might have been desired by both parties much heart burning and discontent sometimes arose as to who should stand above whom
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5533.mp3	and especially as to who was entitled to the high privilege of calling and leading off the first dance and no little indignation was felt at the lower end of the room when any of the leading couples retired prematurely from their duties and did not condescend to dance up and down the whole set
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5534.mp3	we may rejoice that these causes of irritation no longer exist and that if such feelings as jealousy rivalry and discontent ever touch celestial bosoms in the modern ball room they must arise from different and more recondite sources
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5535.mp3	i am tempted to add a little about the difference of personal habits it may be asserted as a general truth that less was left to the charge and discretion of servants and more was done or superintended by the masters and mistresses
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5536.mp3	with regard to the mistresses it is i believe generally understood that at the time to which i refer a hundred years ago they took a personal part in the higher branches of cookery as well as in the concoction of home made wines
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5537.mp3	and distilling of herbs for domestic medicines which are nearly allied to the same art ladies did not disdain to spin the thread of which the household linen was woven some ladies liked to wash with their own hands their choice china after breakfast or tea
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5538.mp3	as that they took an interest in such occupations and it must be borne in mind how many sources of interest enjoyed by this generation were then closed or very scantily opened to ladies a very small minority of them cared much for literature or science
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5539.mp3	but i doubt whether the rising generation are equally aware how much gentlemen also did for themselves in those times
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5540.mp3	than they are now master's eye makes the horse fat and if you would be well served serve yourself some gentlemen took pleasure in being their own gardeners performing all the scientific and some of the manual work themselves

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5761.mp3	nor was there room beneath the desks for their long legs evidently then there were other denizens on mars than the wild and grotesque creatures into whose hands i had fallen but the evidences of extreme antiquity
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5762.mp3	and at a sign from the leader i had been lowered to the ground again locking his arm in mine we had proceeded into the audience chamber there were few formalities observed in approaching the martian chieftain
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5763.mp3	my captor merely strode up to the rostrum the others making way for him as he advanced the chieftain rose to his feet and uttered the name of my escort who in turn halted and repeated the name of the ruler followed by his title
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5764.mp3	at the time this ceremony and the words they uttered meant nothing to me but later i came to know that this was the customary greeting between green martians had the men been strangers and therefore unable to exchange names
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5765.mp3	had their missions been peaceful otherwise they would have exchanged shots or have fought out their introduction with some other of their various weapons my captor whose name was tars tarkas
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5766.mp3	and when he had concluded the chieftain addressed me at some length i replied in our good old english tongue merely to convince him that neither of us could understand the other
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5767.mp3	but i noticed that when i smiled slightly on concluding he did likewise this fact and the similar occurrence during my first talk with tars tarkas convinced me that we had at least something in common the ability to smile
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5768.mp3	therefore to laugh denoting a sense of humor but i was to learn that the martian smile is merely perfunctory and that the martian laugh is a thing to cause strong men to blanch in horror the ideas
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5769.mp3	of incitants to merriment the death agonies of a fellow being are to these strange creatures provocative of the wildest hilarity while their chief form of commonest amusement
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5770.mp3	is to inflict death on their prisoners of war in various ingenious and horrible ways the assembled warriors and chieftains examined me closely feeling my muscles and the texture of my skin
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5771.mp3	the principal chieftain then evidently signified a desire to see me perform and motioning me to follow he started with tars tarkas for the open plaza now i had made no attempt to walk since my first signal failure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5772.mp3	and so now i went skipping and flitting about among the desks and chairs like some monstrous grasshopper after bruising myself severely
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5773.mp3	and i did the only thing a gentleman might do under the circumstances of brutality boorishness and lack of consideration for a stranger's rights i swung my fist squarely to his jaw and he went down like a felled ox
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5774.mp3	as he sunk to the floor i wheeled around with my back toward the nearest desk expecting to be overwhelmed by the vengeance of his fellows but determined to give them as good a battle as the unequal odds would permit before i gave up my life
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5775.mp3	my fears were groundless however as the other martians at first struck dumb with wonderment finally broke into wild peals of laughter and applause i did not recognize the applause as such but later
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5776.mp3	when i had become acquainted with their customs i learned that i had won what they seldom accord a manifestation of approbation the fellow whom i had struck lay where he had fallen
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5777.mp3	but i was not long in being enlightened they first repeated the word sak a number of times and then tars tarkas made several jumps repeating the same word before each leap then turning to me he said sak
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5778.mp3	i saw what they were after and gathering myself together i sakked with such marvelous success that i cleared a good hundred and fifty feet nor did i this time lose my equilibrium but landed squarely upon my feet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5779.mp3	without falling i then returned by easy jumps of twenty five or thirty feet to the little group of warriors my exhibition had been witnessed by several hundred lesser martians and they immediately broke into demands for a repetition
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5780.mp3	which the chieftain then ordered me to make but i was both hungry and thirsty and determined on the spot that my only method of salvation was to demand the consideration from these creatures
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5781.mp3	which they evidently would not voluntarily accord i therefore ignored the repeated commands to sak and each time they were made i motioned to my mouth and rubbed my stomach
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5782.mp3	tars tarkas and the chief exchanged a few words and the former calling to a young female among the throng gave her some instructions and motioned me to accompany her
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5783.mp3	i grasped her proffered arm and together we crossed the plaza toward a large building on the far side my fair companion was about eight feet tall having just arrived at maturity but not yet to her full height
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5784.mp3	she was of a light olive green color with a smooth glossy hide her name as i afterward learned was sola and she belonged to the retinue of tars tarkas she conducted me to a spacious chamber
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5785.mp3	in one of the buildings fronting on the plaza and which from the litter of silks and furs upon the floor i took to be the sleeping quarters of several of the natives the room was well lighted by a number of large windows
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5786.mp3	and was beautifully decorated with mural paintings and mosaics
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5787.mp3	made a peculiar hissing sound as though signaling to someone in an adjoining room in response to her call i obtained my first sight of a new martian wonder it waddled in on its ten short legs and squatted down before the girl
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5788.mp3	like an obedient puppy the thing was about the size of a shetland pony
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5789.mp3	chapter three my advent on mars i opened my eyes upon a strange and weird landscape i knew that i was on mars not once did i question either my sanity or my wakefulness
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5790.mp3	i was not asleep no need for pinching here my inner consciousness told me as plainly that i was upon mars as your conscious mind tells you that you are upon earth you do not question the fact
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5791.mp3	neither did i i found myself lying prone upon a bed of yellowish mosslike vegetation which stretched around me in all directions for interminable miles i seemed to be lying in a deep
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5792.mp3	the irregularities of low hills it was midday the sun was shining full upon me and the heat of it was rather intense upon my naked body yet no greater
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5793.mp3	than would have been true under similar conditions on an arizona desert here and there were slight outcroppings of quartz bearing rock which glistened in the sunlight and a little to my left perhaps a hundred yards appeared a low walled enclosure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5794.mp3	about four feet in height no water and no other vegetation than the moss was in evidence and as i was somewhat thirsty i determined to do a little exploring springing to my feet i received my first martian surprise
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5795.mp3	for the effort which on earth would have brought me standing upright carried me into the martian air to the height of about three yards i alighted softly upon the ground however without appreciable shock or jar
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5796.mp3	now commenced a series of evolutions which even then seemed ludicrous in the extreme i found that i must learn to walk all over again
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5797.mp3	as the muscular exertion which carried me easily and safely upon earth played strange antics with me upon mars instead of progressing in a sane and dignified manner
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5798.mp3	my attempts to walk resulted in a variety of hops which took me clear of the ground a couple of feet at each step and landed me sprawling upon my face or back
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5799.mp3	my muscles perfectly attuned and accustomed to the force of gravity on earth played the mischief with me in attempting for the first time to cope with the lesser gravitation and lower air pressure on mars
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5800.mp3	i was determined however to explore the low structure which was the only evidence of habitation in sight
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5801.mp3	it had ever been given me to see the roof of the enclosure was of solid glass
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5802.mp3	and beneath this were several hundred large eggs perfectly round and snowy white the eggs were nearly uniform in size being about two and one half feet in diameter five or six had already hatched
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5803.mp3	and the grotesque caricatures which sat blinking in the sunlight were enough to cause me to doubt my sanity they seemed mostly head with little scrawny bodies long necks and six legs or
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5804.mp3	as i afterward learned two legs and two arms with an intermediary pair of limbs which could be used at will either as arms or legs their eyes were set at the extreme sides of their heads a trifle above the center
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5805.mp3	without the necessity of turning the head the ears which were slightly above the eyes and closer together were small cup shaped antennae protruding not more than an inch on these young specimens

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5807.mp3	these latter add a most ferocious appearance to an otherwise fearsome and terrible countenance as the lower tusks curve upward to sharp points which end about where the eyes of earthly human beings are located
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5808.mp3	the whiteness of the teeth is not that of ivory but of the snowiest and most gleaming of china against the dark background of their olive skins their tusks stand out in a most striking manner

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5831.mp3	and i doubt that were one of them suddenly to be transported to earth he could lift his own weight from the ground in fact i am convinced that he could not do so my feat then was as marvelous upon mars
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5832.mp3	as it would have been upon earth and from desiring to annihilate me they suddenly looked upon me as a wonderful discovery to be captured and exhibited among their fellows the respite

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5837.mp3	and some telepathic force must have warned me against an attempt to escape in broad daylight from under the muzzles of twenty of these death dealing machines

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5841.mp3	he then stopped as though waiting for my reply pricking up his antennae like ears and cocking his strange looking eyes still further toward me as the silence became painful

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5844.mp3	his actions spoke for the peace and friendship that at the present moment were most dear to my heart of course i might have been a babbling brook for all the intelligence my speech carried to him
