https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5850.mp3	and it is true that a person can deliberately hypnotize himself when he wishes to till he has become accustomed to it and is expert in it so to speak it does away at a stroke with the claims of all professional hypnotists and magnetic healers
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5851.mp3	that they have any peculiar power in themselves which they exert over their fellows one of these professionals gives an account in his book of what he calls the wonderful lock method he says that
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5852.mp3	though he is locked up in a separate room he can make the psychic power work through the walls all that he does is to put his subjects in the way of hypnotizing themselves
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5853.mp3	he shows his inconsistency when he states that under certain circumstances the hypnotizer is in danger of becoming hypnotized himself in this he makes no claim that the subject is using any psychic power
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5854.mp3	but of course if the hypnotizer looks steadily into the eyes of his subject and the subject looks into his eyes the steady gaze on a bright object will produce hypnotism in one quite as readily as in the other
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5855.mp3	hypnotism is an established scientific fact but the claim that the hypnotizer has any mysterious psychic power is the invariable mark of the charlatan
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5856.mp3	probably no scientific phenomenon was ever so grossly prostituted to base ends as that of hypnotism later we shall see some of the outrageous forms this charlatanism assumes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5857.mp3	and how it extends to the professional subjects as well as to the professional operators till those subjects even impose upon scientific men who ought to be proof against such deception
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5858.mp3	moreover the possibility of self hypnotization carefully concealed and called by another name opens another great field of humbug and charlatanism of which the advertising columns of the newspapers are constantly filled
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5859.mp3	namely that of the clairvoyant and medium we may conceive how such a profession might become perfectly legitimate and highly useful but at present it seems as if any person who went into it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5860.mp3	however honest he might be at the start soon began to deceive himself as well as others until he lost his power entirely to distinguish between fact and imagination before discussing the matter further
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5861.mp3	let us quote doctor cocke's experiment in hypnotizing himself it will be remembered that a professional hypnotizer or magnetizer had hypnotized him by telling him to fix his mind on the number twenty six and holding up his hand
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5862.mp3	i was intensely cold my heart seemed to stand still i had ringing in my ears my hair seemed to rise upon my scalp i persisted in the effort and the previously mentioned noise in my ears grew louder and louder
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5863.mp3	the roar became deafening it crackled like a mighty fire i was fearfully conscious of myself having read vivid accounts of dreams visions et cetera it occurred to me that i would experience them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5864.mp3	i felt in a vague way that there were beings all about me but could not hear their voices i felt as though every muscle in my body was fixed and rigid
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5865.mp3	the roar in my ears grew louder still and i heard above the roar reports which sounded like artillery and musketry then above the din of the noise a musical chord i seemed to be absorbed in this chord i knew nothing else
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5866.mp3	secondly i wished to be hypnotized these together with a vivid imagination and strained attention brought on the states which occurred
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5867.mp3	his descriptions of dreams bear a wonderful likeness to de quincey's dreams such as those described in the english mail coach de profundis and the confessions of an english opium eater
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5868.mp3	all of which were presumably due to opium the causes which doctor cocke thinks produced the hypnotic condition in his case namely belief desire to be hypnotized and strained attention united with a vivid imagination
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5869.mp3	are causes which are often found in conjunction and produce effects which we may reasonably explain on the theory of self hypnotization
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5870.mp3	for instance the effects of an exciting religious revival are very like those produced by mesmer's operations in paris the subjects become hysterical and are ready to believe anything or do anything
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5871.mp3	by prolonging the operation a whole community becomes more or less hypnotized in all such cases however unusual excitement is commonly followed by unusual lethargy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5872.mp3	in fact it is a sort of intoxication the same phenomena are probably accountable for many of the strange records of history the wonderful cures at lourdes of which we have read in zola's novel of that name
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5873.mp3	are no doubt the effect of hypnotization by the priests some of the strange movements of whole communities during the crusades are to be explained either on the theory of hypnotization or of contagion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5874.mp3	and possibly these two things will turn out to be much the same in fact on no other ground can we explain the so called children's crusade in which over thirty thousand children from germany from all classes of the community
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5875.mp3	tried to cross the alps in winter and in their struggles were all lost or sold into slavery without even reaching the holy land again hypnotism is accountable for many of the poet's dreams
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5876.mp3	gazing steadily at a bed of bright coals or a stream of running water will invariably throw a sensitive subject into a hypnotic sleep that will last sometimes for several hours doctor cocke says
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5877.mp3	that he has experimented in this direction with patients of his says he they have the ability to resist the state or to bring it at will many of them describe beautiful scenes from nature or some mighty cathedral
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5878.mp3	with its lofty dome or the faces of imaginary beings beautiful or demoniacal according to the will and temper of the subject perhaps the most wonderful example of self hypnotism which we have in history
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5879.mp3	is that of the mystic swedenborg who saw such strange things in his visions and at last came to believe in them as real the same explanation may be given of the manifestations of oriental prophets
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5880.mp3	for in the orient hypnotism is much easier and more systematically developed than with us of the west the performances of the dervishes and also of the fakirs who wound themselves and perform many wonderful feats
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5881.mp3	their impersonations are ridiculous in the extreme one man i remember believed himself to be controlled by the spirit of charles sumner being uneducated he used the most wretched english
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5882.mp3	and his language was utterly devoid of sense while on the other hand a very intelligent lady who believed herself to be controlled by the spirit of charlotte cushman personated the part very well doctor cooke says of himself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5883.mp3	i can hypnotize myself to such an extent that i will become wholly unconscious of events taking place around me and a long interval of time say from one half to two hours will be a complete blank
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5884.mp3	how the subject feels under hypnotization doctor cooper's experience effect of music doctor alfred marthieu's experiments
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5885.mp3	the sensations produced during a state of hypnosis are very interesting as may be supposed they differ greatly in different persons
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5886.mp3	one of the most interesting accounts ever given is that of doctor james r cocke a hypnotist himself who submitted to being operated upon by a professional magnetizer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5887.mp3	he was at that time a firm believer in the theory of personal magnetism a delusion from which he afterward escaped on the occasion which he describes the operator commanded him to close his eyes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5888.mp3	but he did open them at once again he told him to close the eyes and at the same time he gently stroked his head and face and eyelids with his hand doctor cocke fancied he felt a tingling sensation in his forehead and eyes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5889.mp3	which he supposed came from the hand of the operator afterward he came to believe that this sensation was purely imaginary on his part then he says a sensation akin to fear came over me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5890.mp3	the operator said you are going to sleep you are getting sleepy you cannot open your eyes i was conscious that my heart was beating rapidly and i felt a sensation of terror
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5891.mp3	he then made passes over my head down over my hands and body but did not touch me he then said to me you cannot open your eyes the motor apparatus of my lids would not seemingly respond to my will
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5892.mp3	yet i was conscious that while one part of my mind wanted to open my eyes another part did not want to so i was in a paradoxical state i believed that i could open my eyes and yet could not
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5893.mp3	the feeling of not wishing to open my eyes was not based upon any desire to please the operator i had no personal interest in him in any way but be it understood i firmly believed in his power to control me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5894.mp3	then he stroked the arm and said it was growing numb he said you have no feeling in it have you doctor cocke goes on i said no and i knew that i said no
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5895.mp3	the operator went on pricking the arm with a pin and though doctor cocke felt the pain he said he did not feel it and at the same time the sensation of terror increased i was not conscious of my body at all he says further on
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5896.mp3	but i was painfully conscious of the two contradictory elements within me i knew that my body existed but could not prove it to myself i knew that the statements made by the operator were in a measure untrue
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5897.mp3	i obeyed them voluntarily and involuntarily this is the last remembrance that i have of that hypnotic experience after this however the operator caused the doctor to do a number of things which he learned of from his friends after the performance was over
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5898.mp3	it seemed to me that the hypnotist commanded me to awake as soon as i dropped my arm and yet ten minutes of unconsciousness had passed on a subsequent occasion doctor cocke who was blind was put into a deep hypnotic sleep
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5899.mp3	by fixing his mind on the number twenty six and holding up his hand this time he experienced a still greater degree of terror and incidentally learned that he could hypnotize himself the matter of self hypnotism
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5900.mp3	we shall consider in another chapter in this connection we find great interest in an article in the medical news july twenty eighth eighteen ninety four
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5901.mp3	in which he describes the effects of music upon hypnotic subjects while in vienna he took occasion to observe closely the enthusiastic musical devotees as they sat in the audience at the performance of one of wagner's operas
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5902.mp3	he believed they were in a condition of self induced hypnotism in which their subjective faculties were so exalted as to supersede their objective perceptions music was no longer to them a succession of pleasing sounds
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5903.mp3	but the embodiment of a drama in which they became so wrapped up that they forgot all about the mechanical and external features of the music and lived completely in a fairy world of dream
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5904.mp3	this observation suggested to him an interesting series of experiments his first subject was easily hypnotized and of an emotional nature wagner's
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5905.mp3	was played from the piano score the pulse of the subject became more rapid and at first of higher tension increasing from a normal rate of sixty beats a minute to one hundred twenty then
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5906.mp3	as the music progressed the tension diminished the respiration increased from eighteen to thirty per minute great excitement in the subject was evident his whole body was thrown into motion his legs were drawn up his arms tossed into the air
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5907.mp3	the state of mind brought up before him in the most realistic and vivid manner possible the picture of the ride of tam o'shanter which he had seen years before the picture
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5908.mp3	soon became real to him and he found himself taking part in a wild chase not as witch devil or tam even but in some way his consciousness was spread through every part of the scene being of it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5909.mp3	and yet playing the part of spectator as is often the case in dreams doctor warthin tried the same experiment again this time on a young man who was not so emotional and was hypnotized with much more difficulty
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5910.mp3	this subject did not pass into such a deep state of hypnotism but the result was practically the same the pulse rate rose from seventy to one hundred twenty the sensation remembered was that of riding furiously through the air
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5911.mp3	the experiment was repeated on other subjects in all cases with the same result
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5912.mp3	to him it always expressed the pictured wild ride of the daughters of wotan the subject taking part in the ride it was noticeable in each case that the same music played to them in the waking state produced no special impression
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5913.mp3	at first it seemed to produce the opposite effect for the pulse was lowered later it rose to a rate double the normal and the tension was diminished the impression described by the subject afterward
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5914.mp3	and the subject seemed to contemplate a landscape of lofty grandeur a different sort of music was played

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5916.mp3	it became slow and irregular and very small the respiration decreased almost to gasping the face grew pale and a cold perspiration broke out readers who are especially interested in this subject

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5921.mp3	the following is a description of a public performance given by doctor herbert l flint a very successful public operator it is in the language of an eye witness a new york lawyer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5922.mp3	in response to a call for volunteers twenty young and middle aged men came upon the stage they evidently belonged to the great middle class the entertainment commenced by doctor flint passing around the group
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5923.mp3	who were seated on the stage in a semicircle facing the audience and stroking each one's head and forehead repeating the phrases close your eyes think of nothing but sleep you are very tired you are drowsy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5924.mp3	you feel very sleepy as he did this several of the volunteers closed their eyes at once and one fell asleep immediately one or two remained awake
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5925.mp3	while a few were wide awake and smiling at the rest these latter were dismissed as unlikely subjects when the stage had been cleared of all those who were not responsive the doctor passed around and snapping his finger
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5926.mp3	at each individual awoke him one of the subjects when questioned afterward as to what sensation he experienced at the snapping of the fingers replied that it seemed to him as if something inside of his head responded
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5927.mp3	and with this sensation he regained self consciousness this is to be doubted as a rule subjects in this stage of hypnotism do not feel any sensation that they can remember
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5928.mp3	that you can't pull them apart they are fast you cannot pull them apart try you can't the whole class made frantic efforts to unclasp their hands but were unable to do so the doctor's explanation of this is
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5929.mp3	that what they were really doing was to force their hands closer together thus obeying the counter suggestion that they thought they were trying to unclasp their hands was evident from their endeavors
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5930.mp3	one young fellow aged about eighteen said that he was addicted to the cigarette habit the suggestion was made to him that he would not be able to smoke a cigarette for twenty four hours after the entertainment he was asked to smoke as was his usual habit
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5931.mp3	he was then away from any one who could influence him he replied that the very idea was repugnant however he was induced to take a cigarette in his mouth but it made him ill and he flung it away with every expression of disgust
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5932.mp3	this is an instance of what is called post hypnotic suggestion doctor cocke tells of suggesting to a drinker whom he was trying to cure of the habit that for the next three days anything he took would make him vomit
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5933.mp3	they immediately began and twirled them faster and faster in spite of their efforts to stop one of the subjects said he thought of nothing but the strange action of his hands and sometimes it puzzled him to know why they whirled
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5934.mp3	at this point doctor flint's daughter took charge of the class she pointed her finger at one of them and the subject began to look steadily before him at which the rest of the class were highly amused
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5935.mp3	presently the subject's head leaned forward the pupils of his eyes dilated and assumed a peculiar glassy stare he arose with a steady gliding gait

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5939.mp3	but the moment the gesture was made his countenance fell his mirth stopped while that of his companions redoubled and the change was so obvious that the audience shared in the laughter but the subject neither saw nor heard
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5940.mp3	his eyes assumed the same expression that had been noticed in his companion's he too arose in the same attitude as if his head were pulling the body along and following the finger in the same way as his predecessor

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5943.mp3	the bare suggestion was given as now think that you are a newsboy and are selling papers or now think that you are hunting and are going into the woods to shoot birds so the party was started
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5944.mp3	at the same time into the audience the one who was impersonating a newsboy went about crying his edition in a loud voice while the hunter crawled along stealthily and carefully
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5945.mp3	the newsboy even adopted the well worn device of asking those whom he solicited to buy to help him get rid of his stock one man offered him a cent when the price was two cents the newsboy chaffed the would be purchaser
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5946.mp3	and taking him into the center of the stage showed him a small riding whip he looked at it indifferently enough he was told it was a hot bar of iron but he shook his head still incredulous
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5947.mp3	the suggestion was repeated and as the glazed look came into his eyes the incredulous look died out every member of the class was following the suggestion made to the subject in hand all of them had the same expression in their eyes the doctor said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5948.mp3	that his daughter was hypnotizing the whole class through this one individual as she spoke she lightly touched the subject with the end of the whip the moment the subject felt the whip he jumped and shrieked as if it really were a hot iron
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5949.mp3	she touched each one of the class in succession and every one manifested the utmost pain and fear one subject sat down on the floor and cried in dire distress
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5950.mp3	had the suggestion been continued it would undoubtedly have raised a blister one of the amusing experiments tried at a later time was that of a tall young man diffident pale and modest being given a broom carefully wrapped in a sheet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5951.mp3	and told that it was his sweetheart he accepted the situation and sat down by the broom he was a little sheepish at first but eventually he grew bolder and smiled upon her such a smile as malvolio casts upon olivia
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5952.mp3	the manner in which little by little he ventured upon a familiar footing was exceedingly funny but when in a moment of confident response to his wooing he clasped her round the waist and imprinted a chaste kiss upon the brushy part of the broom
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5953.mp3	disguised by the sheet the house resounded with roars of laughter the subject however was deaf to all of the noise he was absorbed in his courtship and he continued to hug the broom and exhibit in his features

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5956.mp3	then he calmly resumed his garment and walked back to the stage the side show closed the evening's entertainment a young man was told to think of himself as managing a side show at a circus
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5957.mp3	when his mind had absorbed this idea he was ordered to open his exhibition he at once mounted a table and in the voice of the traditional side show fakir began to dilate upon the fat woman and the snakes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5958.mp3	that for the small sum of ten cents they could see more wonders than ever before had been crowded under one canvas tent he harangued the crowd as they surged about the tent door
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5959.mp3	he pointed to a suppositious canvas picture he chaffed the boys he flattered the vanity of the young fellows with their girls telling them that they could not afford for the small sum of ten cents to miss this great show
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5960.mp3	when the little fleet of spanish vessels including the one which had been captured by bartholemy portuguez and his men were on their way to campeachy they met with very stormy weather so that they were separated and the ship which contained bartholemy and his companions arrived first at the port for which they were bound
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5961.mp3	the captain who had bartholemy and the others in charge did not know what an important capture he had made he supposed that these pirates were ordinary buccaneers and it appears that it was his intention to keep them as his own private prisoners
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5962.mp3	for as they were all very able bodied men they would be extremely useful on a ship but when his vessel was safely moored and it became known in the town that he had a company of pirates on board
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5963.mp3	and who had heard of his various exploits he therefore went to the captain of the vessel and informed him that he had on board one of the very worst pirates in the whole world whose wicked deeds were well known in various parts of the west indies
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5964.mp3	and who ought immediately to be delivered up to the civil authorities this proposal however met with no favor from the spanish captain who had found bartholemy a very quiet man and could see that he was a very strong one
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5965.mp3	and he did not at all desire to give up such a valuable addition to his crew but the merchant grew very angry for he knew that bartholemy had inflicted great injury on spanish commerce and as the captain would not listen to him he went to the governor of the town and reported the case
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5966.mp3	when this dignitary heard the story he immediately sent a party of officers to the ship and commanded the captain to deliver the pirate leader into their charge the other men were left where they were
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5967.mp3	but he did not lose heart and immediately set to work to free himself from his irons which were probably very clumsy affairs at last caring little how much he scratched and tore his skin
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5968.mp3	he succeeded in getting rid of his fetters and could move about as freely as a tiger in a cage to get out of this cage was bartholemy's first object it would be comparatively easy because in the course of time some one would come into the hold
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5969.mp3	and the athletic buccaneer thought that he could easily get the better of whoever might open the hatch but the next act in this truly melodramatic performance would be a great deal more difficult for in order to escape from the ship it would be absolutely necessary for bartholemy to swim to shore
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5970.mp3	and he did not know how to swim which seems a strange failing in a hardy sailor with so many other nautical accomplishments in the rough hold where he was shut up our pirate peering about anxious and earnest
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5971.mp3	he was satisfied that this unwieldy contrivance would support him in the water among other things he had found in his rummagings about the hold was an old knife and with this in his hand he now sat waiting for a good opportunity to attack his sentinel
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5972.mp3	this came soon after nightfall a man descended with a lantern to see that the prisoner was still secure let us hope that it was not the soldier who had kindly informed him of his fate and as soon as he was fairly in the hold bartholemy sprang upon him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5973.mp3	there was a fierce struggle but the pirate was quick and powerful and the sentinel was soon dead then carrying his two jars bartholemy climbed swiftly and noiselessly up the short ladder
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5974.mp3	for a moment he sank below the surface but the two air tight jars quickly rose and bore him up with them there was a bustle on board the ship there was some random firing of muskets in the direction of the splashing which the watch had heard
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5975.mp3	but none of the balls struck the pirate or his jars and he soon floated out of sight and hearing kicking out with his legs and paddling as well as he could with one hand while he held on to the jars with the other he at last managed to reach the land
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5976.mp3	and ran as fast as he could into the dark woods beyond the town bartholemy was now greatly in fear that when his escape was discovered he would be tracked by bloodhounds
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5977.mp3	which was what he wished to do if the hounds should get upon his trail he was a lost man the desperate pirate therefore determined to give the bloodhounds no chance to follow him and for three days he remained in a marshy forest in the dark recesses of which he could hide
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5978.mp3	and where the water which covered the ground prevented the dogs from following his scent he had nothing to eat except a few roots of water plants but he was accustomed to privation and these kept him alive often he heard the hounds baying on the dry land adjoining the marsh
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5979.mp3	and sometimes he saw at night distant torches which he was sure were carried by men who were hunting for him but at last the pursuit seemed to be given up and hearing no more dogs and seeing no more flickering lights bartholemy left the marsh and set out on his long journey down the coast
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5980.mp3	which was forty leagues away but where he had reason to suppose he would find some friends when he came out from among the trees he mounted a small hill and looked back upon the town the public square was lighted and there in the middle of it he saw the gallows which had been erected for his execution
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5981.mp3	and this sight doubtless animated him very much during the first part of his journey the terrible trials and hardships which bartholemy experienced during his tramp along the coast were such as could have been endured only by one of the strongest and toughest of men
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5982.mp3	but after a diet of roots shellfish must have been a very agreeable change and they gave him all the strength and vigor he needed very often he found streams and inlets which he was obliged to ford
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5983.mp3	when he had made for himself what seemed to be a free passage he would dash in and hurry across at other times great forests stretched down to the very coast and through these he was obliged to make his way
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5984.mp3	although he could hear the roars and screams of wild beasts all about him any one who is afraid to go down into a dark cellar to get some apples from a barrel at the foot of the stairs can have no idea of the sort of mind possessed by bartholemy portuguez
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5985.mp3	the animals might howl around him and glare at him with their shining eyes and the alligators might lash the water into foam with their great tails
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5986.mp3	this was a wide river flowing through the inland country into the sea he made his way up the shore of this river for a considerable distance but it grew but little narrower and he could see no chance of getting across he could not swim
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5987.mp3	and he had no wine jars now with which to buoy himself up
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5988.mp3	but a man in his situation would not be likely to give up readily
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5989.mp3	now a piece of good fortune happened to him although to an ordinary traveller it might have been considered a matter of no importance whatever on the edge of the shore where it had floated down from some region higher up the river
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5990.mp3	bartholemy perceived an old board in which there were some long and heavy rusty nails greatly encouraged by this discovery the indefatigable traveller set about a work which resembled that of the old woman who wanted a needle
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5991.mp3	and who began to rub a crow bar on a stone in order to reduce it to the proper size bartholemy carefully knocked all the nails out of the board and then finding a large flat stone he rubbed down one of them until he had formed it into the shape of a rude knife blade
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5992.mp3	which he made as sharp as he could then with these tools he undertook the construction of a raft working away like a beaver and using the sharpened nails instead of his teeth
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5993.mp3	he cut down a number of small trees and when he had enough of these slender trunks he bound them together with reeds and osiers which he found on the river bank so after infinite labor and trial he constructed a raft which would bear him on the surface of the water
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5994.mp3	gathering up his legs so as to keep out of reach of the alligators and with a long pole pushed himself off from shore sometimes paddling and sometimes pushing his pole against the bottom he at last got across the river and took up his journey upon dry land
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5995.mp3	even if he could not walk no athlete of the present day no matter if he should be a most accomplished circus man could reasonably expect to perform the feat which this bold pirate successfully accomplished for five or six leagues he went through that mangrove forest
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5996.mp3	never once setting his foot upon the ground by which is meant mud water and roots but swinging himself by his hands and arms from branch to branch as if he had been a great ape only resting occasionally drawing himself upon a stout limb where he might sit for a while and get his breath
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5997.mp3	a sputtering of musketry was always to be heard later the cannon had entered the dispute in the fog filled air their voices made a thudding sound the reverberations were continual
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5998.mp3	this part of the world led a strange battleful existence the youth's regiment was marched to relieve a command that had lain long in some damp trenches the men took positions behind a curving line of rifle pits that had been turned up like a large furrow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/5999.mp3	he could see the low line of trenches but for a short distance a few idle flags were perched on the dirt hills
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6000.mp3	always the noise of skirmishers came from the woods on the front and left and the din on the right had grown to frightful proportions the guns were roaring without an instant's pause for breath
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6001.mp3	it seemed that the cannon had come from all parts and were engaged in a stupendous wrangle it became impossible to make a sentence heard the youth wished to launch a joke a quotation from newspapers he desired to say
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6002.mp3	all quiet on the rappahannock but the guns refused to permit even a comment upon their uproar he never successfully concluded the sentence but at last the guns stopped and among the men in the rifle pits rumors again flew
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6003.mp3	like birds but they were now for the most part black creatures who flapped their wings drearily near to the ground and refused to rise on any wings of hope the men's faces grew doleful from the interpreting of omens
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6004.mp3	stories of disaster were borne into their minds with many proofs this din of musketry on the right growing like a released genie of sound expressed and emphasized the army's plight the men were disheartened and began to mutter
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6005.mp3	and it could always be seen that they were bewildered by the alleged news and could not fully comprehend a defeat before the gray mists had been totally obliterated by the sun rays the regiment was marching in a spread column that was retiring carefully through the woods
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6006.mp3	the disordered hurrying lines of the enemy could sometimes be seen down through the groves and little fields they were yelling shrill and exultant at this sight the youth forgot many personal matters and became greatly enraged he exploded in loud sentences
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6007.mp3	observed a man his friend recently aroused was still very drowsy he looked behind him until his mind took in the meaning of the movement then he sighed oh well i s'pose we got licked
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6008.mp3	he remarked sadly the youth had a thought that it would not be handsome for him to freely condemn other men he made an attempt to restrain himself but the words upon his tongue were too bitter
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6009.mp3	he presently began a long and intricate denunciation of the commander of the forces mebbe it wa'n't all his fault not all together
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6010.mp3	it's our luck t git licked often said his friend in a weary tone he was trudging along with stooped shoulders and shifting eyes like a man who has been caned and kicked well don't we fight like the devil
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6011.mp3	don't we do all that men can demanded the youth loudly he was secretly dumfounded at this sentiment when it came from his lips for a moment his face lost its valor and he looked guiltily about him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6012.mp3	but no one questioned his right to deal in such words and presently he recovered his air of courage he went on to repeat a statement he had heard going from group to group at the camp that morning the brigadier said he never saw a new reg'ment fight the way we fought yestirday didn't he
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6013.mp3	in his reply the friend's voice was stern a course not he said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6014.mp3	but still still we don't have no luck well then if we fight like the devil an don't ever whip it must be the general's fault said the youth grandly and decisively
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6015.mp3	and i don't see any sense in fighting and fighting and fighting yet always losing through some derned old lunkhead of a general
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6016.mp3	the speech pierced the youth inwardly he was reduced to an abject pulp by these chance words his legs quaked privately he cast a frightened glance at the sarcastic man why no he hastened to say in a conciliating voice
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6017.mp3	i don't think i fought the whole battle yesterday but the other seemed innocent of any deeper meaning apparently he had no information it was merely his habit oh he replied in the same tone of calm derision
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6018.mp3	the youth nevertheless felt a threat his mind shrank from going near to the danger and thereafter he was silent the significance of the sarcastic man's words took from him all loud moods that would make him appear prominent
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6019.mp3	he became suddenly a modest person there was low toned talk among the troops the officers were impatient and snappy their countenances clouded with the tales of misfortune
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6020.mp3	the troops sifting through the forest were sullen in the youth's company once a man's laugh rang out a dozen soldiers turned their faces quickly toward him and frowned with vague displeasure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6021.mp3	the noise of firing dogged their footsteps sometimes it seemed to be driven a little way but it always returned again with increased insolence the men muttered and cursed throwing black looks in its direction
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6022.mp3	in a clear space the troops were at last halted regiments and brigades broken and detached through their encounters with thickets grew together again and lines were faced toward the pursuing bark of the enemy's infantry
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6023.mp3	increased to a loud and joyous burst and then as the sun went serenely up the sky throwing illuminating rays into the gloomy thickets it broke forth into prolonged pealings the woods began to crackle as if afire

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6026.mp3	awaited the moment when the gray shadows of the woods before them should be slashed by the lines of flame there was much growling and swearing good gawd the youth grumbled we're always being chased around like rats it makes me sick

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6035.mp3	there was a wait in this part of the field there passed slowly the intense moments that precede the tempest a single rifle flashed in a thicket before the regiment in an instant it was joined by many others

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6037.mp3	the battle roar settled to a rolling thunder which was a single long explosion in the regiment there was a peculiar kind of hesitation denoted in the attitudes of the men
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6038.mp3	they were worn exhausted having slept but little and labored much

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6041.mp3	he managed to get possession of a ship which he manned with a crew of about a score of impecunious dare devils who were very anxious to do something to mend their fortunes having now become very fond of land fighting
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6042.mp3	he did not go out in search of ships but directed his vessel to a little village called de los cayos on the coast of cuba for here he thought was a chance for a good and easy stroke of business
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6043.mp3	so that large ships could not approach very near and thus the villagers were kept busy carrying goods and supplies in small boats backwards and forwards from the town to the vessels at anchor
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6044.mp3	here was a nice little prize that could not get away from him and l'olonnois had plenty of time to make his preparations to seize it as he could not sail a ship directly up to the town
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6045.mp3	he cruised about the coast at some distance from de los cayos endeavoring to procure two small boats in which to approach the town but although his preparations were made as quietly as possible the presence of his vessel was discovered by some fishermen
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6046.mp3	informing the governor of the island that the cruel pirate l'olonnois was in a ship a short distance from their village which he undoubtedly intended to attack when the governor heard this astonishing tale
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6047.mp3	it was almost impossible for him to believe it the good news of the death of l'olonnois had come from campeachy to havana and the people of the latter town also rejoiced greatly to be now told that this scourge of the west indies was alive
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6048.mp3	and was about to fall upon a peaceful little village on the island over which he ruled filled the governor with rage as well as amazement and he ordered a well armed ship with a large crew of fighting men to sail immediately for de los cayos
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6049.mp3	by the time the war vessel had arrived at de los cayos l'olonnois had made his preparation to attack the place he had procured two large canoes and in these he had intended to row up to the town and land with his men
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6050.mp3	but now there was a change in the state of affairs and he was obliged to alter his plans the ordinary person in command of two small boats who should suddenly discover that a village which he supposed almost defenceless was protected by a large man of war
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6051.mp3	with cannon and a well armed crew would have altered his plans so completely that he would have left that part of the coast of cuba with all possible expedition but the pirates of that day seemed to pay very little attention to the element of odds
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6052.mp3	if they met an enemy who was weak they would fall upon him and if they met with one who was a good deal stronger than themselves they would fall upon him all the same when the time came to fight they fought
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6053.mp3	but no intention of giving up his project entered his mind as the spanish vessel was in his way he would attack her and get her out of his way if the thing could be done in this new state of affairs he was obliged to use stratagem
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6054.mp3	and he also needed a larger force than he had with him and he therefore captured some men who were fishing along the coast and put them into his canoes to help work the oars then by night he proceeded slowly in the direction of the spanish vessel
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6055.mp3	the man of war was anchored not very far from the town and when about two o'clock in the morning the watch on deck saw some canoes approaching they supposed them to be boats from shore
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6056.mp3	for as has been said such vessels were continually plying about those shallow waters the canoes were hailed and after having given an account of themselves they were asked if they knew anything about the pirate ship upon the coast
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6057.mp3	but their way was a very different one from any which could have been expected by the captain of the ship they rowed off into the darkness instead of going toward the town and waited until nearly daybreak then they boldly made for the man of war
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6058.mp3	one canoe attacking her on one side and the other on the other before the spanish could comprehend what had happened there were more than twenty pirates upon their decks the dreaded l'olonnois at their head
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6059.mp3	and they fought each scoundrel of them like three men and the savage fight ended by every spanish sailor or officer who was not killed or wounded being forced to stay below decks where the hatches were securely fastened down upon them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6060.mp3	l'olonnois now stood a proud victor on the deck of his prize and being a man of principle he determined to live up to the distinguished reputation which he had acquired in that part of the world
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6061.mp3	baring his muscular and hairy right arm he clutched the handle of his sharp and heavy cutlass and ordered the prisoners to be brought up from below one at a time and conducted to the place where he stood
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6062.mp3	he wished to give spain a lesson which would make her understand that he was not to be interfered with in the execution of his enterprises and he determined to allow himself the pleasure of personally teaching this lesson
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6063.mp3	this man who was not a soldier was desperately frightened and begged piteously for his life l'olonnois finding that the man was willing to tell everything he knew questioned him about the sending of this vessel from havana
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6064.mp3	and when the poor fellow had finished by telling that he had come there not of his own accord but simply for the purpose of obeying his master to hang all the pirates except their leader that great buccaneer laughed and finding he could get nothing more from the negro
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6065.mp3	cut off his head likewise and his body was tumbled into the sea after those of his companions now there was not a spaniard left on board the great ship except one man
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6066.mp3	who had been preserved from the fate of the others because l'olonnois had some correspondence to attend to and he needed a messenger to carry a letter the pirate captain went into the cabin where he found writing materials ready to his hand
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6067.mp3	and there he composed a letter to the governor of havana a part of which read as follows i shall never henceforward give quarter unto any spaniard whatsoever
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6068.mp3	when this message was received by the dignified official who filled the post of governor of cuba he stormed and fairly foamed at the mouth to be utterly foiled and discomfited by this resurrected pirate
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6069.mp3	and to be afterwards addressed in terms of such unheard of insolence and abuse was more than he could bear and in the presence of many of his officials and attendants he swore a terrible oath that after that hour he would never again give quarter to any buccaneer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6070.mp3	but when the inhabitants of havana and the surrounding villages heard of this terrible resolution of their governor they were very much disturbed they lived in constant danger of attack especially those who were engaged in fishing or maritime pursuits
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6071.mp3	and they feared that when it became known that no buccaneer was to receive quarter the spanish colonists would be treated in the same way no matter where they might be found and taken
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6072.mp3	consequently it was represented to the governor that his plan of vengeance would work most disastrously for the spanish settlers for the buccaneers could do far more damage to them than he could possibly do to these dreadful brethren of the coast
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6073.mp3	and that unless he wished to bring upon them troubles greater than those of famine or pestilence they begged that he would retract his oath when the high dignitary had cooled down a little he saw that there was a good deal of sense in what the representative of the people had said to him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6074.mp3	and he also discovered much to his surprise that there were very few provisions on board for when the vessel was sent from havana it was supposed she would make but a very short cruise
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6075.mp3	there were a few stars dying out in the dark west the atmosphere was clear and when the sun rose i knew he would turn the sable pall overhead into blueness the hull lay very deep
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6076.mp3	i had at one time during the black hours struck into a mournful calculation and reckoned that the brig would float some two or three hours after sunrise
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6077.mp3	and a deep of rolling sapphire i started with sudden terror to observe how close the covering board sat upon the water and how the head of every swell ran past as high as the bulwark rail
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6078.mp3	yet for a few moments i stood contemplating the scene of ruin it was visible now to its most trifling detail the foremast was gone smooth off at the deck it lay over the starboard bow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6079.mp3	one extraordinary stroke i quickly detected the jolly boat had lain stowed in the long boat it was thus we carried those boats the little one lying snugly enough in the other the sea that had flooded our decks
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6080.mp3	had floated the jolly boat out of the long boat and swept it bottom up to the gangway where it lay as though god's mercy designed it should be preserved for my use for not long after it had been floated out the brig struck the berg the masts fell
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6081.mp3	and there lay the long boat crushed into staves this signal and surprising intervention filled my heart with thankfulness though my spirits sank again at the sight of my poor drowned shipmates
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6082.mp3	and so made a tackle by the help of which i turned the jolly boat over i then with a handspike prised her nose to the gangway secured a bunch of rope on either side her to act as fenders or buffers
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6083.mp3	when she should be launched and lying alongside ran her midway out by the tackle and attaching a line to a ring bolt in her bow shoved her over the side and she fell with a splash shipping scarce a hatful of water
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6084.mp3	but i met with an oar that had belonged to the other boat and this with the mast and sail i dropped into her the swell lifting her up to my hand when the blue fold swung past my next business was to victual her
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6085.mp3	i ran to the cabin but the lazarette was full of water and none of the provisions in it to be come at i thereupon ransacked the cabin and found a whole dutch cheese a piece of raw pork half a ham
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6086.mp3	eight or ten biscuits some candles a tinder box several lemons a little bag of flower and thirteen bottles of beer these things i rolled up in a cloth and placed them in the boat
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6087.mp3	the heavy sluggish sodden movement of the hull advised me to make haste she was now barely lifting to the swell that came brimming in broad liquid blue brows to her stem
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6088.mp3	it seemed as though another ton of water would sink her and if the swell fell over her bows and filled the decks down she would go i had a small parcel of guineas in my chest and was about to fetch this money
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6089.mp3	when a sort of staggering sensation in the upward slide of the hull gave me a fright and watching my chance i jumped into the boat and cast the line that held her adrift the sun was an hour above the horizon
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6090.mp3	heaving very slowly though you felt the weight of the mighty ocean in every fold and eastwards the shoulders of the swell catching the glorious reflection of the sun hurled the splendour along
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6091.mp3	till all that quarter of the sea looked to be a mass of leaping dazzle upon the eastern sea line lay a range of white clouds compact as the chalk cliffs of dover
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6092.mp3	shot with pearly lustre floated overhead very high it was in truth a fair and pleasant morning of an icy coldness indeed but the air being dry its shrewdness was endurable
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6093.mp3	with us had it dawned yesterday instead of to day my companions would have been alive and yonder sinking ruined fabric a trim ship capable of bearing us stoutly into warm seas and to our homes at last
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6094.mp3	i threw the oar over the stern of the boat to keep her near to the brig not so much because i desired to see the last of her
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6095.mp3	into those prodigious leagues of ocean which lay stretched under the sky whilst the hull floated she was something to hold on to so to say something for the eye amid the vastness of water to rest upon
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6096.mp3	and her main deck blew up with a loud clap or blast of noise i could follow the line of her bulwarks fluctuating and waving in the clear dark blue when she was some feet under
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6097.mp3	and which she dragged down with her on a sudden when the last fragment of mast had disappeared and when the hollows of the whirlpools were flattening to the level surface of the sea up rose a body with a sort of leap
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6098.mp3	it was the sailor that had lain drowned on the starboard side of the forward deck being frozen stiff he rose in the posture in which he had expired that is with his arms extended
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6099.mp3	so that when he jumped to the surface he came with his hands lifted up to heaven and thus he stayed a minute sustained by the eddies which also revolved him the shock occasioned by this melancholy object was so great
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6100.mp3	and such was the state of my mind that imagination might quickly have worked the apparition had it lingered into an instrument for the unsettling of my reason i rose from the seat on to which i had sunk and loosed the sail
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6101.mp3	and hauling the sheet aft put the oar over the stern and brought the little craft's head to an easterly course the draught of air was extremely weak and scarce furnished impulse enough to the sail to raise a bubble alongside
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6102.mp3	the boat was about fifteen feet long
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6103.mp3	ere i could heave a civilized coast or a habitable island into view at the start i had a mind to steer north west and blow as the wind would suffer into the south sea
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6104.mp3	where perchance i might meet a whaler or a southseaman from new holland but my heart sank at the prospect of the leagues of water which rolled between me and the islands and the western american seaboard indeed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6105.mp3	i understood that my only hope of deliverance lay in being picked up and that though by heading east i should be clinging to the stormy parts i was more likely to meet with a ship hereabouts
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6106.mp3	than by sailing into the great desolation of the north west the burden of my loneliness weighed down upon me so crushingly that i cannot but consider my senses must have been somewhat dulled by suffering
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6107.mp3	i am persuaded my heart must have broken and that i should have died of grief faintly as the wind blew it speedily wafted me out of sight of the floating relics of the wreck
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6108.mp3	and then all was bare bald swelling sea and empearled sky darkening in lagoons of azure down to the soft mountainous masses of white vapour lying like the coast of a continent on the larboard horizon
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6109.mp3	but one living thing there was besides myself a grey breasted albatross of a princely width of pinion i had not observed it till the hull went down and then
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6110.mp3	lifting my eyes with involuntary sympathy in the direction pointed to by the upraised arms of the sailor i observed the great royal bird hanging like a shape of marble directly over the frothing eddies
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6111.mp3	it was as though the spirit of the deep had taken form in the substance of the noblest of all the fowls of its dominions and poised on tremorless wings
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6112.mp3	was surveying with the cold curiosity of an intelligence empty of human emotion the destruction of one of those fabrics whose unequal contests and repeated triumphs had provoked its haughty surprise
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6113.mp3	the bird quitted the spot of the wreck after a while and followed me its eyes had the sparkling blood red gleam of rubies
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6114.mp3	it was as silent as a phantom and with arched neck and motionless plumes seemed to watch me with an earnestness that presently grew insufferable so far from finding any comfort of companionship in the creature
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6115.mp3	it uttered a strange salt cry the very note of a gust of wind splitting upon a rope flapped its wings and after a turn or two
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6116.mp3	i lay for a long while insensible and that i should have recovered my mind instead of dying in that swoon i must ever account as the greatest wonder of a life that has not been wanting in the marvellous
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6117.mp3	i had no sooner sat up than all that had happened and my present situation instantly came to me my hair was stiff with ice there was no more feeling in my hands than had they been of stone
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6118.mp3	my clothes weighed upon me like a suit of armour so inflexibly hard were they frozen yet i got upon my legs and found that i could stand and walk and that life flowed warm in my veins
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6119.mp3	it was intensely dark the binnacle lamp was extinguished and the light in the cabin burned too dimly to throw the faintest colour upon the hatchway one thing i quickly noticed that the gale had broken and blew no more than a fresh breeze
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6120.mp3	there was less spite in its wash less fury in its blow the multitudinous roaring of the heaving blackness had sobered into a hard and sullen growling a sound as of thunder among mountains heard in a valley
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6121.mp3	the brig pitched and rolled heavily much of the buoyancy of her earlier dance was gone out of her nevertheless i could not persuade myself that this sluggishness was altogether due to the water she had taken in
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6122.mp3	it was wonderful however that she should still be afloat no man could have heard the rending and grating of her side against the ice without supposing that every plank in it was being torn out
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6123.mp3	finding that i had the use of my voice i holloaed as loudly as i could but no human note responded three or four times i shouted giving some of the people their names but in vain father of mercy i thought
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6124.mp3	what has come to pass is it possible that all my companions have been washed overboard certainly five men at least were living before we fouled the ice and again i cried out is there any one alive
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6125.mp3	my loneliness was more terrible to me than any other condition of my situation it was dreadful to be standing nearly dead with cold in utter darkness
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6126.mp3	it was dreadful i say to be thus placed and to feel that i was in the heart of the rudest most desolate space of sea in the world into which the commerce of the earth dispatched but few ships all the year round
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6127.mp3	but no feature of my lamentable situation so affrighted me so worked upon the passions of my mind as my loneliness oh for one companion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6128.mp3	even one only to make me an echo for mine own speech nay god himself the merciful father of all even he seemed not the blackness lay like a pall upon the deep and upon my soul
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6129.mp3	misery and horror were within that shadow and beyond it nothing that my spirit could look up to i stood for some moments as one stunned and then my manhood trained to some purpose by the usage of the sea
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6130.mp3	reasserted itself and maybe i also got some slender comfort from observing that dull and heavy as was the motion of the brig there was yet the buoyancy of vitality in her manner of mounting the seas and that after all
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6131.mp3	her case might not be so desperate as was threatened by the way in which she had been torn and precipitated past the iceberg at moments when she plunged the whiteness of the water creaming upon the surges on either hand
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6132.mp3	by preventing the seas which washed on to the forecastle from cascading with their former violence aft also that the whole length of the main and top masts lay upon the larboard rail and over the side
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6133.mp3	my eyes directly sought it and found the time twenty minutes after ten this signified that i had ten or eleven hours of darkness before me

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6136.mp3	and i then with a seaman's dispatch shifted the rest of my apparel and cannot express how greatly i was comforted by the change though the jacket and trousers i put on were still damp with the soaking of previous days
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6137.mp3	i took from the captain's cabin a stout cloak and threw it over me enveloping my head which i had cased in a warm fur cap with the hood of it and thus equipped i lighted a small hand lantern that was used on dark nights for heaving the log

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6143.mp3	that no executioner could have gone more artistically to work to pinion and choke a man under a mass of rigging in the larboard scuppers lay two bodies as i could just faintly discern

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6160.mp3	even a poor devil like me does sometimes feel it when he is insulted mister roylake he kicked me say no more about it sir i would never have mentioned it if i hadn't had something else to tell you only i don't know how

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6166.mp3	the cur had betrayed himself it was a paltry vengeance i own to gratify a malicious pleasure as i did now in thinking of him and speaking of him by the degrading name which his morbid humility had suggested

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6170.mp3	a lapse of a quarter of an hour followed the last dose was repeated and the dog soon sprang to his feet again as lively as ever gloody was thereupon told to set the animal free and was informed at the same time
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6171.mp3	that he would be instantly dismissed if he mentioned to any living creature what he had just seen by what process he arrived at the suspicion that my safety might be threatened by the experiment on the dog he was entirely unable to explain
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6172.mp3	it was borne in on my mind sir and that's all i can tell you he said i didn't dare speak to you about it you wouldn't have believed me or if you did believe me you might have sent for the police
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6173.mp3	the one way of putting a stop to murdering mischief if murdering mischief it might be was to trust miss cristel that she was fond of you i don't mean any offence sir i pretty well guessed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6174.mp3	that she was true as steel and not easily frightened i didn't need to guess i knew it gloody had done his best to prepare cristel for the terrible confidence which he had determined to repose in her and had not succeeded

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6176.mp3	whatever she saw him drink she was to insist on your drinking it too you heard me ask leave to make the tea yes well that was one of the signals agreed on between us

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6178.mp3	i ought to have remembered this after what he had already told me my intelligence brightened a little as i went on and your accident in the next room was planned of course i said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6179.mp3	i should say no judging by his looks he turned pale when he felt the floor shaken by your fall for once in a way he was honest honestly frightened i noticed the same thing sir when he picked me up off the floor

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6182.mp3	while the deaf man lodges at the cottage he means mischief and his eye is on miss cristel early this morning sir i happened to be at the boat house somebody i leave you to guess who it is has stolen the oars
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6183.mp3	i was dressed by this time and so eager to get to the cottage that i had already opened my door what i had just heard brought me back into the room as a matter of course we both suspected the same person of stealing the oars
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6184.mp3	had we any proof to justify us gloody at once acknowledged that we had no proof i happened to look at the boat he said and i missed the oars oh yes i searched the boat house no oars no oars
