https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6190.mp3	are still occupied by glaciers which descend in showy ranks their messy bulging snouts lying back a little distance in the shadows of the walls or pushing forward among the cotton woods
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6191.mp3	that line the banks of the rivers or even stretching all the way across the main canyons compelling the rivers to find a channel beneath them the stickeen was perhaps the best known of the rivers that cross the coast range
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6192.mp3	because it was the best way to the mackenzie river cassiar gold mines it is about three hundred and fifty miles long and is navigable for small steamers a hundred and fifty miles to glenora
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6193.mp3	and sometimes to telegraph creek fifteen miles farther it first pursues a westerly course through grassy plains darkened here and there with groves of spruce and pine
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6194.mp3	then curving southward and receiving numerous tributaries from the north it enters the coast range and sweeps across it through a magnificent canyon three thousand to five thousand feet deep
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6195.mp3	of form and sculpture and are wonderfully adorned and enlivened with glaciers and waterfalls while throughout almost its whole extent the floor is a flowery landscape garden like yosemite
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6196.mp3	the most striking features are the glaciers hanging over the cliffs descending the side canyons and pushing forward to the river greatly enhancing the wild beauty of all the others
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6197.mp3	gliding along the swift flowing river the views change with bewildering rapidity wonderful too are the changes dependent on the seasons and the weather in spring when the snow is melting fast
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6198.mp3	you enjoy the countless rejoicing waterfalls the gentle breathing of warm winds the colors of the young leaves and flowers when the bees are busy and wafts of fragrance are drifting hither and thither
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6199.mp3	from miles of wild roses clover and honeysuckle the swaths of birch and willow on the lower slopes following the melting of the winter avalanche snow banks
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6200.mp3	the bossy cumuli swelling in white and purple piles above the highest peaks gray rain clouds wreathing the outstanding brows and battlements of the walls
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6201.mp3	and the breaking forth of the sun after the rain the shining of the leaves and streams and crystal architecture of the glaciers the rising of fresh fragrance the song of the happy birds
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6202.mp3	and the serene color grandeur of the morning and evening sky in summer you find the groves and gardens in full dress glaciers melting rapidly under sunshine and rain waterfalls in all their glory
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6203.mp3	the river rejoicing in its strength young birds trying their wings bears enjoying salmon and berries all the life of the canyon brimming full like the streams in autumn comes rest as if the year's work were done
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6204.mp3	the rich hazy sunshine streaming over the cliffs calls forth the last of the gentians and goldenrods the groves and thickets and meadows bloom again as their leaves change to red and yellow petals
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6205.mp3	the rocks also and the glaciers seem to bloom like the plants in the mellow golden light and so goes the song change succeeding change in sublime harmony through all the wonderful seasons and weather

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6208.mp3	the sunbeams streaming through the ice pinnacles along its terminal wall produced a wonderful glory of color and the broad sparkling crystal prairie and the distant snowy fountains were wonderfully attractive
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6209.mp3	and expands in a broad fan five or six miles in width separated from the stickeen river by its broad terminal moraine fringed with spruces and willows around the beautifully drawn curve of the moraine
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6210.mp3	was once united front to front with the greater glacier though at first both were tributaries of the main stickeen glacier which once filled the whole grand canyon after the main trunk canyon was melted out
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6211.mp3	cirques and branch canyons along the tops and sides of the walls the indians have a tradition that the river used to run through a tunnel under the united fronts of the two large tributary glaciers mentioned above
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6212.mp3	which entered the main canyon from either side and that on one occasion an indian anxious to get rid of his wife had her sent adrift in a canoe down through the ice tunnel expecting that she would trouble him no more
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6213.mp3	but to his surprise she floated through under the ice in safety all the evidence connected with the present appearance of these two glaciers indicates that they were united and formed a dam across the river
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6214.mp3	and had receded to a greater or lesser height above the valley floor the big stickeen glacier is hardly out of sight ere you come upon another that pours a majestic crystal flood
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6215.mp3	through the evergreens while almost every hollow and tributary canyon contains a smaller one the size of course varying with the extent of the area drained some are like mere snow banks others with the blue ice apparent
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6216.mp3	depend in massive bulging curves and swells and graduate into the river like forms that maze through the lower forested regions and are so striking and beautiful that they are admired even by the passing miners

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6238.mp3	to make sure that it was not interrupted by sheer precipices i concluded that with great care and the digging of slight footholds he could be slid down to the glacier where i could lay him on his back and perhaps be able to set his arms

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6398.mp3	requires highly matured artistic taste and absolute musical control too sensitive to enjoy playing before miscellaneous audiences whose unsympathetic curiosity he declared paralyzed him

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6400.mp3	spiritualizing its timbre liberating it from traditional orchestral and choral effects and elevating it to an independent power in the world of music besides enriching the technique of the piano he augmented the materials of musical expression

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6402.mp3	and he so systematized the use of the pedals that the most varied nuances could be produced by them in melody and general conception his tone poems sprang spontaneously from his glowing fancy

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6416.mp3	but he arranged with one of the pall bearers to give him nudges and kicks when it was expected of him to make a response and so he got through fairly well better than the kid did he said the babe was an unruly child

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6418.mp3	there was great excitement and surprise because the flatirons didn't float and the undertaker or what you call em overturned the barrel of water and set everybody afloat drenching the sponsors and guests

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/6421.mp3	pod didn't that night he got up a fine supper and invited some old friends he bought a big porterhouse steak thick and tender and personally broiled it on his patent folding stove

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7133.mp3	of breeding that neither parades nor conceals its quality yes this is milton this is modern milton boston society receives some of its most prominent contributions from this patrician source
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7134.mp3	but modern milton is something more than this as old milton
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7135.mp3	that swims forever against the sky that marches forever around the horizon the rounded summits of the blue hills to which the eye is irresistibly attracted before entering the town which principally claims them are the worn down stumps of ancient mountains
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7136.mp3	and although so leveled by the process of the ages they are still the highest land near the coast from maine to mexico these eighteen or twenty skyey crests form the southern boundary of the so called boston basin
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7137.mp3	and are the most prominent feature of the southern coast from them the massachuset tribe about the bay derived its name signifying near the great hills which name was changed by the english to massachusetts
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7138.mp3	and applied to both bay and colony although its indian name has been taken from this lovely range the loveliness remains all the surrounding country shimmers under the mysterious bloom of these heights
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7139.mp3	so vast that everything else is dwarfed beside them and yet so curiously airy that they seem to perpetually ripple against the sky the great blue hill especially the one which bears an observatory on its summit swims above one's head
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7140.mp3	it seems to have a singular way of moving from point to point as one motors and although one may be forced to admit that this may be due more to the winding roads than to the illusiveness of the hill still the buoyant effect is the same
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7141.mp3	ruskin declares somewhere with his quaint and characteristic mixture of positiveness and idealism that inhabitants of granite countries

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7143.mp3	each has through its own fair name done honor to the fair names which have preceded it one of the very first to be attracted by the lofty and yet lovely appeal of this region was governor thomas hutchinson
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7144.mp3	and the wide flat twist of the neponset river winding through it for all the world like a decorative panel

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7148.mp3	that visitors on entering from the street might see the gleam of his gold knee buckles as he stood on the distant porch the avenue however was never completed as belcher was appointed governor of and transferred to new jersey shortly after

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7151.mp3	still retains in its broad hospitable lines some shred of its ancient charm milton is full of history from the revolutionary days when the cannonading at bunker hill shook the foundations of the houses but not the nerves of the milton ladies
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7152.mp3	when the fourth liberty loan of two million nine hundred fifty five thousand two hundred fifty dollars was subscribed from a population of nine thousand all the various vicissitudes of peace and war have been sustained on the high level
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7153.mp3	that one might expect from men and women nobly nurtured by the strength of the hills how much of its success milton attributes to its location for one joins indeed a distinguished fellowship when one builds upon a hill

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7236.mp3	as i had been told early in the evening a small entertainment was being given which would insure its being open even at so late an hour as midnight miss page who will i am sure pardon the introduction of her name into this narrative

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7238.mp3	and so hastened on till i came to the gate on high street here i had a moment of hesitation and thoughts bitter enough for me to recall them at this moment came into my mind

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7354.mp3	and the return of these scouts with good news was anxiously watched and waited for as the most desired thing at that time was a speedy and safe landing on the supposedly golden beach sands of nome
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7355.mp3	at unalaska we spent four days taking on fresh water and coal during which time passengers visited back and forth from the waiting steamers many persons having friends on other boats
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7356.mp3	and each having a curiosity to see if they were faring as well or ill as he comparing notes as to the expense of traveling with the different companies et cetera passengers on the saint paul agreed that they had no kick comin
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7357.mp3	which was one of the commonest slang phrases intended to mean that they had no fault to find with the alaska commercial company and their steamer saint paul all were well cared for and satisfied as well they might be
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7358.mp3	with the service of the ship's men leaving unalaska the sun shone clear and cold upon the mountains where in places the sides looked black from the late fires started in the deep tundra by miscreants
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7359.mp3	the tops of the mountains were covered with snow down deep gorges dashed mountain waters of melting snow and ice hurrying to leap off gullied and rocky cliffs into the sea their progress was never impeded
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7360.mp3	no tree nor shrub obstructed the way with gnarled old trunks twisted roots or low hanging branches for none grow in unalaska
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7361.mp3	and the bold dignity and grandeur of the mountains is never diminished by these lesser objects as our ship sailed out into behring sea we were closely followed by the steamer george w elder whose master
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7362.mp3	an old friend of our captain had decided to follow in our wake he being less familiar than the latter with alaskan waters
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7363.mp3	on the morning of the twenty sixth of june i awoke to find that the ice had drifted out to sea in the night eight days after mollie and i had taken our twelve miles trip across the bay and return
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7364.mp3	then came hard rain and wind that for several days blew the ice back into the bay first to one side and then to the other so that the steamers waiting to come in could not do so for fear of the drifting floes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7365.mp3	by the thirtieth of june schooners were coming into the bay with passengers and freight and the coast steamers elmore and dora had begun to make regular trips to and from nome with them came mails from the outside
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7366.mp3	with newspapers and tidings of friends in the states then our fingers trembled at opening our letters until we found that all our dear ones were well and we heartily thanked the lord
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7367.mp3	there were other white women in camp by this time and many strangers at the hotel among others officials and those in authority since the stone throwing episode the marshal had been doing duty as watchman
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7368.mp3	sleeping during the day and guarding the house nights the heavy iron bracelets in his inner coat pocket weighing scarcely more than the loaded revolver in his belt
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7369.mp3	our little sick girl being obliged now to keep her bed continually with no more playing in the sand and sunshine although her cough had left her was still the same sweet patient child she had been through all her illness
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7370.mp3	and my whole time was given to her before one of the sunny south windows of the living room we placed her cot each morning and here she received her numerous friends both eskimo and white and their names were legion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7371.mp3	they came from the east west north and south all sorry to know of her illness and bringing presents with them sometimes it was a little live bird or squirrel a delicious salmon trout
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7372.mp3	or wild fowl for her supper sometimes it was candy nuts or fresh fruit from nome and with everything she was well pleased and joyous friends soon came in from the outside bringing city dolls dressed in ribbons and laces
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7373.mp3	there were tiny dishes chairs tables a hundred things dear to a little girl's heart and all pleased her immensely but all were laid quickly aside for a basket of wild flowers or mosses
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7374.mp3	for a fish bird animal or baby showing plainly her taste for the things of nature in preference to art her love for her birthplace with its hills streams and ocean is a sincere one
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7375.mp3	and young as she is and having seen the great city by the golden gate with many of its wonders she is happiest in chinik here lives her dear old grandmother her cousins and aunts
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7376.mp3	for which she has a whole heartful of love and the sight of which is better to her than medicine during the month of july we eagerly watched the incoming steamers and welcomed all new comers who landed in chinik
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7377.mp3	many were simply passing through on their way up fish river to the mines

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7379.mp3	and was watched with eager eyes by everyone we ate lettuce and radishes picked fresh from the garden beds where they had been sown by the captain's own hands and we found ageetuk and mollie to be quite famous cooks
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7380.mp3	nothing so delicious as their salads for the french cooks had long ago gone the hotel management being changed and mollie had a nice little kitchen of her own and with fresh salmon trout wild fowl
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7381.mp3	fresh meats and vegetables we made up for many months of winter dieting all this time i longed to get away i was going each day to the hill top to watch for the steamers which would bring the letters for which i waited

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7383.mp3	arranged as well as possible and when i boarded the steamer i would carry with me at least three deeds to as many claims with a fair prospect of others but i could not decide to remain another winter

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7385.mp3	the latter now grown wilful but still so bright and pretty i wanted to take both with me but no i could not the little girl's work was not ended
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7386.mp3	and she is surely about to fulfill it born as she was in a rough mining camp at the foot of the barren hills she was given the eskimo name of yahkuk meaning a little hill
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7387.mp3	and she like an oasis in a desert place is left here to cheer love and help others many times i have seen evidence of the sweet and gentle influences going out from the life of little yahkuk
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7388.mp3	as she lies upon her cot of pain a tall brown miner enters the living room goes to the little bed by the window speaks softly and bending over the tiny girl kisses her
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7389.mp3	then her big black eyes glance brightly into blue ones looking down from above full red lips part in a cordial smile while the one solitary dimple in the smooth round cheek
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7390.mp3	pricks its way still deeper and small arms go up around his neck when the man turns his face wears a soft and tender expression as though he were looking at some beautiful sight far away
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7391.mp3	and perhaps he is god grant that the sweet memory of that little child's kiss may be so lasting that all their lives he and others may be purer and better men

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7396.mp3	farewell to my white faced friends and to the dark skinned ones
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7397.mp3	chapter ten measure ninety seven from the standpoint of the eye a measure is that portion of the staff found between two bars in certain cases this space may be less than a measure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7398.mp3	as e g at the beginning and end of a movement but from the standpoint of the ear a single isolated measure is not possible and the term must therefore be defined in the plural form
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7399.mp3	measures are similarly accented groups of evenly spaced beats each group having at least one accented and one non accented beat the strongest accent falls normally on the first beat in the measure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7400.mp3	two essential characteristics are involved in the ordinary musical measure one a group of even beats or pulses always felt though not always actually sounded
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7401.mp3	one or more of these beats being stronger than the rest two certain rhythmic figures
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7402.mp3	cetera which form the actual musical content of these groups the student will note the essential difference between rhythm and measure rhythm is the regular recurrence of accent in a series of beats or pulses
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7403.mp3	while measure is the grouping of these beats according to some specified system in listening to a piece of music two hearers a and b may feel the rhythm equally strongly
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7404.mp3	but a may subjectively group the beats into one two one two et cetera while b feels the groups as one two three four one two three four et cetera
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7405.mp3	rhythm is thus seen to be a fundamental thing inherent in the music itself while measure is to a certain extent at least an arbitrary grouping which musicians have adopted for practical purposes ninety eight
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7406.mp3	in syncopation the normal system of accenting is temporarily suspended and the accented tone falls on the regularly unaccented part of the measure syncopation may therefore be defined as the temporary interruption of a normal series of accents
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7407.mp3	and compound a simple measure is one which has but a single accent
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7408.mp3	two beat measure and three beat measure a compound measure is as its name implies one made up by combining two or more simple measures or by the elaboration of a single measure in slow tempo
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7409.mp3	into several constituent groups the principal compound measures are four beat and six beat both being referred to as compound duple measures five beat seven beat nine beat and twelve beat measures
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7410.mp3	are also classified as compound measures an english writer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7411.mp3	classifies measures as duple triple or quadruple specifying that a simple measure is one in which each beat is represented by a note whose value can be divided into halves
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7412.mp3	and that a compound measure is one in which each beat is represented by a dotted note whose value can be divided into three parts
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7413.mp3	there is thus seen to be considerable difference of opinion as to the meaning of the words simple and compound when applied in this connection the principal question at issue being whether four beat measure is an individual variety
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7414.mp3	or whether it is a variety compounded out of two beat measures either by placing two of these in a group or by the elaboration of a single measure into a larger number of beats as is often necessary in slow tempi
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7415.mp3	perhaps the easiest way out of the difficulty is to admit that both may be true
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7416.mp3	in which there are three beats the first one being accented the second and third unaccented
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7417.mp3	three eighth three quarter and three half measure respectively three quadruple in which there are four beats the first and third being accented primary accent on one secondary accent on three
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7418.mp3	the second and fourth unaccented
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7419.mp3	four sextuple in which there are six beats the first and fourth being accented the others not in rapid tempi this is always taken as compound duple measure a dotted quarter note having a beat
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7420.mp3	it will be noted that the two measures
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7421.mp3	but these are practically always taken as three beat and four beat measures respectively being equivalent to these if each group of three tones is thought of as a triplet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7422.mp3	quintuple five beat and septuple seven beat measures are occasionally met with but these are rare and will always be sporadic the five beat measure is taken as a combination of three and two
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7423.mp3	or of two and three sometimes a mixture of both in the same composition while the seven beat measure is taken in groups of four and three or of three and four
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7424.mp3	but usage varies somewhat and the second sign is sometimes used to indicate four half measure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7425.mp3	but an incomplete circle differentiating two beat imperfect measure from three beat perfect measure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7426.mp3	chapter twenty seven but we must follow edward for a time on his arrival at paris he was kindly received by king charles who promised to assist his views in joining the army

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7574.mp3	which justify or are fundamental to the spiritual life and the way in which these experiences may be accommodated to the world view of the modern man and next the nature of that spiritual life as it appears in human history
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7575.mp3	the succeeding sections of the book treat in some detail the light cast on spiritual problems by mental analysis a process which need not necessarily be conducted from the standpoint of a degraded materialism
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7576.mp3	and by recent work on the psychology of autistic thought and of suggestion these investigations have a practical interest for every man who desires to be the captain of his soul
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7577.mp3	the relation in which institutional religion does or should stand to the spiritual life is also in part a matter for psychology which is here called upon to deal with the religious aspect of the social instincts
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7578.mp3	and the problems surrounding symbols and cults these chapters lead up to a discussion of the personal aspect of the spiritual life its curve of growth characters and activities
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7579.mp3	and a further section suggests some ways in which educationists might promote the up springing of this life in the young finally the last chapter attempts to place the fact of the life of the spirit in its relation to the social order
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7580.mp3	and to indicate some of the results which might follow upon its healthy corporate development it is superfluous to point out that each of these subjects needs at least a volume to itself

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7880.mp3	there is no time to play the woman another minute of this and we are lost pluck up thy courage keep thy eyes to the cliff and forward yet i could not but answered i cannot i cannot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7881.mp3	move thou must and tis better to risk falling now than fall for certain with another bullet in thee later on and with that he shifted his hand from my back and fixed it in my coat collar moving backwards himself and setting to drag me after him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7882.mp3	now i was so besotted with fright that i would not budge an inch fearing to fall over if i opened my eyes and elzevir for all he was so strong could not pull a helpless lump backwards up that path
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7883.mp3	so he gave it up leaving go hold on me with a groan and at that moment there rose from the under cliff below a sound of voices and shouting zounds they are down already cried elzevir and have found maskew's body
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7884.mp3	it is all up another minute and they will see us but so strange is the force of mind on body and the power of a greater to master a lesser fear that when i heard those voices from below all fright of falling left me in a moment
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7885.mp3	and i could open my eyes without a trace of giddiness so i began to move forward again on hands and knees and elzevir
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7886.mp3	thinking that we were hiding by the sea five minutes later elzevir stepped on to the cliff top with me upon his back we have made something of this throw he said and are safe for another hour though i thought thy giddy head had ruined us
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7887.mp3	the day was still young and far below us was stretched the moving floor of the channel with a silver grey film of night mists not yet lifted in the offing a hummocky up and down line of cliffs
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7888.mp3	with the straight sunpath across it spangled and gleaming like a mackerel's back the relief of being once more on firm ground and the exultation of an escape from immediate danger removed my pain and made me forget that my leg was broken
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7889.mp3	and the wind which a few minutes before threatened to blow me from that narrow ledge seemed now but the gentlest of breezes fresh with the breath of the kindly sea but this was only for a moment for the anguish came back and grew apace
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7890.mp3	and i fell to thinking dismally of the plight we were in how things had been against us in these last days first there was losing the why not and that was bad enough second
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7891.mp3	there was the being known by the excise for smugglers and perhaps for murderers third and last there was the breaking of my leg which made escape so difficult but most of all
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7892.mp3	there came before my eyes that grey face turned up against the morning sun and i thought of all it meant for grace and would have given my own life to call back that of our worst enemy then elzevir sat up stretching himself like one waking out of sleep
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7893.mp3	and said we must be gone they will not be back for some time yet and when they come will not think to search closely for us hereabouts but that we cannot risk and must get clear away
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7894.mp3	this leg of thine will keep us tied for weeks and we must find some place where we can lie hid and tend it now i know such a hiding hole in purbeck which they call joseph's pit and thither we must go but it will take all the day to get there
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7895.mp3	and so he took me in his arms again and started off across the fields i need not tell of that weary journey and indeed could not if i wished for the pain went to my head and filled me with such a drowsy anguish
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7896.mp3	that i knew nothing except when some unlooked for movement gave me a sharper twinge and made me cry out at first elzevir walked briskly but as the day wore on went slower
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7897.mp3	it was after noon for the sun was past the meridian and very hot for the time of year when the face of the country began to change and instead of the short sward of the open down sprinkled with tiny white snail shells
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7898.mp3	the ground was brashy with flat stones and divided up into tillage fields it was a bleak wide bitten place enough looking as if twould never pay for turning and instead of hedges there were dreary walls built of dry stone without mortar
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7899.mp3	behind one of these walls broken down in places but held together with straggling ivy and buttressed here and there with a bramble bush elzevir put me down at length and said i am beat and can carry thee no farther for this present
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7900.mp3	though there is not now much farther to go we have passed purbeck gates and these walls will screen us from prying eyes if any chance comer pass along the down and as for the soldiers they are not like to come this way so soon
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7901.mp3	and if they come i cannot help it for weariness and the sun's heat have made my feet like lead a score of years ago i would have laughed at such a task but now tis different
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7902.mp3	so sit thee here and lean thy shoulder up against the wall and thus thou canst look through this broken place and watch both ways then if thou see aught moving wake me up
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7903.mp3	i wish i had a thimbleful of powder to make this whistle sound' and he took maskew's silver butted pistol again from his bosom and handled it lovingly
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7904.mp3	with that he flung himself down where there was a narrow shadow close against the bottom of the wall and in a minute i knew from his heavy breathing that he was asleep the wind had freshened much and was blowing strong from the west
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7905.mp3	and now that i was under the lee of the wall
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7906.mp3	and gets at length into shelter moreover though i was not tired by grievous toil like elzevir i had passed a night without sleep and felt besides the weariness of pain to lull me to slumber
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7907.mp3	then i sought something to fix my thoughts and looking on that side of the wall where the sward was fell to counting the mole hills that were cast up in numbers thereabout and when i had exhausted them and reckoned up thirty little heaps of dry and powdery brown earth
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7908.mp3	that lay at random on the green turf i turned my eyes to the tillage field on the other side of the wall and saw the inch high blades of corn coming up between the stones then i fell to counting the blades feeling glad to have discovered a reckoning that would not be exhausted at thirty
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7909.mp3	but would go on for millions and millions and millions and before i had reached ten in so heroic a numeration was fast asleep a sharp noise woke me with a start that set the pain tingling in my leg
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7910.mp3	and though i could see nothing i knew that a shot had been fired very near us i was for waking elzevir but he was already full awake and put a finger on his lip to show i should not speak then
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7911.mp3	enough for him to look through the leaves without being seen he dropped down again with a look of relief and said tis but a lad scaring rooks with a blunderbuss we will not stir unless he makes this way a minute later he said the boy is coming straight for the wall
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7912.mp3	we shall have to show ourselves and while he spoke there was a rattle of falling stones where the boy was partly climbing and partly pulling down the dry wall and so elzevir stood up the boy looked frightened and made as if he would run off
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7913.mp3	but elzevir passed him the time of day in a civil voice and he stopped and gave it back what are you doing here son block asked scaring rooks for farmer topp was the answer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7914.mp3	have you got a charge of powder to spare said elzevir showing his pistol i want to get a rabbit in the gorse for supper and have dropped my flask maybe you've seen a flask in walking through the furrows he whispered to me to lie still
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7915.mp3	no time was wasted in words elzevir had the flask in his pocket and the boy was biting the crown what shot have you said elzevir what have you dropped your shot flask too asked the boy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7916.mp3	and his voice had something of surprise in it nay but my shot are over small
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7917.mp3	but thou must pay a shilling for them my master says i never am to use them except i see a swan or buzzard or something fit to cook come over i shall get a sound beating for my pains and to be beat is worth a shilling if thou art beat be beat for something more says elzevir the tempter
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7918.mp3	the smugglers got off clear but they say the hue and cry is up already and that a head price will be fixed of twenty pound so if i sell you a fowling piece maybe i shall do wrong and have the government upon me as well as my master the surprise in his voice was changed to suspicion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7919.mp3	for while he spoke i saw that his eye had fallen on my foot though i tried to keep it in the shadow and that he saw the boot clotted with blood and the kerchief tied round my leg tis for that very reason says elzevir that i want the firelock
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7920.mp3	these smugglers are roaming loose and a pistol is a poor thing to stop such wicked rascals on a lone hill side come come thou dost not want a piece to guard thee they will not hurt a boy he had the guinea between his finger and thumb
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7921.mp3	and so i said as much to elzevir who only laughed saying the boy was simple and harmless but from where i sat i could peep out through the brambles in the open gap and see without being seen and there was my young gentleman walking carelessly enough
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7922.mp3	but when elzevir sat down the boy gave a careful look round and seeing no one watching any more
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7923.mp3	then i knew that he had guessed who we were and was off to warn the hue and cry but before elzevir was on his feet again the boy was out of sight over the hill brow let us move on said block tis but a little distance now to go and the heat is past already
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7924.mp3	we must have slept three hours or more for thou art but a sorry watchman john tis when the sentry sleeps that the enemy laughs and for thee the posse might have had us both like daylight owls with that he took me on his back and made off with a lusty stride
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7925.mp3	and in the shelter of the walls we had slept longer than we thought for the sun was westering fast and though the rest had refreshed me my leg had grown stiff and hurt the more in dangling when we started again
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7926.mp3	elzevir was still walking strongly in spite of the heavy burden he carried and in less than half an hour i knew though i had never been there before we were in the land of the old marble quarries at the back of anvil point
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7927.mp3	although i knew little of these quarries and certainly was in evil plight to take note of anything at that time yet afterwards i learnt much about them out of such excavations comes that black purbeck marble which you see in old churches in our country
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7928.mp3	and i am told in other parts of england as well and the way of making a marble quarry is to sink a tunnel slanting very steeply down into the earth like a well turned askew till you reach fifty seventy or perhaps one hundred feet deep then
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7929.mp3	from the bottom of this shaft there spread out narrow passages or tunnels mostly six feet high but sometimes only three or four and in these the marble is dug these quarries were made by men centuries ago some say by the romans themselves
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7930.mp3	which was just putting on the brighter green of spring this turf was not smooth but hummocky for under it lay heaps of worthless stone and marble drawn out of the quarries ages ago which the green vestment had covered for the most part
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7931.mp3	though it left sometimes a little patch of broken rubble peering out at the top of a mound there were many tumble down walls and low gables left of the cottages of the old quarrymen grass covered ridges marked out the little garden folds

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/7938.mp3	and how far off we were now and how long it was likely to be before i saw that dear village and grace again the stairs were still sharp cut and little worn but elzevir paid great care to his feet lest he should slip on the ferns and mosses with which they were overgrown

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8123.mp3	and laid on my back where five people held me a young colored woman leaping upon my knees which seemed to break under the weight doctor gannon then forced the tube through my lips and down my throat i gasping and suffocating with the agony of it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8124.mp3	i didn't know where to breathe from and everything turned black when the fluid began pouring in i was moaning and making the most awful sounds quite against my will for i did not wish to disturb my friends in the next room finally
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8125.mp3	the tube was withdrawn i lay motionless after a while i was dressed and carried in a chair to a waiting automobile laid on the back seat and driven into washington to the jail hospital previous to the feeding
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8126.mp3	i had been forcibly examined by doctor gannon i protesting that i wished a woman physician of this experience miss burns wrote on tiny scraps of paper wednesday
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8127.mp3	yesterday afternoon at about four or five missus lewis and i were asked to go to the operating room went there and found our clothes told we were to go to washington no reason as usual when we were dressed doctor gannon appeared
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8128.mp3	and said he wished to examine us both refused were dragged through halls by force our clothing partly removed by force and we were examined heart tested blood pressure and pulse taken of course such data was of no value after such a struggle doctor gannon told me then i must be fed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8129.mp3	was stretched on bed two doctors matron four colored prisoners present whittaker in hall i was held down by five people at legs arms and head i refused to open mouth gannon pushed tube up left nostril
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8130.mp3	i turned and twisted my head all i could but he managed to push it up it hurts nose and throat very much and makes nose bleed freely tube drawn out covered with blood operation leaves one very sick
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8131.mp3	left nostril throat and muscles of neck very sore all night after this i was brought into the hospital in an ambulance missus lewis and i placed in same room slept hardly at all this morning doctor ladd appeared with his tube

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8157.mp3	gag you and put you in a straitjacket i wish to state again that the cells into which we were put were situated in the men's prison

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8161.mp3	incited to their brutal conduct towards us by the superintendent i thought of the offense with which we had been charged merely that of obstructing traffic and felt that the treatment that we had received was out of all proportion to the offense with which we were charged

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8165.mp3	and requested permission to lie down feeling so ill i could not sleep having a sense of constant danger i was almost paralyzed and in wretched physical condition

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8168.mp3	and this went on until we reached the sewing room the effect of this upon our nerves can better be imagined than described every conceivable lie was tried in an effort to force the women to abandon their various form of resistance
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8169.mp3	they were told that no efforts were being made from the outside to reach them and that their attorney had been called off the case each one was told that she was the only one hunger striking each one was told that all the others had put on prison clothes and were working
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8170.mp3	although they were separated from one another they suspected the lies and remained strong in their resistance after mister o'brien's one visit and the subsequent reports in the press he was thereafter refused admission to the workhouse
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8171.mp3	it was evident that the administration was anxious to keep this group away from alice paul and her companions as they counted on handling the rebellion more easily in two groups than one meanwhile the condition of the prisoners in the workhouse grew steadily worse
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8172.mp3	we decided to take the only course open to obtain a writ of habeas corpus a hurried journey by counsel to united states district judge waddill of norfolk virginia brought the writ
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8173.mp3	it compelled the government to bring the prisoners into court and show cause why they should not be returned to the district jail this conservative southern judge said of the petition for the writ
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8174.mp3	there followed a week more melodramatic than the most stirring moving picture film although the writ had been applied for in the greatest secrecy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8175.mp3	a detective suddenly appeared to accompany mister o'brien from washington to norfolk during his stay in norfolk and back to washington telephone wires at our headquarters were tapped it was evident that the administration was cognizant of every move in this procedure before it was executed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8176.mp3	no sooner was our plan decided upon than friends of the administration besought us to abandon the habeas corpus proceedings one member of the administration sent an emissary to our headquarters with the following appeal
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8177.mp3	if you will only drop these proceedings i can absolutely guarantee you that the prisoners will be removed from the workhouse to the jail in a week in a week they may be dead by that time we answered we cannot wait
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8178.mp3	and before the end of the week they hoped to increase their facilities for forcible feeding at the workhouse they also wished to conceal the treatment of the women the exposure of which would be inevitable in any court proceedings and lastly
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8179.mp3	the administration was anxious to avoid opening up the whole question of the legality of the very existence of the workhouse in virginia persons convicted in the district for acts committed in violation of district law were transported to virginia alien territory to serve their terms
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8180.mp3	it was a moot point whether prisoners were so treated with sufficient warrant in law eminent jurists held that the district had no right to convict a person under its laws and commit that person to confinement in another state they contended that sentence imposed upon a person for unlawful acts in the district
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8181.mp3	should be executed in the district hundreds of persons who had been convicted in the district of columbia and who had served their sentences in virginia had been without money or influence enough to contest this doubtful procedure in the courts the administration
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8182.mp3	was alarmed we quickened our pace a member of the administration rushed his attorney as courier to the women in the workhouse to implore them not to consent to the habeas corpus proceedings he was easily admitted and tried to extort from one prisoner at a time a promise to reject the plan
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8183.mp3	the women suspected his solicitude and refused to make any promise whatsoever without first being allowed to see their own attorney we began at once to serve the writ ordinarily this would be an easy thing to do but for us it developed into a very difficult task
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8184.mp3	a deputy marshal must serve the writ counsel sought a deputy for miles around washington not one was to be found at his home or lodgings none could be reached by telephone
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8185.mp3	where he kept himself discreetly hidden for several days when a deputy was found six attempts were made to serve the writ all failed finally by a ruse mister whittaker was caught at his home late at night
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8186.mp3	some had over trustful characters like the seals or exploitable characters like cows and chickens and sheep such creatures sentence themselves to be captives by their lack of ambition dogs they have more spirit
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8187.mp3	but they have lost their chance of kingship through worshipping us the dog's finer qualities can't be praised too warmly there is a purity about his devotion which makes mere men feel speechless but with all love for dogs
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8188.mp3	one must grant they are vassals not rulers they are too parasitic the one willing servant class of the world and we have betrayed them by making under simians of them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8189.mp3	loving us they let us stop their developing in tune with their natures and they've patiently tried ever since to adopt ways of ours they have done it too but of course they can't get far it's not their own road
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8190.mp3	dogs have more love than integrity they've been true to us yes but they haven't been true to themselves pigs the pig is remarkably intelligent and brave but he's gross
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8191.mp3	and grossness delays one's achievement it takes so much time the snake too though wise has a way of eating himself into stupors if super snake men had had banquets they would have been too vast to describe
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8192.mp3	and well should the elephant know it he had the best chance of all wiser even than the lion or the wisest of apes his wisdom furthermore was benign where theirs was sinister consider his dignity his poise and skill
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8193.mp3	he was plastic too he had learned to eat many foods and endure many climates once some say this race explored the globe their bones are found everywhere in south america even
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8194.mp3	so the elephants columbus may have found some road here before ours they are cosmopolitans these suave and well bred beings they have rich emotional natures long memories loyalty they are steady and sure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8195.mp3	and not narrow not self absorbed for they seem interested in everything what was it then that put them out of the race could it have been a quite natural belief that they had already won and when they saw that they hadn't
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8196.mp3	and that the monkey men were getting ahead were they too great minded and decent to exterminate their puny rivals it may have been their tolerance and patience that betrayed them they wait too long before they resent an imposition or insult
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8197.mp3	just as ants are too energetic and cats too shrewd for their own highest good so the elephants suffer from too much patience their exhibitions of it may seem superb such power and such restraint combined are noble
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8198.mp3	more live and let live in allowing other species to stay here our way is to kill good and bad male and female and babies till the few last survivors lie hidden away from our guns
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8199.mp3	all species must surrender unconditionally those are our terms and come and live in barns alongside us or on us as parasites the creatures that want to live a life of their own we call wild if wild
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8200.mp3	then no matter how harmless we treat them as outlaws and those of us who are specially well brought up shoot them for fun some might be our friends we don't wish it we keep them all terrorized
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8201.mp3	when one of us conquering monkey men enters the woods most animals that scent him slink away or race off in a panic it is not that we have planned this deliberately but they know what we're like race by race they have been slaughtered
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8202.mp3	soon all will be gone we give neither freedom nor life room to those we defeat if we had been as strong as the elephants we might have been kinder when great power comes naturally to people
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8203.mp3	it is used more urbanely we use it as parvenus do because that's what we are the elephant being born to it is easy going confident tolerant he would have been a more humane king
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8204.mp3	the elephant is stupid when it comes to learning how to use tools so are all other species except our own isn't it strange a tool in the most primitive sense is any object lying around
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8205.mp3	that can obviously be used as an instrument for this or that purpose many creatures use objects as materials as birds use twigs for nests but the step that no animal takes is learning freely to use things as instruments
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8206.mp3	when an elephant plucks off a branch and swishes his flanks and thus keeps away insects he is using a tool but he does it only by a vague and haphazard association of ideas if he once became a conscious user of tools
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8207.mp3	he would of course go much further we ourselves who are so good at it now were slow enough in beginning think of the long epochs that passed before it entered our heads
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8208.mp3	and all that while the contest for leadership blindly went on without any species making use of this obvious aid the lesson to be learned was simple the reward was the rule of a planet yet only one species our own
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8209.mp3	has ever had that much brains it makes you wonder what other obvious lessons may still be unlearned it is not necessarily stupid however to fail to use tools to use tools involves using reason
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8210.mp3	instead of sticking to instinct now sticking to instinct has its disadvantages but so has using reason whichever faculty you use the other atrophies and partly deserts you we are trying to use both

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8316.mp3	we were face to face with the question which we had considered at the convention the previous month when war was rumored as to what position we as an organization should take in this situation the atmosphere of that convention had been dramatic in the extreme
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8317.mp3	most of the delegates assembled had been approached either before going to washington or upon arriving and urged to use their influence to persuade the organization to abandon its work for the freedom of women and turn its activities into war channels

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8319.mp3	the president will turn this imperialistic war into a crusade for democracy lay aside your own fight and help us crush germany and you will find yourselves rewarded with a vote out of the nation's gratitude were some of the appeals made to our women by government officials high and low
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8320.mp3	and by the rank and file of men and women never in history did a band of women stand together with more sanity and greater solidarity than did these one thousand delegates representing thousands more throughout the states as our official organ the suffragist

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8322.mp3	we were united on no other subject some would offer passive resistance to the war others would become devoted followers of a vigorous military policy between these every shade of opinion was represented each was loyal to the ideas which she held for her country
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8323.mp3	had nothing to do it was concerned only with the effort to obtain for women the opportunity to give effective expression through political power to their ideals whatever they might be
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8324.mp3	the thousand delegates present at the convention though differing widely on the duty of the individual in war were unanimous in voting that in the event of war the national woman's party as an organization should continue to work for political liberty for women and for that alone

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8326.mp3	they were also unanimous in the opinion that all service which individuals wished to give to war or peace should be given through groups organized for such purposes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8327.mp3	for one purpose only to secure an amendment to the united states constitution enfranchising women we declared officially through our organ that this held as the policy of the woman's party whatever turn public events may take
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8328.mp3	and announced that no subjects would be considered by them unless the president urged them as war measures our task was from that time on to make national suffrage a war measure we at once urged upon the administration the wisdom of accepting this proposed reform as a war measure

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8330.mp3	was most perplexing here were we citizens without power and recognition with the only weapons to which a powerless class which does not take up arms can resort we could not and would not fight with men's weapons
