https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8417.mp3	and it has even a natural tendency to pervert the true by infusing into it a strong mixture of superstition folly and delusion each ghostly practitioner in order to render himself more precious and sacred in the eyes of his retainers
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8418.mp3	will inspire them with the most violent abhorrence of all other sects and continually endeavor by some novelty to excite the languid devotion of his audience no regard will be paid to truth morals or decency in the doctrines inculcated
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8419.mp3	every tenet will be adopted that best suits the disorderly affections of the human frame customers will be drawn to each conventicle by new industry and address in practising on the passions and credulity of the populace
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8420.mp3	and in the end the civil magistrate will find that he has dearly paid for his pretended frugality in saving a fixed establishment for the priests and that in reality the most decent and advantageous composition which he can make with the spiritual guides
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8421.mp3	is to bribe their indolence by assigning stated salaries to their profession and rendering it superfluous for them to be further active than merely to prevent their flock from straying in quest of new pastures
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8422.mp3	and in this manner ecclesiastical establishments though commonly they arose at first from religious views prove in the end advantageous to the political interests of society
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8423.mp3	but we may observe that few ecclesiastical establishments have been fixed upon a worse foundation than that of the church of rome or have been attended with circumstances more hurtful to the peace and happiness of mankind
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8424.mp3	the large revenues privileges immunities and powers of the clergy rendered them formidable to the civil magistrate and armed with too extensive authority an order of men who always adhere closely together
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8425.mp3	the higher dignities of the church served indeed to the support of gentry and nobility but by the establishment of monasteries many of the lowest vulgar were taken from the useful arts and maintained in those receptacles of sloth and ignorance
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8426.mp3	the supreme head of the church was a foreign potentate guided by interests always different from those of the community sometimes contrary to them and as the hierarchy was necessarily solicitous to preserve a unity of faith rites and ceremonies
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8427.mp3	all liberty of thought ran a manifest risk of being extinguished and violent persecutions or what was worse a stupid and abject credulity took place every where to increase these evils the church
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8428.mp3	though she possessed large revenues was not contented with her acquisitions
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8429.mp3	she even bestowed on each individual priest a power of enriching himself by the voluntary oblations of the faithful and left him still an urgent motive for diligence and industry in his calling
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8430.mp3	and thus that church though an expensive and burdensome establishment was liable to many of the inconveniences which belong to an order of priests trusting entirely to their own art and invention for obtaining a subsistence
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8431.mp3	the advantages attending the romish hierarchy were but a small compensation for its inconveniences the ecclesiastical privileges during barbarous times
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8432.mp3	and the pomp and splendor of worship which belonged to so opulent an establishment contributed in some respect to the encouragement of the fine arts and began to diffuse a general elegance of taste by uniting it with religion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8433.mp3	it will easily be conceived that though the balance of evil prevailed in the romish church this was not the chief reason which produced the reformation a concurrence of incidents must have contributed to forward that great revolution
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8434.mp3	in order to support his projects pleasures and liberalities the scheme of selling indulgences was suggested to him as an expedient which had often served in former times to draw money from the christian world
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8435.mp3	and make devout people willing contributors to the grandeur and riches of the court of rome the church it was supposed was possessed of a great stock of merit as being entitled to all the good works of all the saints beyond what were employed in their own justification
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8436.mp3	and even to the merits of christ himself which were infinite and unbounded and from this unexhausted treasury the pope might retail particular portions and by that traffic acquire money to be employed in pious purposes in resisting the infidels
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8437.mp3	or subduing schismatics when the money came into his exchequer the greater part of it was usually diverted to other purposes it is commonly believed that leo from the penetration of his genius and his familiarity with ancient literature
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8438.mp3	was fully acquainted with the ridicule and falsity of the doctrines which as supreme pontiff
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8439.mp3	may justly in part be ascribed to the late invention of printing and revival of learning not that reason bore any considerable share in opening men's eyes with regard to the impostures of the romish church for of all branches of literature philosophy had
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8440.mp3	as yet and till long afterwards made the most inconsiderable progress neither is there any instance that argument has ever been able to free the people from that enormous load of absurdity
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8441.mp3	with which superstition has every where overwhelmed them not to mention that the rapid advance of the lutheran doctrine and the violence with which it was embraced prove sufficiently that it owed not its success to reason and reflection
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8442.mp3	were propagated more quickly and in greater numbers the minds of men somewhat awakened from a profound sleep of so many centuries were prepared for every novelty and scrupled less to tread in any unusual path which was opened to them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8443.mp3	and as copies of the scriptures and other ancient monuments of the christian faith became more common
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8444.mp3	many of the powers indeed assumed by the church of rome were very ancient and were prior to almost every political government established in europe
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8445.mp3	which time might render valid but appealed still to a divine origin men were tempted to look into their primitive charter and they could without much difficulty perceive its defect in truth and authenticity
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8446.mp3	in order to bestow on this topic the greater influence luther and his followers not satisfied with opposing the pretended divinity of the romish church and displaying the temporal inconveniences of that establishment
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8447.mp3	carried matters much further and treated the religion of their ancestors as abominable detestable damnable foretold by sacred writ itself as the source of all wickedness and pollution they denominated the pope antichrist
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8448.mp3	called his communion the scarlet whore and gave to rome the appellation of babylon expressions which however applied were to be found in scripture and which were better calculated to operate on the multitude than the most solid arguments
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8449.mp3	excited by contest and persecution on the one hand by success and applause on the other many of the reformers carried to the greatest extremities their opposition to the church of rome
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8450.mp3	and in contradiction to the multiplied superstitions with which that communion was loaded they adopted an enthusiastic strain of devotion which admitted of no observances rites or ceremonies but placed all merit
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8451.mp3	in a mysterious species of faith in inward vision rapture and ecstasy the new sectaries seized with this spirit were indefatigable in the propagation of their doctrine
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8452.mp3	against the ecclesiastical jurisdiction the lutherans advanced doctrines favorable in some respect to the temporal authority of sovereigns they inveighed against the abuses of the court of rome
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8453.mp3	in those powers of which the encroaching spirit of the ecclesiastics especially of the sovereign pontiff had so long bereaved them they condemned celibacy and monastic vows and thereby opened the doors of the convents
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8454.mp3	to those who were either tired of the obedience and chastity or disgusted with the license in which they had hitherto lived they blamed the excessive riches the idleness
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8455.mp3	the libertinism of the clergy and pointed out their treasures and revenues as lawful spoil to the first invader and as the ecclesiastics had hitherto conducted a willing and a stupid audience and were totally unacquainted with controversy much more
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8456.mp3	with every species of true literature they were unable to defend themselves against men armed with authorities quotations and popular topics and qualified to triumph in every altercation or debate
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8457.mp3	died in the flower of his age a little after he received the king's book against luther and he was succeeded in the papal chair by adrian a fleming who had been tutor to the emperor charles this man was fitted to gain on the reformers by the integrity candor
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8458.mp3	and simplicity of manners which distinguished his character but so violent were their prejudices against the church he rather hurt the cause by his imprudent exercise of those virtues he frankly confessed that many abominable and detestable practices prevailed in the court of rome
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8459.mp3	and by this sincere avowal he gave occasion of much triumph to the lutherans this pontiff also whose penetration was not equal to his good intentions was seduced to concur in that league which charles and henry had formed against france
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8460.mp3	and who dreaded the resentment of that haughty minister was solicitous to repair the breach made in their friendship by this incident
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8461.mp3	he renewed to wolsey all the promises which he had made him of seconding his pretensions to the papal throne
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8462.mp3	to the next election the emperor renewed the treaty made at bruges
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8463.mp3	the more to ingratiate himself with henry and the english nation he gave to surrey admiral of england a commission for being admiral of his dominions and he himself was installed knight of the garter at london
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8464.mp3	marguerite's aching heart stood still she felt more than she heard the men on the watch preparing for the fight her senses told her that each with sword in hand was crouching ready for the spring
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8465.mp3	the voice came nearer and nearer in the vast immensity of these lonely cliffs with the loud murmur of the sea below it was impossible to say how near or how far nor yet from which direction came that cheerful singer who sang to god to save his king whilst he himself was in such deadly danger
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8466.mp3	felt that her very life was slipping away as if when that voice drew nearer when that singer became entrapped she distinctly heard the click of desgas gun close to her no no no no oh god in heaven this cannot be
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8467.mp3	let armand's blood then be on her own head let her be branded as his murderer let even he whom she loved despise and loathe her for this but god oh god save him at any cost with a wild shriek she sprang to her feet and darted round the rock
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8468.mp3	armand armand for god's sake fire your leader is near he is coming he is betrayed armand armand fire in heaven's name she was seized and thrown to the ground she lay there moaning bruised not caring but still half sobbing half shrieking
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8469.mp3	percy my husband for god's sake fly armand armand why don't you fire
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8470.mp3	something was thrown over her face she could not breathe and perforce she was silent the bold singer too had become silent warned no doubt of his impending danger by marguerite's frantic shrieks the men had sprung to their feet there was no need for further silence on their part
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8471.mp3	the very cliffs echoed the poor heart broken woman's screams chauvelin with a muttered oath which boded no good to her who had dared to upset his most cherished plans had hastily shouted the word of command into it my men and let no one escape from that hut alive
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8472.mp3	the moon had once more emerged from between the clouds the darkness on the cliffs had gone giving place once more to brilliant silvery light some of the soldiers had rushed to the rough wooden door of the hut whilst one of them kept guard over marguerite
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8473.mp3	the door was partially open one of the soldiers pushed it further but within all was darkness the charcoal fire only lighting with a dim red light the furthest corner of the hut the soldiers paused automatically at the door like machines waiting for further orders
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8474.mp3	was for the moment paralyzed with astonishment when he saw the soldiers standing there at attention like sentries on guard whilst not a sound proceeded from the hut filled with strange anxious foreboding he too went to the door of the hut and peering into the gloom he asked quickly
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8475.mp3	what is the meaning of this i think citoyen that there is no one there now replied one of the soldiers imperturbably you have not let those four men go thundered chauvelin menacingly i ordered you to let no man escape alive quick after them all of you quick in every direction
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8476.mp3	the men obedient as machines rushed down the rocky incline towards the beach some going off to right and left as fast as their feet could carry them you and your men will pay with your lives for this blunder citoyen sergeant said chauvelin viciously to the sergeant who had been in charge of the men
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8477.mp3	and you too citoyen he added turning with a snarl to desgas for disobeying my orders you ordered us to wait citoyen until the tall englishman arrived and joined the four men in the hut no one came said the sergeant sullenly

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8495.mp3	i cannot quite reach you without risking your lives and endangering the success of your rescue when you receive this wait two minutes then creep out of the hut one by one turn to your left sharply and creep cautiously down the cliff

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8512.mp3	with true french contempt of the jew which has survived the lapse of centuries even to this day he would not go too near him but said with biting sarcasm as the wretched old man was brought in full light of the moon by the two soldiers
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8513.mp3	i suppose now that being a jew you have a good memory for bargains answer he again commanded as the jew with trembling lips seemed too frightened to speak yes your honour stammered the poor wretch

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8519.mp3	i think i can rely on you citoyen soldiers laughed chauvelin maliciously to give this old liar the best and soundest beating he has ever experienced but don't kill him he added drily we will obey citoyen replied the soldiers as imperturbably as ever
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8520.mp3	he did not wait to see his orders carried out he knew that he could trust these soldiers who were still smarting under his rebuke not to mince matters when given a free hand to belabour a third party
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8521.mp3	the jew and the woman can look after each other he added roughly until we can send somebody for them in the morning they can't run away very far in their present condition and we cannot be troubled with them just now chauvelin had not given up all hope his men he knew were spurred on by the hope of the reward
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8522.mp3	but he felt less sure now the englishman's audacity had baffled him once whilst the wooden headed stupidity of the soldiers and the interference of a woman had turned his hand which held all the trumps into a losing one
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8523.mp3	it was a long if and chauvelin stood for a moment quite still and enrolled thirty odd people in one long overwhelming anathema nature poetic silent balmy the bright moon the calm silvery sea spoke of beauty and of rest
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8524.mp3	and chauvelin cursed nature cursed man and woman and above all he cursed all long legged meddlesome british enigmas with one gigantic curse the howls of the jew behind him undergoing his punishment sent a balm through his heart
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8525.mp3	overburdened as it was with revengeful malice he smiled it eased his mind to think that some human being at least was like himself not altogether at peace with mankind he turned and took a last look at the lonely bit of coast where stood the wooden hut now bathed in moonlight
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8526.mp3	the scene of the greatest discomfiture ever experienced by a leading member of the committee of public safety against a rock on a hard bed of stone lay the unconscious figure of marguerite blakeney
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8527.mp3	while some few paces further on the unfortunate jew was receiving on his broad back the blows of two stout leather belts wielded by the stolid arms of two sturdy soldiers of the republic the howls of benjamin rosenbaum were fit to make the dead rise from their graves
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8528.mp3	that will do commanded chauvelin as the jew's moans became more feeble and the poor wretch seemed to have fainted away we don't want to kill him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8529.mp3	leave him there said chauvelin and lead the way now quickly to the cart i'll follow he walked up to where marguerite lay and looked down into her face
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8530.mp3	she had evidently recovered consciousness and was making feeble efforts to raise herself her large blue eyes were looking at the moonlit scene round her with a scared and terrified look they rested with a mixture of horror and pity on the jew
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8531.mp3	with mock gallantry he stooped and raised her icy cold hand to his lips which sent a thrill of indescribable loathing through marguerite's weary frame
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8532.mp3	i much regret fair lady he said in his most suave tones that circumstances over which i have no control compel me to leave you here for the moment but i go away secure in the knowledge that i do not leave you unprotected
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8533.mp3	i have no doubt at dawn i will send an escort for you until then i feel sure that you will find him devoted though perhaps a trifle slow marguerite only had the strength to turn her head away her heart was broken with cruel anguish
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8534.mp3	what had become of percy what of armand she knew nothing of what had happened after she heard the cheerful song god save the king which she believed to be the signal of death i myself concluded chauvelin must now very reluctantly leave you
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8535.mp3	au revoir fair lady we meet i hope soon in london shall i see you at the prince of wales garden party no ah well au revoir remember me i pray to sir percy blakeney
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8536.mp3	you speak of jealousies and fears lay your hands on your hearts and ask yourselves whether i may not likewise be disturbed with fears and jealousies and if so i assure you that this message has nothing lessened them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8537.mp3	what would you have have i violated your laws have i denied to pass any bill for the ease and security of my subjects i do not ask what you have done for me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8538.mp3	all this considered there is a judgment of heaven upon this nation if these distractions continue god so deal with me and mine as all my thoughts and intentions are upright for the maintenance of the true protestant profession
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8539.mp3	and for the observance and preservation of the laws and i hope god will bless and assist those laws for my preservation no sooner did the commons despair of obtaining the king's consent to their bill than they instantly voted
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8540.mp3	that those who advised his majesty's answer were enemies to the state and mischievous projectors against the safety of the nation that this denial is of such dangerous consequence that if his majesty persist in it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8541.mp3	it will hazard the peace and tranquillity of all his kingdoms unless some speedy remedy be applied by the wisdom and authority of both houses and that such of the subjects as have put themselves in a posture of defence against the common danger
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8542.mp3	with the terrors of invasion with the dread of english and irish papists and the most unaccountable panics were spread throughout the nation lord digby having entered kingston in a coach and six
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8543.mp3	attended by a few livery servants the intelligence was conveyed to london and it was immediately voted that he had appeared in a hostile manner to the terror and affright of his majesty's subjects
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8544.mp3	had been sufficient to open the eyes of many and to recover them from the astonishment with which at first they had been seized
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8545.mp3	and they proceeded to frame an ordinance in which by the authority of the two houses without the king's consent they named lieutenants for all the counties and conferred on them the command of the whole military force of all the guards
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8546.mp3	garrisons and forts of the kingdom he issued proclamations against this manifest usurpation
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8547.mp3	as he professed a resolution strictly to observe the law himself so was he determined he said to oblige every other person to pay it a like obedience the name of the king was so essential to all laws
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8548.mp3	and so familiar in all acts of executive authority that the parliament was afraid had they totally omitted it that the innovation would be too sensible to the people in all commands therefore which they conferred
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8549.mp3	they bound the persons to obey the orders of his majesty signified by both houses of parliament and inventing a distinction hitherto unheard of between the office and the person of the king
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8550.mp3	those very forces which they employed against him they levied in his name and by his authority it is remarkable how much the topics of argument were now reversed between the parties the king
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8551.mp3	while he acknowledged his former error of employing a plea of necessity in order to infringe the laws and constitution warned the parliament not to imitate an example on which they threw such violent blame and the parliament
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8552.mp3	while they clothed their personal fears or ambition under the appearance of national and imminent danger made unknowingly an apology for the most exceptionable part of the king's conduct
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8553.mp3	that the liberties of the people were no longer exposed to any peril from royal authority so narrowly circumscribed so exactly defined
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8554.mp3	might be maintained upon very plausible topics but that the danger allowing it to have any existence was not of that kind great urgent inevitable which dissolves all law and levels all limitations
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8555.mp3	were undoubtedly not of a civil but of a religious nature the distempered imaginations of men were agitated with a continual dread of popery with a horror against prelacy with an antipathy to ceremonies and the liturgy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8556.mp3	and more actuated by principle
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8557.mp3	never were there individuals who possessed more capacity more courage more public spirit more disinterested zeal the infusion of one ingredient in too large a proportion had corrupted all these noble principles
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8558.mp3	and converted them into the most virulent poison to determine his choice in the approaching contests every man hearkened with avidity to the reasons proposed on both sides the war of the pen preceded that of the sword
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8559.mp3	lord falkland had accepted the office of secretary a man who adorned the purest virtue with the richest gifts of nature and the most valuable acquisitions of learning by him assisted by the king himself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8560.mp3	were the memorials of the royal party chiefly composed so sensible was charles of his superiority in this particular that he took care to disperse every where the papers of the parliament together with his own
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8561.mp3	by comparison to form a judgment between them the parliament while they distributed copies of their own were anxious to suppress all the king's compositions
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8562.mp3	to the ordinance of the parliament concerning the militia the king opposed his commissions of array the counties obeyed the one or the other according as they stood affected and in many counties where the people were divided
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8563.mp3	mobbish combats and skirmishes ensued the parliament on this occasion went so far as to vote that when the lords and commons in parliament which is the supreme court of judicature
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8564.mp3	upon the same principles they pretended by a verbal criticism on the tense of a latin verb to ravish from the king his negative voice in the legislature

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8568.mp3	that the king seduced by wicked counsel intended to make war against his parliament who in all their consultations and actions had proposed no other end but the care of his kingdoms
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8569.mp3	were traitors to the fundamental laws of the kingdom the armies which had been everywhere raised on pretence of the service in ireland were henceforth more openly enlisted by the parliament for their own purposes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8570.mp3	and the command of them was given to the earl of essex in london no less than four thousand men enlisted in one day and the parliament voted a declaration which they required every member to subscribe

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8572.mp3	and wait till the treasurers could find leisure to receive them such zeal animated the pious partisans of the parliament
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8573.mp3	near the moiety too of the lower house absented themselves from counsels which they deemed so full of danger the commons sent up an impeachment against nine peers for deserting their duty in parliament
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8574.mp3	their own members also who should return to them they voted not to admit till satisfied concerning the reason of their absence charles made a declaration to the peers who attended him

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8576.mp3	in order to remove all jealousy he had resolved that their usurpations and illegal pretensions should be apparent to the whole world and thought that to recover the confidence of the people was a point much more material to his interest
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8577.mp3	than the collecting of any magazines stores or armies which might breed apprehensions of violent or illegal counsels but the urgent necessity of his situation no longer admitted of delay

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8595.mp3	of invading the established government of church and state it could not be expected that their proceedings in such a violent attempt would thenceforth be altogether regular and equitable but it must be confessed that

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8606.mp3	they possessed authority sufficient to regulate and control in order to obtain a majority in the upper house the commons had recourse to the populace who on other occasions had done them such important service

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8608.mp3	however ridiculous were willingly attended to and were dispersed among the multitude to whose capacity they were well adapted beale a tailor informed the commons that walking in the fields

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8613.mp3	and resounded with the dangers which threatened religion from the desperate attempts of papists and malignants multitudes flocked towards westminster and insulted the prelates and such of the lords as adhered to the crown
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8614.mp3	the peers voted a declaration against those tumults and sent it to the lower house but these refused their concurrence some seditious apprentices being seized and committed to prison immediately received their liberty

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8618.mp3	being distinguishable by their habit and being the object of violent hatred to all the sectaries were exposed to the most dangerous insults williams now created archbishop of york
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8619.mp3	that though they had an undoubted right to sit and vote in parliament yet in coming thither they had been menaced assaulted affronted by the unruly multitude and could no longer with safety attend their duty in the house
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8620.mp3	for this reason they protested against all laws votes and resolutions as null and invalid which should pass during the time of their constrained absence this protestation which
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8621.mp3	that house desired a conference with the commons whom they informed of this unexpected protestation the opportunity was seized with joy and triumph
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8622.mp3	the king was betrayed into another indiscretion much more fatal an indiscretion to which all the ensuing disorders and civil wars ought immediately and directly to be ascribed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8623.mp3	this was the impeachment of lord kimbolton and the five members when the commons employed in their remonstrance language so severe and indecent they had not been actuated entirely by insolence and passion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8624.mp3	their views were more solid and profound they considered that in a violent attempt such as an invasion of the ancient constitution the more leisure was afforded the people to reflect
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8625.mp3	the less would they be inclined to second that rash and dangerous enterprise that the peers would certainly refuse their concurrence nor were there any hopes of prevailing on them but by instigating the populace to tumult and disorder
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8626.mp3	that the employing of such odious means for so invidious an end would at long run lose them all their popularity and turn the tide of favor to the contrary party and that if the king only remained in tranquillity
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8627.mp3	they were therefore resolved if possible to excite him to some violent passion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8628.mp3	it was not long before they succeeded beyond their fondest wishes charles was enraged to find that all his concessions but increased their demands
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8629.mp3	were again roused to sedition and tumults that the blackest calumnies were propagated against him and even the irish massacre ascribed to his counsels and machinations
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8630.mp3	he was apt to ascribe them in a great measure to his own indolence and facility the queen and the ladies of the court further stimulated his passion and represented that
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8631.mp3	if he exerted the vigor and displayed the majesty of a monarch the daring usurpations of his subjects would shrink before him lord digby a man of fine parts but full of levity and hurried on by precipitate passions
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8632.mp3	that they had traitorously endeavored to subvert the fundamental laws and government of the kingdom to deprive the king of his regal power and to impose on his subjects an arbitrary and tyrannical authority that they had endeavored
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8633.mp3	by many foul aspersions on his majesty and his government to alienate the affections of his people and make him odious to them that they had attempted to draw his late army to disobedience of his royal commands
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8634.mp3	and to side with them in their traitorous designs
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8635.mp3	seem to be common between the impeached members and the parliament
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8636.mp3	than so far as they concurred with the majority in their votes and speeches though proofs might perhaps be produced of their privately inviting the scots to invade england
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8637.mp3	how could such an attempt be considered as treason after the act of oblivion which had passed and after that both houses with the king's concurrence had voted that nation three hundred thousand pounds for their brotherly assistance
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8638.mp3	while the house of peers are scarcely able to maintain their independency or to reject the bills sent them by the commons will they ever be permitted by the populace supposing them inclined
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8639.mp3	but surely was never before attempted in opposition to a faction during the full tide of its power and success but men had not leisure to wonder at the indiscretion of this measure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8640.mp3	messengers were employed to search for them and arrest them their trunks chambers and studies were sealed and locked the house voted all these acts of violence to be breaches of privilege
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8641.mp3	and commanded every one to defend the liberty of the members the king irritated by all this opposition resolved next day to come in person to the house with an intention to demand perhaps seize in their presence
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8642.mp3	the persons whom he had accused this resolution was discovered to the countess of carlisle sister to northumberland a lady of spirit wit and intrigue she privately sent intelligence to the five members
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8643.mp3	and they had time to withdraw a moment before the king entered he was accompanied by his ordinary retinue to the number of above two hundred armed as usual some with halberts
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8644.mp3	yesterday i sent a serjeant at arms to demand some who by my order were accused of high treason instead of obedience i received a message i must here declare to you
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8645.mp3	that though no king that ever was in england could be more careful of your privileges than i shall be yet in cases of treason no person has privilege
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8646.mp3	i never did intend any force but shall proceed against them in a fair and legal way for i never meant any other and now since i see i cannot do what i came for
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8647.mp3	he asked the speaker who stood below whether any of these persons were in the house the speaker falling on his knee prudently replied i have sir
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8648.mp3	neither eyes to see nor tongue to speak in this place but as the house is pleased to direct me whose servant i am and i humbly ask pardon
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8649.mp3	who were appointed for that purpose or perhaps actuated by their own terrors ran from gate to gate crying out that the cavaliers were coming to burn the city and that the king himself was at their head
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8650.mp3	next morning charles sent to the mayor and ordered him to call a common council immediately about ten o'clock he himself attended only by three or four lords went to guildhall
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8651.mp3	he told the common council that he was sorry to hear of the apprehensions entertained of him that he was come to them without any guard in order to show how much he relied on their affections
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8652.mp3	and that he had accused certain men of high treason against whom he would proceed in a legal way and therefore presumed that they would not meet with protection in the city after many other gracious expressions
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8653.mp3	he heard the cry privilege of parliament privilege of parliament resounding from all quarters
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8654.mp3	an oval face broad above and narrow below golden hair fair skin white delicate and well formed hands with slender tapering fingers these were considered as marking the type of beauty and of high family descent
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8655.mp3	they were the marks of aristocracy to these natural advantages the people added by the usual artificial means among the higher classes the finger nails were kept carefully cut and rounded
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8656.mp3	it was considered shameful for a man of position to have rough unkempt nails crimson coloured finger nails were greatly admired
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8657.mp3	i sleep no more and i shall not crimson my nails no joy shall ever again come upon my mind
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8658.mp3	ladies often dyed the eyebrows black with the juice of some sort of berry
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8659.mp3	that the irish missionary monks sometimes painted or dyed their eyelids black an entry in cormac's glossary plainly indicates that the blush of the cheeks was sometimes heightened by a colouring matter obtained from the alder tree
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8660.mp3	and the sprigs and berries of the elder were applied to the same purpose among greek and roman ladies the practice was very general of painting the cheeks eyebrows and other parts of the face both men and women wore the hair long
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8661.mp3	the hair was combed daily after a bath the heroes of the fena of erin before sitting down to their dinner after a hard day's hunting always took a bath and carefully combed their long hair among the higher classes in very early times
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8662.mp3	great care was bestowed on the hair its regulation constituted quite an art and it was dressed up in several ways very often the long hair of men as well as of women was elaborately curled conall kernach's hair as described in the story of da derga
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8663.mp3	flowed down his back and was done up in
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8664.mp3	hooks and plaits and swordlets
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8665.mp3	the accuracy of this and other similar descriptions is fully borne out by the most unquestionable authority of all namely the figures in the early illuminated manuscripts and on the shrines and high crosses of later ages
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8666.mp3	in nearly all the figures of the book of kells for example seventh or eighth century the hair is combed and dressed with the utmost care so beautifully adjusted indeed that it could have been done only by skilled professional hairdressers
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8667.mp3	and must have occupied much time whether in case of men or women
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8668.mp3	and is commonly divided the whole way as well as all over the head into slender fillets or locks which sometimes hang down to the eyes in front i do not find mentioned anywhere that the irish dyed their hair as was the custom among the greeks and romans
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8669.mp3	the men were as particular about the beard as about the hair the fashion of wearing the beard varied
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8670.mp3	and gradually narrowed to two points below sometimes as shown in many ancient figures it falls down in a single mass while in a few it is cut straight across at bottom not unlike assyrian beards nearly all have a mustache
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8671.mp3	in most cases curled up and pointed at the ends as we often see now in many the beard is carefully divided into slender twisted fillets as described above for the hair kings and chiefs had barbers in their service to attend to all this
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8672.mp3	razors were used made of bronze as hard as steel as we know by finding them mentioned in irish documents as early as the eighth century and many old bronze razors are now preserved in museums
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8673.mp3	from what precedes it will be understood that combs were in general use with men as well as with women and many specimens of combs are now found in the remains of ancient dwellings bathing was very usual at least among the upper classes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8674.mp3	and baths and the use of baths are constantly mentioned in the old tales and other writings in every public hostel in every monastery and in every high class house there was a bath with its accompaniments soap was used both in bathing and washing
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8675.mp3	the modes of manufacturing them will be mentioned silk and satin which were of course imported were much worn among the higher classes the furs of animals such as seals otters badgers foxes et cetera were much used for capes and jackets
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8676.mp3	and for the edgings of various garments so that skins of all the various kinds were valuable they formed too an important item of everyday traffic and they were also exported the ancient irish loved bright colours
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8677.mp3	in this respect they resembled many other nations of antiquity as well indeed as of the present day and they illustrated ruskin's saying
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8678.mp3	whenever men are noble they love bright colour
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8679.mp3	in sky sea flowers
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8680.mp3	and we know that they well understood the art of dyeing the several articles of dress on one person were usually coloured differently even the single outer cloak was often striped spotted or chequered in various colours king domnall in the seventh century
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8681.mp3	on one occasion sent a many coloured tunic to his foster son prince congal like joseph's coat of many colours a very common article of dress was a large cloak generally without sleeves
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8682.mp3	varying in length but commonly covering the whole person from the shoulders down the people also wore a tight fitting coat with sleeves
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8683.mp3	but it was much shorter and without a collar
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8684.mp3	a short cape was often worn on the shoulders sometimes carrying a hood to cover the head the outer covering of the general run of the peasantry was just one loose sleeved coat or mantle
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8685.mp3	which covered them down to the ankles and which they wore winter and summer women commonly wore a long loose cloak with a hood a fashion which is common at the present day the over garments were fastened by brooches pins buttons
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8686.mp3	girdles strings and loops many of them beautifully made and ornamented the ancient irish wore a trousers which was so tight fitting as to show perfectly the shape of the limbs when terminating below the ankles it was held down by a slender strap passing under the foot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8687.mp3	like other irish garments it was generally striped or speckled in various colours leggings of cloth or of thin soft leather were used and were laced on by strings tipped with white bronze
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8688.mp3	a kilt was often worn in which case the legs were left bare at the knees with leggings below for the kilt is of irish origin and was brought like many other fashions by the early colonists to scotland
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8689.mp3	and when not actually worn was usually carried among other small articles in a lady's ornamental hand bag shoes were often made of untanned hide stitched with thongs with several layers for a sole but there was a more shapely shoe made of fully tanned leather
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8690.mp3	having serviceable sole and heel and often ornamented with patterns stamped in the irish were excessively fond of personal ornaments which among the higher classes were made of expensive materials such as gold silver gems white bronze et cetera
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8691.mp3	they wore rings and bracelets of various shapes on the fingers including the thumb round the wrist and forearm and even round the leg above the ankle
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8692.mp3	all of which materials were found native they had torques for the neck made of twisted gold bars and the elaborate and immensely expensive crescents or gorgets
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8693.mp3	there was a gold ornament a kind of open ring with bosses or buttons on the ends
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8694.mp3	worn on the breast suspended from an ornamented button thin circular gold plates were also worn fastened on the breast and as for brooches they were of all shapes and sizes some plain simple and cheap
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8695.mp3	some of gold or other expensive material of elaborate workmanship
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8696.mp3	one of the commissioners for the publication of the ancient laws of ireland president of the royal society of antiquaries ireland london longmans green and co dublin m h gill and son
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8697.mp3	nineteen o seven printed by ponsonby and gibbs university press dublin preface
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8698.mp3	this little book has been written and published with the main object of spreading as widely as possible among our people young and old a knowledge of the civilisation and general social condition of ireland from the fifth or sixth
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8699.mp3	when it was wholly governed by native rulers the publication comes at an appropriate time when there is an awakening of interest in the irish language and in irish lore of every kind unparalleled in our history but the book has a further mission
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8700.mp3	there are many english and many anglo irish people who think merely from ignorance that ireland was a barbarous and half savage country before the english came among the people and civilised them this book so far as it finds its way among the two classes above mentioned will
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8701.mp3	i fancy open their eyes they will learn from it that the old irish so far from being barbarous were a bright intellectual and cultured people that they had professions trades and industries pervading the whole population
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8702.mp3	with clearly defined ranks and grades of society all working under an elaborate system of native laws and that in the steadying and civilising arts and pursuits of everyday life they were as well advanced as orderly
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8703.mp3	and as regular as any other european people of the same period they will find too that as regards education scholarship and general mental culture the irish of those early ages were in advance of all other countries of europe
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8704.mp3	that they helped most materially to spread christianity and to revive learning all over the continent and that to irish missionaries and scholars the anglo saxons of the heptarchy were indebted for the greater part of their christianity
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8705.mp3	and for the preservation and restoration of learning when it was threatened with extinction all over england by the ravages of the danes but there were and are englishmen better informed about our country
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8706.mp3	more than three hundred years ago the great english poet edmund spenser lived for some time in ireland and made himself well acquainted with its history he knew what it was in past ages
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8707.mp3	of wealth and goodnesse far above the rest
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8708.mp3	but it is better not to pursue these observations farther here as it would be only anticipating what will be found in the body of the book this book is the last of a series of three of which the second is abridged from the first and the third from both
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8709.mp3	the first a social history of ancient ireland
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8710.mp3	contains a complete survey of the social life and institutions of ancient ireland all the important statements in it are proved home by references to authorities
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8711.mp3	the second a smaller social history of ancient ireland
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8712.mp3	five hundred ninety eight pages in twenty seven chapters with two hundred thirteen illustrations traverses the same ground as the larger work but besides condensation most of the illustrative quotations and nearly all the references to authorities are omitted
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8713.mp3	this third book the story of ancient irish civilisation gives in simple plain language an account of the condition of the country in the olden time but as it is here to speak for itself i need not describe it further
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8714.mp3	for all the statements it contains full and satisfactory authorities will be found in the two larger works i have done my best to make all three readable and interesting as well as instructive
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8715.mp3	the ordinary history of our country has been written by many and the reader has a wide choice but in the matter of our social history he has no choice at all for these three books of mine have for the first and only time
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8716.mp3	brought within the reach of the general public a knowledge of the whole social life of ancient ireland p w j lyre na grena february

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8719.mp3	that in freedom which men greatly desire and if they that be kings defend not their dignity as stoutly as others seek to overthrow it then shall the highest be made even as the lowest and there shall be an end of kingship than which there is nothing more honorable under heaven
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8720.mp3	with these words they persuaded king porsenna who judging it well for the etrurians that there should be a king at rome and that king an etrurian by birth gathered together a great army and came up against rome

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8723.mp3	lartius and herminius by name men of noble birth both of them and of great renown in arms so these three for a while stayed the first onset of the enemy and the men of rome meanwhile brake down the bridge and when there was but a small part remaining
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8724.mp3	and they that brake it down called to the three that they should come back horatius bade lartius and herminius return but he himself remained on the farther side turning his eyes full of wrath in threatening fashion on the princes of the etrurians and crying

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8727.mp3	for the bridge was now altogether broken down

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8729.mp3	and swam across to his own people and though many javelins of the enemy fell about him he was not one whit hurt nor did such valor fail to receive due honor from the city

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8734.mp3	and was associated with so many strange and high hopes and some dark blending of doubt and apprehension and discordant thoughts hatton in his appearance realised little of the fancies

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8738.mp3	is yours that life of uncomplaining toil wherein there is so much of beauty and of goodness that by the fine maxim of our church it is held to include the force and efficacy of prayer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8739.mp3	then hesitating while a soft expression came over her countenance she held forth her hand which he retained for a moment and withdrew i was with him more than an hour continued morley at first he recollected nothing
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8740.mp3	he doubtless had them now as he never destroyed papers would order a search to be made for them and so on i was about to withdraw when he asked me carelessly a question about your father what he was doing and whether he were married and had children
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8741.mp3	this led to a very long conversation in which he suddenly seemed to take great interest at first he talked of writing to see your father and i offered that gerard should call upon him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8742.mp3	he took down your direction in order that he might write to your father and give him an appointment when observing that it was westminster he said that his carriage was ordered to go to the house of lords in a quarter of an hour and that if not inconvenient to me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8743.mp3	he would propose that i should at once accompany him i thought whatever might be the result it must be a satisfaction to gerard at last to see this man of whom he has talked and thought so much and so we are here
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8744.mp3	you did well good stephen as you always do said sybil with a musing and abstracted air no one has so much forethought and so much energy as you he threw a glance at her and immediately withdrew it their eyes had met
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8745.mp3	hers were kind and calm and this egremont said morley rather hurriedly and abruptly and looking on the ground how came he here when we discovered him yesterday your father and myself agreed that we should not mention to you the
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8746.mp3	the mystification of which we had been dupes and you did wrong said sybil there is no wisdom like frankness had you told me he would not have been here today he met and addressed me and i only recognised an acquaintance
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8747.mp3	had he not accompanied me to this door and met my father which precipitated an explanation on his part which he found had not been given by others i might have remained in an ignorance which hereafter might have produced inconvenience
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8748.mp3	you are right said morley looking at her rather keenly we have all of us opened ourselves too unreservedly before this aristocrat i should hope that none of us have said to him a word that we wish to be forgotten said sybil

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8848.mp3	and started home again now the queen thought to herself that the king could not mean to send her away for good and that as soon as he had got over his fit of temper he would summon her back so she stayed quite still for a long time listening with all her ears for approaching footsteps
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8849.mp3	but heard none after a while she grew nervous for she was all alone and put her head out of the palanquin and looked about her day was just breaking and birds and insects were beginning to stir
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8850.mp3	but although the queen's eyes wandered in all directions there was no sign of any human being then her spirit gave way and she began to cry it so happened that close to the spot where the queen's palanquin had been set down there dwelt a man who had a tiny farm in the midst of the forest
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8851.mp3	where he and his wife lived alone far from any neighbours as it was hot weather the farmer had been sleeping on the flat roof of his house but was awakened by the sound of weeping he jumped up and ran downstairs as fast as he could and into the forest towards the place the sound came from
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8852.mp3	and when she had told her story the farmer called his wife who led her to their house and gave her food to eat and a bed to lie on and in the farm a few days later a little prince was born and by his mother's wish named ameer ali
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8853.mp3	years passed without a sign from the king his wife might have been dead for all he seemed to care though the queen still lived with the farmer and the little prince had by this time grown up into a strong handsome and healthy youth out in the forest they seemed far from the world
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8854.mp3	very few ever came near them and the prince was continually begging his mother and the farmer to be allowed to go away and seek adventures and to make his own living but she and the wise farmer always counselled him to wait until
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8855.mp3	at last when he was eighteen years of age they had not the heart to forbid him any longer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8856.mp3	a big brass pot to hold water a few pieces of silver
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8857.mp3	many a weary mile he tramped day after day until one morning he saw before him just such a forest as that in which he had been born and bred and he stepped joyfully into it like one who goes to meet an old friend
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8858.mp3	presently as he made his way through a thicket he saw a pigeon which he thought would make a good dinner so he fired a pellet at it from his galail but missed the pigeon which fluttered away with a startled clatter at the same instant he heard a great clamour from beyond the thicket
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8859.mp3	and on reaching the spot he found an ugly old woman streaming wet and crying loudly as she lifted from her head
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8860.mp3	the old woman's face brightened she showed him where to seek the water and when he returned a few minutes later with his pot filled to the brim she led the way without a word and he followed in a short while they came to a hut in the forest
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8861.mp3	and as they drew near it ameer ali beheld in the doorway the loveliest damsel his eyes had ever looked on at the sight of a stranger she drew her veil about her and stepped into the hut and much as he wished to see her again
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8862.mp3	ameer ali could think of no excuse by which to bring her back and so with a heavy heart he made his salutation and bade the old woman farewell but when he had gone a little way she called after him if ever you are in trouble or danger
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8863.mp3	come to where you now stand and cry fairy of the forest fairy of the forest help me now and i will listen to you the prince thanked her and continued his journey but he thought little of the old woman's saying and much of the lovely damsel
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8864.mp3	shortly afterwards he arrived at a city and as he was now in great straits
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8865.mp3	the king said he had plenty of servants and wanted no more
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8866.mp3	and promised that he should enter his bodyguard on the condition that he would undertake any service which was especially difficult or dangerous this was just what ameer ali wanted and he agreed to do whatever the king might wish
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8867.mp3	soon after this on a dark and stormy night when the river roared beneath the palace walls the sound of a woman weeping and wailing was heard above the storm the king ordered a servant to go and see what was the matter but the servant falling on his knees in terror
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8868.mp3	begged that he might not be sent on such an errand particularly on a night so wild when evil spirits and witches were sure to be abroad indeed so frightened was he that the king who was very kind hearted bade another to go in his stead
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8869.mp3	but each one showed the same strange fear then ameer ali stepped forward this is my duty your majesty he said i will go the king nodded and off he went the night was as dark as pitch
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8870.mp3	but he made his way down to the ford under the palace walls and stepped into the flooded water inch by inch and foot by foot he fought his way across now nearly swept off his feet by some sudden swirl or eddy now narrowly escaping
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8871.mp3	being caught in the branches of some floating tree that came tossing and swinging down the stream at length he emerged panting and dripping wet on the other side close by the bank stood a gallows and on the gallows hung the body of some evildoer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8872.mp3	whilst from the foot of it came the sound of sobbing that the king had heard
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8873.mp3	or of the roaring river as for ghosts and witches they had never troubled him so he walked up towards the gallows where crouched the figure of the woman what ails you he said now the woman was not really a woman at all
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8874.mp3	but a horrid kind of witch who really lived in witchland and had no business on earth if ever a man strayed into witchland the ogresses used to eat him up and this old witch thought she would like to catch a man for supper
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8875.mp3	in hopes that someone out of pity might come to her rescue so when ameer ali questioned her she replied ah kind sir it is my poor son who hangs upon that gallows help me to get him down and i will bless you for ever
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8876.mp3	ameer ali thought that her voice sounded rather eager
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8877.mp3	and bent so that the old woman could clamber on to his back which she did very nimbly then suddenly he felt a noose slipped over his neck
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8878.mp3	but ameer ali gave a sweep upwards with his sharp sword to cut the rope that she had slipped round his neck
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8879.mp3	and with a yell of pain and anger she vanished into the darkness ameer ali then sat down to collect himself a little and felt upon the ground by his side an anklet that had evidently fallen off the old witch's foot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8880.mp3	and as the storm had by this time passed over he made his way back to the palace when he had finished his story he took the anklet out of his pocket and handed it to the king who like everyone else was amazed at the glory of the jewels which composed it indeed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8881.mp3	ameer ali himself was astonished for he had slipped the anklet into his pocket in the dark and had not looked at it since the king was delighted at its beauty and having praised and rewarded ameer ali he gave the anklet to his daughter a proud and spoiled princess
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8882.mp3	now in the women's apartments in the palace there hung two cages in one of which was a parrot and in the other a starling and these two birds could talk as well as human beings they were both pets of the princess who always fed them herself and the next day as she was
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8883.mp3	walking grandly about with her treasure tied round her ankle she heard the starling say to the parrot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8884.mp3	that was the parrot's name how do you think the princess looks in her new jewel think snapped the parrot who was cross because they hadn't given him his bath that morning i think she looks like a washerwoman's daughter with one shoe on and the other off
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8885.mp3	why doesn't she wear two of them instead of going about with one leg adorned and the other empty when the princess heard this she burst into tears and sending for her father
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8886.mp3	or she would die of shame so the king sent for ameer ali
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8887.mp3	or he should be hanged for the princess would certainly die of disappointment poor ameer ali was greatly troubled at the king's command but he thought to himself that he had at any rate a month in which to lay his plans he left the palace at once
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8888.mp3	and inquired of everyone where the finest jewels were to be got but though he sought night and day he never found one to compare with the anklet at last only a week remained and he was in sore difficulty when he remembered the fairy of the forest
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8889.mp3	therefore away he went and after a day's travelling he reached the cottage in the forest and standing where he had stood when the old woman called to him he cried fairy of the forest fairy of the forest help me help me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8890.mp3	then there appeared in the doorway the beautiful girl he had seen before whom in all his wanderings he had never forgotten what is the matter she asked in a voice so soft that he listened like one struck dumb
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8891.mp3	then he told her his story and she went within the cottage and came back with two wands and a pot of boiling water the two wands she planted in the ground about six feet apart and then turning to him she said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8892.mp3	and hold it over the cauldron and every drop of blood that falls from it into the water will become a jewel next you must change the wands so that the one that stood at my head is at my feet and the one at my feet stands at my head and place the severed foot against the wound and it will heal
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8893.mp3	and i shall become quite well again as before at first
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8894.mp3	at length she persuaded him to do her bidding he nearly fainted himself with horror when he found that after the cruel blow which lopped her foot off she lay as one lifeless but he held the severed foot over the cauldron and as drops of blood fell from it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8895.mp3	and he saw each turn in the water into shining gems his heart took courage very soon there were plenty of jewels in the cauldron and he quickly changed the wands placed the severed foot against the wound and immediately the two parts became one as before
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8896.mp3	then the maiden opened her eyes sprang to her feet and drawing her veil about her ran into the hut and would not come out or speak to him any more
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8897.mp3	but three rare and beautiful anklets and these he duly presented to the king on the very day that his month of grace was over the king embraced him warmly and made him rich gifts and the next day the vain princess put two anklets on each foot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8898.mp3	and strutted up and down in them admiring herself in the mirrors that lined her room
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8899.mp3	and never recovered his temper until after lunch she's got all her beauty at one end of her now if she had a few of those fine gew gaws round her neck and wrists she would look better but now to my mind
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8900.mp3	she looks more than ever like the washerwoman's daughter dressed up poor princess she wept and stormed and raved until she made herself quite ill
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8901.mp3	and then she declared to her father that unless she had bracelets and necklace to match the anklets she would die again the king sent for ameer ali and ordered him to get a necklace and bracelets to match those anklets within a month or be put to a cruel death
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8902.mp3	and again ameer ali spent nearly the whole month searching for the jewels but all in vain at length he made his way to the hut in the forest and stood and cried fairy of the forest fairy of the forest help me
