https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8907.mp3	when on the day appointed ameer ali produced a necklace and bracelets each more beautiful and priceless than the last the king's astonishment knew no bounds and as for his daughter she was nearly mad with joy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8908.mp3	the very next morning she put on all her finery and thought that now at least that disagreeable parrot could find no fault with her appearance and she listened eagerly when she heard the starling say

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8913.mp3	ameer ali was instantly thrown into the most dismal prison that they could find and ordered to be kept there until the king had time to think in what way he should be put to death meanwhile the king determined that the princess ought in any case to be married without delay
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8914.mp3	so he sent forth heralds throughout the neighbouring countries proclaiming that on a certain day any person fitted for a bridegroom and heir to the throne should present himself at the palace when the day came all the court were gathered together and a great crowd assembled of men young and old
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8915.mp3	who thought that they had as good a chance as anyone else to gain both the throne and the princess as soon as the king was seated he called upon an usher to summon the first claimant but just then a farmer who stood in front of the crowd cried out that he had a petition to offer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8916.mp3	well hasten then said the king i have no time to waste your majesty said the farmer has now lived and administered justice long in this city

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8918.mp3	no your majesty answered the farmer i would only remind your majesty that there are plenty of jackals gathered to day to try and claim your daughter and kingdom every city has sent them and they wait hungry and eager but do not o king mistake or pretend again
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8919.mp3	to mistake the howl of a jackal for the hunting cry of a tiger the king turned first red and then pale there is continued the farmer a royal tiger bred in the forest who has the first and only true claim to your throne where
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8920.mp3	growing pale as he listened in prison replied the farmer if your majesty will clear this court of the jackals i will explain clear the court commanded the king and very unwillingly the visitors left the palace now
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8921.mp3	then the farmer told the king and his ministers how he had rescued the queen and brought up ameer ali and he fetched the old queen herself whom he had left outside at the sight of her the king was filled with shame and self reproach and wished he could have lived his life over again
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8922.mp3	and not have married the mother of the proud princess who caused him endless trouble until her death my day is past said he and he gave up his crown to his son ameer ali who went once more and called to the forest fairy to provide him with a queen to share his throne

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8924.mp3	she was the forest maiden's fairy godmother and when she was no longer needed to look after the girl she gladly returned to fairyland the old king has never been heard to contradict his wife any more if he even looks as if he does not agree with her

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8926.mp3	after a long and tedious discourse of these six non natural things and their several rectifications
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8927.mp3	or that kind of physic which cureth by medicines which apothecaries most part make mingle or sell in their shops many cavil at this kind of physic and hold it unnecessary unprofitable to this or any other disease
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8928.mp3	because those countries which use it least live longest

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8931.mp3	and very long lived in which places there is no use at all of physic the name of it is not once heard dithmarus bleskenius in his accurate description of iceland sixteen o seven

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8934.mp3	and but little at this day except it be for a few nice idle citizens surfeiting courtiers and stall fed gentlemen lubbers the country people use kitchen physic

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8938.mp3	the devil himself was the first inventor of it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8939.mp3	and what was apollo but the devil the greeks first made an art of it and they were all deluded by apollo's sons priests oracles if we may believe varro pliny columella most of their best medicines were derived from his oracles
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8940.mp3	aesculapius his son had his temples erected to his deity and did many famous cures but as lactantius holds he was a magician a mere impostor
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8941.mp3	performed most of their cures the first that ever wrote in physic to any purpose was hippocrates and his disciple and commentator galen whom scaliger calls fimbriam hippocratis
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8942.mp3	their precepts confused their medicines obsolete and now most part rejected those cures which they did paracelsus holds
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8943.mp3	they themselves idiots and infants as are all their academical followers the arabians received it from the greeks and so the latins adding new precepts and medicines of their own but so imperfect still that through ignorance of professors impostors mountebanks empirics
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8944.mp3	disagreeing of sectaries which are as many almost as there be diseases envy covetousness and the like they do much harm amongst us
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8945.mp3	as he said of adrian multitudo medicorum principem interfecit a multitude of physicians hath killed the emperor plus a medico quam a morbo periculi more danger there is from the physician than from the disease
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8946.mp3	doth appropriate it to herself and tells a story of one curtius a physician in venice because he was a stranger and practised amongst them the rest of the physicians did still cross him in all his precepts if he prescribed hot medicines they would prescribe cold
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8947.mp3	miscentes pro calidis frigida pro frigidis humida pro purgantibus astringentia binders for purgatives omnia perturbabant if the party miscarried curtium damnabant curtius killed him that disagreed from them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8948.mp3	sometimes stumbles them all they cannot so much as ease they know not how to judge of it if by pulses that doctrine some hold is wholly superstitious
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8949.mp3	is neither observed nor understood of any and for urine that is meretrix medicorum the most deceitful thing of all as forestus and some other physicians have proved at large
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8950.mp3	i had rather believe and commit myself to a mere empiric than to a mere doctor and i cannot sufficiently commend that custom of the babylonians that have no professed physicians but bring all their patients to the market to be cured
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8951.mp3	which herodotus relates of the egyptians strabo sardus and aubanus bohemus of many other nations and those that prescribed physic
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8952.mp3	a second the teeth a third the head
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8953.mp3	i acknowledge it a most noble and divine science
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8954.mp3	and those other gods were confined and adored alone in some peculiar places aesculapius and his temple and altars everywhere
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8955.mp3	with all virtuous and wise men therefore i honour the name and calling as i am enjoined to honour the physician for necessity's sake the knowledge of the physician lifteth up his head and in the sight of great men he shall be admired
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8956.mp3	but of this noble subject how many panegyrics are worthily written
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8957.mp3	i have said yet one thing i will add that this kind of physic is very moderately and advisedly to be used
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8958.mp3	is to be understood of such purges as are unseasonably or immoderately taken they have their excellent use in this as well as most other infirmities of alteratives and cordials no man doubts be they simples or compounds
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8959.mp3	the contrary is true what we need is not less education but more more trained leaders to uphold the standards of civilization before both races among indian college and university graduates a failure is very rare
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8960.mp3	i am sure i have not met one and really do not know of one the press is responsible for many popular errors whenever an indian indulges in any notorious misbehavior he is widely heralded as a carlisle graduate
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8961.mp3	although because of the wonderful athletic prowess of its students they have met and defeated the athletes of many a white university on the football field
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8962.mp3	giving a fair knowledge of some trade together with the essentials of an english education but no latin or other foreign language consequently its graduates must attend a higher preparatory school for several years before they can enter college
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8963.mp3	it will be seen then that the college educated men and women of my race have accomplished quite a feat considering their antecedents and wholly foreign point of view they have had to adjust themselves to a new way of thinking
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8964.mp3	furthermore they are almost always hampered by lack of means nevertheless an increasing number have succeeded in the undertaking trials of the educated indian
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8965.mp3	i wish to contradict the popular misconception that an educated indian will necessarily meet with strong prejudice among his own people or will be educated out of sympathy with them from their point of view
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8966.mp3	a particularly able or well equipped man of their race is a public blessing and all but public property that was the old rule among us up to a very recent period an educated indian could not succeed materially
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8967.mp3	he could not better himself because the people required him to give unlimited free service according to the old regime i have even known one to be killed by the continual demands upon him there was a time not so long ago either
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8968.mp3	when the educated indian stood in a very uncomfortable position between his people and the government officials and shady politicians every complaint was brought to him as a matter of course and he was expected to expose and redress every wrong
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8969.mp3	as i have said elsewhere such efforts are generally useless and resulted only in damage to his financial position and his reputation no doubt he often invited attacks upon himself by a rashness born of his ardent sympathy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8970.mp3	for his fellow tribesmen in this matter i speak from personal experience as well as long observation even in the old wild days an education was appreciated by the indians
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8971.mp3	but it was a hard life for the educated man they made him carry too heavy a burden without much recompense save honor and respect but we have pretty well passed through that period and the native graduates of our higher institutions
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8972.mp3	have begun to show their strength and enlarge their views they have not only done well for themselves and their race but they stand before the world as living illustrations of its capacity disproving many theories concerning untutored races
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8973.mp3	no inferior race it was declared without qualification by the universal races congress at london in nineteen eleven that there is no inherently superior race
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8974.mp3	therefore no inferior race from every race some individuals have mastered the same curriculum and passed the same tests and in some instances members of so called uncivilized races
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8975.mp3	because of the racial environment change the environment and the race is transformed certainly the american indian has clearly demonstrated the truth of this assertion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8976.mp3	the very mention of the name indian in earlier days would make the average white man's blood creep with thoughts of the war whoop and the scalping knife
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8977.mp3	a little later it suggested chiefly feathers and paint and buffalo bill's wild west to day the association is rather with the carlisle school and its famous athletes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8978.mp3	it is a fact that the intelligent and educated indian has no social prejudice to contend with his color is not counted against him he is received cordially and upon equal terms in school college and society
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8979.mp3	doctor booker washington is in the habit of saying jocosely that the negro blood is the strongest in the world for one drop of it makes a nigger of a white man i would argue that the indian blood is even stronger
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8980.mp3	for a half blood negro and indian may pass for an indian and so be admitted to first class hotels and even to high society
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8981.mp3	is to get an education and hold up his head as a member of the oldest american aristocracy many of our leading men have married into excellent families and are prominent in cultivated white communities
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8982.mp3	we want the best in two races and civilizations in exchange for what we have lost some of us have entered upon every known professional career such as medicine law the ministry education and the sciences
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8983.mp3	politics and higher business management art and literature it may be well to mention some of our best known professional men and women
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8984.mp3	at first to be sure as indian herb doctors or quacks of one sort or another but later as competent graduated physicians the government has utilized several in the indian service and others have established themselves in private practice
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8985.mp3	some noted indians of to day perhaps the foremost of these is doctor carlos montezuma of chicago a full blooded apache
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8986.mp3	who were enemies of his people he was brought to chicago by the man who ransomed him a reporter and photographer and when his benefactor died the boy became the protege of the chicago press club
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8987.mp3	and from there to the northwestern university where he was graduated from the medical department all this time although receiving some aid from various sources he largely supported himself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8988.mp3	after graduation doctor montezuma was sent by the government as physician to an indian agency in montana and later transferred to the carlisle school in a few years he returned to chicago and opened an office
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8989.mp3	he has been a prominent physician there for a number of years and was recently married to a lady of german descent he stands uncompromisingly for the total abolition of the reservation system and of the indian bureau
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8990.mp3	holding that the red man must be allowed to work out his own salvation one of the earliest practitioners of our race was doctor susan la flesche picotte of the omaha tribe
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8991.mp3	she has since taken up private practice and also had charge of a mission hospital doctor picotte is a sister of bright eyes susette la flesche and also of francis la flesche of washington d c
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8992.mp3	there is another indian doctor not of full blood who is president of the city club of chicago and active in civic reform in several middle western cities there are successful doctors and dentists of my race
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8993.mp3	was a successful lawyer in topeka when he was elected to the house of representatives and later to the united states senate his mother is a kaw indian mister curtis was and is a leader of the republican party in his state
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8994.mp3	senator owen of oklahoma is part cherokee the whole country has come to realize his ability and influence representative carter of oklahoma is also an indian
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8995.mp3	during my student days in new hampshire i was often told that daniel webster was part indian on his mother's side certainly his physiognomy as well as his unequalled logic corroborated the story
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8996.mp3	we all know that governors and other men of mark have proclaimed themselves descendants of pocahontas i have met several in the west and south
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8997.mp3	but have never verified it their wonderful aggressiveness and dauntless public service in my mind point to native descent and if they can truthfully claim it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8998.mp3	as late as eighteen seventy six doctor washington mathews a surgeon in the united states army
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/8999.mp3	and left him with the missionary teacher doctor alfred l riggs to rear and educate this military surgeon and scientist not only attained the rank of major general but he became one of our foremost archaeologists
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9000.mp3	i will not pretend to claim for the indian all the credit of their talents and energy in the ministry we have many able and devoted men more than in any other profession
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9001.mp3	is well known as an evangelistic preacher and singer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9002.mp3	a full blood arapahoe he has had an unusual career having been taken prisoner as a boy by an officer of the army he was sent to school and eventually graduated from bishop whipple's seabury divinity school at faribault minnesota
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9003.mp3	since that time doctor coolidge has devoted himself to the christianization of his race
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9004.mp3	he had unusual eloquence and personal charm and became at once one of bishop hare's ablest helpers in his great work among the sioux stationed at pine ridge at the time of the wounded knee massacre
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9005.mp3	he opened his church to the wounded indian prisoners as an emergency hospital his much regretted death occurred a few months later he was a tireless worker and much loved by his people

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9007.mp3	has done good work as field secretary among the indians for a number of years i should add that there are many ministers of my race who have no college degree nor much education in the english language yet who are among our most able and influential leaders
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9008.mp3	who passed but a short time in school has not only been a successful preacher among the sioux but for many years their trusted adviser and representative to look after their interests at the national capital
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9009.mp3	most of them in the united states indian service it is the express policy of the government to use the educated indians whenever possible in promoting the advancement of their race indeed some of the treaties include this stipulation
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9010.mp3	and although they must pass a civil service examination to prove their fitness such examination in their case is non competitive they have been prepared in the larger government schools in many instances with the addition of normal and college courses
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9011.mp3	at least two are superintendents of schools a number of young women carlisle graduates have taken up trained nursing as a profession and are practising successfully both among whites and indians

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9013.mp3	doctor putnam and doctor boas the latter has called him one of our ablest archaeologists doctor jones travelled among the various tribes even to the coast of labrador and labored assiduously in the cause of science for harvard
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9014.mp3	and the marshall field museum of chicago as well as other institutions it was the chicago museum which sent him to the philippine islands where he was murdered by the natives a few years ago
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9015.mp3	in literature several writers of indian blood have appeared during the past few years and have won a measure of recognition francis la flesche an omaha has collaborated with miss alice c fetcher
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9016.mp3	in ethnological work and is also the author of a pleasing story of life in an indian school called the middle five zitkalasa a sioux now missus bonney
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9017.mp3	attended a western college where she distinguished herself in an intercollegiate oratorical contest soon afterward she appeared in the atlantic monthly as the writer of several papers of an autobiographical nature
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9018.mp3	which attracted favorable attention and were followed by a little volume of indian legends and several short stories missus bonney has more recently written the book of an indian opera called the sun dance which has been produced in salt lake city
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9019.mp3	by university students john oskinson a cherokee was first heard of as the winner in an intercollegiate literary contest and he is now on the staff of collier's weekly the five civilized nations of oklahoma
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9020.mp3	can show many other writers and journalists in higher business lines a number have shown special ability general pleasant porter who died recently was president of a short railroad line in oklahoma
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9021.mp3	mister hill of texas is reputed to be a millionaire howard gansworth a graduate of carlisle and princeton
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9022.mp3	in the athletic world this little race has no peer as is sufficiently proven by their remarkable record in football baseball and track athletics
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9023.mp3	why he did not introduce football in his school why said he if i did that half the press of the country would attack me for developing the original war instincts and savagery of the indian the public would be afraid to come to our games
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9024.mp3	at least not in public not long afterward the game was introduced at carlisle and i was asked by the general to visit montana and the dakotas to secure pupils for the school and incidentally recruits for his football warriors
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9025.mp3	the indians victory was complete these boys always fight the battle on its own merits they play a clean game and lose very few games during the season although they meet all our leading universities each on its own home grounds
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9026.mp3	from the fleet deerfoot to this day we boast the noted names of longboat sockalexis bemus pierce frank hudson tewanima metoxen myers bender and jim thorpe
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9027.mp3	thorpe is a graduate of the carlisle school and at the olympic games in sweden in nineteen twelve he won the title of the greatest all round athlete in the world problems of race leadership
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9028.mp3	and with old tribal jealousies and antagonisms yet to be overcome another and a more serious obstacle is the dependent position of the indian and the almost arbitrary power in the hands of the indian bureau
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9029.mp3	about fifteen years ago the idea of a national organization of progressive indians was discussed at some length
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9030.mp3	my brother john eastman and myself at that time we concluded that the movement would not be understood either by our own race or the american people in general and that there was grave danger of arousing the antagonism of the bureau
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9031.mp3	if such a society were formed it would necessarily take many problems of the race under consideration and the officials at washington and in the field are sensitive to criticism
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9032.mp3	nor are they accustomed to allowing the indian a voice in his own affairs furthermore many of the most progressive red men are enlisted in the government service which would make their position a very difficult one in case of any friction with the authorities
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9033.mp3	very few indians are sufficiently independent of the bureau to speak and act with absolute freedom some ten years later i was called to columbus ohio to lecture for the ohio state university
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9034.mp3	on the same course with doctor coolidge and doctor montezuma professor f a mc kenzie of the university arranged the course and soon afterward he wrote me that he believed the time was now ripe to organize our society
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9035.mp3	we corresponded with leading indians and arranged a meeting at columbus for the following april at this meeting five were present besides myself doctor montezuma thomas sloan charles e dagenett henry standingbear
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9036.mp3	and miss laura cornelius we organized as a committee and issued a general call for a conference in october at the university upon the cordial invitation of doctor mc kenzie and president thompson
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9037.mp3	four annual conferences have now been held and the fifth is announced for next october at oklahoma city the society has five hundred active and about the same number of associate members
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9038.mp3	the latter are white friends of the race who are in sympathy with our objects
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9039.mp3	and arthur c parker is secretary and treasurer the society of american indians issues a quarterly journal devoted to the proceedings of the conferences and the interests of the indian race
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9040.mp3	and there are others as well our people have not been trained to work together harmoniously it is a serious question what principles we should stand for and what line of work we ought to undertake
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9041.mp3	should we devote ourselves largely to exposing the numerous frauds committed upon indians or should we keep clear of these matters avoid discussion of official methods and action
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9042.mp3	and simply aim at arousing racial pride and ambition along new lines holding up a modern ideal for the support and encouragement of our youth should we petition congress and in general continue along the lines of the older indian associations
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9043.mp3	or should we rather do intensive work among our people looking especially toward their moral and social welfare i stand for the latter plan others think differently and as a matter of fact a washington office has been opened
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9044.mp3	objects of the society of american indians first to promote and cooperate with all efforts looking to the advancement of the indian in enlightenment which leave him free as a man
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9045.mp3	to develop according to the natural laws of social evolution second to provide through our open conferences the means for a free discussion on all subjects bearing on the welfare of the race third
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9046.mp3	to present in a just light the true history of the race to preserve its records and emulate its distinguishing virtues fourth to promote citizenship and to obtain the rights thereof fifth
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9047.mp3	seventh to direct its energies exclusively to general principles and universal interests and not allow itself to be used for any personal or private interest
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9048.mp3	the plenitude of the revolution he was incomplete however so far as the absolute can be so he had too much of saint just about him and not enough of anacharsis cloots
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9049.mp3	still his mind in the society of the friends of the a b c had ended by undergoing a certain polarization from combeferre's ideas for some time past he had been gradually emerging from the narrow form of dogma
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9050.mp3	and had allowed himself to incline to the broadening influence of progress and he had come to accept as a definitive and magnificent evolution
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9051.mp3	a sort of stifled fire darted from his eyes which were filled with an inward look all at once he threw back his head his blond locks fell back like those of an angel on the sombre quadriga made of stars
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9052.mp3	they were like the mane of a startled lion in the flaming of an halo
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9053.mp3	old men blessing children the past loving the present thinkers entirely at liberty believers on terms of full equality for religion heaven god the direct priest
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9054.mp3	human conscience become an altar no more hatreds the fraternity of the workshop and the school for sole penalty and recompense fame work for all right for all
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9055.mp3	peace over all no more bloodshed no more wars happy mothers to conquer matter is the first step to realize the ideal is the second reflect on what progress has already accomplished
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9056.mp3	and the talons of a tiger fearful beasts which were above man man nevertheless spread his snares consecrated by intelligence and finally conquered these monsters
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9057.mp3	on the day when this promethean task shall be accomplished and when man shall have definitely harnessed to his will the triple chimaera of antiquity the hydra the dragon and the griffin
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9058.mp3	courage and onward citizens whither are we going to science made government to the force of things become the sole public force
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9059.mp3	we are advancing to the unity of man no more fictions no more parasites the real governed by the true that is the goal civilization will hold its assizes at the summit of europe
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9060.mp3	europe will have her amphictyons the globe will have its amphictyons france bears this sublime future in her breast this is the gestation of the nineteenth century
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9061.mp3	i revere you yes you clearly behold the future yes you are right you had neither father nor mother
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9062.mp3	you adopted humanity for your mother and right for your father you are about to die that is to say to triumph here citizens whatever happens to day through our defeat as well as through our victory
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9063.mp3	where two or three of these sovereignties are combined the state begins but in that association there is no abdication each sovereignty concedes a certain quantity of itself for the purpose of forming the common right
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9064.mp3	this quantity is the same for all of us this identity of concession which each makes to all is called equality common right is nothing else than the protection of all beaming on the right of each
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9065.mp3	this protection of all over each is called fraternity the point of intersection of all these assembled sovereignties is called society this intersection being a junction this point is a knot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9066.mp3	hence what is called the social bond some say social contract which is the same thing the word contract

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9397.mp3	be it as it may said sir maleagans know you well madam i have loved you many a year and never till now could i get you to such advantage as i do now and therefore i will take you as i find you
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9398.mp3	then the ten knights of the round table drew their swords and the other party run at them with their spears
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9399.mp3	then they lashed together with swords till several were smitten to the earth so when the queen saw her knights thus dolefully oppressed and needs must be slain at the last then for pity and sorrow she cried sir maleagans
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9400.mp3	slay not my noble knights and i will go with you upon this covenant that
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9401.mp3	madame said maleagans for your sake they shall be led with you into my own castle if that ye will be ruled and ride with me then sir maleagans charged them all that none should depart from the queen
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9402.mp3	for he dreaded lest sir launcelot should have knowledge of what had been done then the queen privily called unto her a page of her chamber that was swiftly horsed to whom she said go thou when thou seest thy time
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9403.mp3	and bear this ring unto sir launcelot and pray him as he loveth me that he will see me and rescue me and spare not thy horse said the queen neither for water nor for land
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9404.mp3	and lightly he took his horse with the spurs and departed as fast as he might and when sir maleagans saw him so flee he understood that it was by the queen's commandment for to warn sir launcelot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9405.mp3	then they that were best horsed chased him and shot at him but the child went from them all then sir maleagans said to the queen madam ye are about to betray me but i shall arrange for sir launcelot that he shall not come lightly at you
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9406.mp3	then he rode with her and them all to his castle in all the haste that they might and by the way sir maleagans laid in ambush the best archers that he had to wait for sir launcelot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9407.mp3	and the child came to westminster and found sir launcelot and told his message and delivered him the queen's ring alas said sir launcelot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9408.mp3	unless i may rescue that noble lady then eagerly he asked his armor and put it on him and mounted his horse and rode as fast as he might
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9409.mp3	and men say he took the water at westminster bridge and made his horse swim over thames unto lambeth then within a while he came to a wood where was a narrow way and there the archers were laid in ambush
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9410.mp3	and they shot at him and smote his horse so that he fell then sir launcelot left his horse and went on foot but there lay so many ditches and hedges betwixt the archers and him that he might not meddle with them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9411.mp3	alas for shame said sir launcelot that ever one knight should betray another but it is an old saw a good man is never in danger but when he is in danger of a coward
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9412.mp3	then sir launcelot went awhile and he was exceedingly cumbered by his armor his shield and his spear and all that belonged to him then by chance there came by him a cart that came thither to fetch wood
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9413.mp3	carts were little used except for carrying offal and for conveying criminals to execution but sir launcelot took no thought of anything but the necessity of haste for the purpose of rescuing the queen so he demanded of the carter
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9414.mp3	that he should take him in and convey him as speedily as possible for a liberal reward the carter consented and sir launcelot placed himself in the cart and only lamented that with much jolting he made but little progress
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9415.mp3	he drew near to see who it might be then sir launcelot told him how the queen had been carried off and how in hastening to her rescue his horse had been disabled and he had been compelled to avail himself of the cart rather than give up his enterprise
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9416.mp3	then sir gawain said surely it is unworthy of a knight to travel in such sort but sir launcelot heeded him not at nightfall
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9417.mp3	but to admit his companion whom she supposed to be a criminal or at least a prisoner it pleased her not
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9418.mp3	at supper sir launcelot came near being consigned to the kitchen
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9419.mp3	neither would the damsels prepare a bed for him he seized the first he found unoccupied and was left undisturbed next morning he saw from the turrets of the castle a train accompanying a lady whom he imagined to be the queen
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9420.mp3	the lady of the castle supplied sir launcelot with a horse and they traversed the plain at full speed they learned from some travellers whom they met that there were two roads which led to the castle of sir maleagans here therefore the friends separated
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9421.mp3	sir launcelot found his way beset with obstacles which he encountered successfully but not without much loss of time as evening approached he was met by a young and sportive damsel who gayly proposed to him a supper
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9422.mp3	at her castle the knight who was hungry and weary accepted the offer though with no very good grace he followed the lady to her castle and ate voraciously of her supper but was quite impenetrable to all her amorous advances
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9423.mp3	suddenly the scene changed and he was assailed by six furious ruffians whom he dealt with so vigorously that most of them were speedily disabled when again there was a change and he found himself alone with his fair hostess
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9424.mp3	which she told him would by its changes of color disclose to him all enchantments and enable him to subdue them sir launcelot pursued his journey without being much incommoded except by the taunts of travellers
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9425.mp3	who all seemed to have learned by some means his disgraceful drive in the cart one more insolent than the rest had the audacity to interrupt him during dinner and even to risk a battle in support of his pleasantry launcelot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9426.mp3	after an easy victory only doomed him to be carted in his turn at night he was received at another castle with great apparent hospitality but found himself in the morning in a dungeon and loaded with chains
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9427.mp3	consulting his ring and finding that this was an enchantment he burst his chains seized his armor in spite of the visionary monsters who attempted to defend it broke open the gates of the tower and continued his journey
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9428.mp3	at length his progress was checked by a wide and rapid torrent which could only be passed on a narrow bridge on which a false step would prove his destruction launcelot leading his horse by the bridle and making him swim by his side
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9429.mp3	passed over the bridge and was attacked as soon as he reached the bank by a lion and a leopard both of which he slew and then exhausted and bleeding seated himself on the grass and endeavored to bind up his wounds
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9430.mp3	offered him his assistance and informed him that the queen was safe in his castle but could only be rescued by encountering maleagans launcelot demanded the battle for the next day and accordingly it took place at the foot of the tower
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9431.mp3	and under the eyes of the fair captive launcelot was enfeebled by his wounds and fought not with his usual spirit and the contest for a time was doubtful
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9432.mp3	ah launcelot my knight truly have i been told that thou art no longer worthy of me these words instantly revived the drooping knight he resumed at once his usual superiority and soon laid at his feet his haughty adversary
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9433.mp3	moved by the entreaties of brademagus ordered him to withhold the blow and he obeyed the castle and its prisoners were now at his disposal launcelot hastened to the apartment of the queen threw himself at her feet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9434.mp3	and was about to kiss her hand when she exclaimed ah launcelot why do i see thee again yet feel thee to be no longer worthy of me after having been disgracefully drawn about the country in a she had not time to finish the phrase
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9435.mp3	for her lover suddenly started from her and bitterly lamenting that he had incurred the displeasure of his sovereign lady rushed out of the castle threw his sword and his shield to the right and left ran furiously into the woods and disappeared
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9436.mp3	it seems that the story of the abominable cart which haunted launcelot at every step had reached the ears of sir kay who had told it to the queen as a proof that her knight must have been dishonored
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9437.mp3	three days elapsed during which launcelot wandered without knowing where he went till at last he began to reflect that his mistress had doubtless been deceived by misrepresentation
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9438.mp3	and that it was his duty to set her right he therefore returned compelled maleagans to release his prisoners
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9439.mp3	had the satisfaction of meeting him the next day
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9440.mp3	where he was brought up in total ignorance of arms and chivalry he was allowed no weapon
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9441.mp3	which was the only thing of all her lordes faire gere that his mother carried to the wood with her in the use of this he became so skilful that he could kill with it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9442.mp3	not only the animals of the chase for the table but even birds on the wing at length however perceval was roused to a desire of military renown by seeing in the forest five knights who were in complete armor
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9443.mp3	he said to his mother mother what are those yonder they are angels my son said she by my faith i will go and become an angel with them and perceval went to the road and met them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9444.mp3	tell me good lad said one of them sawest thou a knight pass this way either today or yesterday
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9445.mp3	such an one as i am said the knight if thou wilt tell me what i ask thee i will tell thee what thou askest me gladly will i do so said sir owain for that was the knight's name
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9446.mp3	and perceval in return gave him such information as he had then perceval returned to his mother and said to her mother those were not angels but honorable knights then his mother swooned away
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9447.mp3	and perceval went to the place where they kept the horses that carried firewood and provisions for the castle and he took a bony piebald horse which seemed to him the strongest of them and he pressed a pack into the form of a saddle
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9448.mp3	and with twisted twigs he imitated the trappings which he had seen upon the horses when he came again to his mother the countess had recovered from her swoon my son said she desirest thou to ride forth
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9449.mp3	yes with thy leave said he go forward then she said to the court of arthur where there are the best and the noblest and the most bountiful of men and tell him thou art perceval the son of pelenore
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9450.mp3	and ask of him to bestow knighthood on thee and whenever thou seest a church repeat there thy pater noster
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9451.mp3	for thus shalt thou acquire fame yet freely give it to another for thus thou shalt obtain praise if thou see a fair woman pay court to her for thus thou wilt obtain love
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9452.mp3	perceiving in one corner of the tent some food two flasks full of wine and some boar's flesh roasted he said my mother told me whenever i saw meat and drink to take it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9453.mp3	and he ate greedily for he was very hungry the maiden said sir thou hadst best go quickly from here for fear that my friends should come and evil should befall you but perceval said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9454.mp3	and he gave the maiden his own ring in exchange for hers then he mounted his horse and rode away perceval journeyed on till he arrived at arthur's court and it so happened
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9455.mp3	for when her page was serving the queen with a golden goblet this knight struck the arm of the page and dashed the wine in the queen's face and over her stomacher then he said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9456.mp3	let him follow me to the meadow so the knight took his horse and rode to the meadow carrying away the golden goblet and all the household hung down their heads and no one offered to follow the knight to take vengeance upon him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9457.mp3	for it seemed to them that no one would have ventured on so daring an outrage unless he possessed such powers through magic or charms that none could be able to punish him just then behold
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9458.mp3	perceval entered the hall upon the bony piebald horse with his uncouth trappings in the centre of the hall stood kay the seneschal tell me tall man said perceval is that arthur yonder
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9459.mp3	what wouldst thou with arthur asked kay my mother told me to go to arthur and receive knighthood from him by my faith said he thou art all too meanly equipped with horse and with arms
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9460.mp3	then all the household began to jeer and laugh at him but there was a certain damsel who had been a whole year at arthur's court
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9461.mp3	and the king's fool footnote a fool was a common appendage of the courts of those days when this romance was written a fool was the ornament held in next estimation to a dwarf he wore a white dress with a yellow bonnet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9462.mp3	and carried a bell or bawble in his hand though called a fool his words were often weighed and remembered as if there were a sort of oracular meaning in them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9463.mp3	till she had seen him who would be the flower of chivalry now this damsel came up to perceval and told him smiling that if he lived he would be one of the bravest and best of knights truly said kay
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9464.mp3	thou art ill taught to remain a year at arthur's court with choice of society and smile on no one and now before the face of arthur and all his knights to call such a man as this the flower of knighthood
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9465.mp3	that she fell senseless to the ground then said kay to perceval go after the knight who went hence to the meadow overthrow him and recover the golden goblet and possess thyself of his horse and arms and thou shalt have knighthood
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9466.mp3	i will do so tall man said perceval so he turned his horse's head toward the meadow and when he came there the knight was riding up and down proud of his strength and valor and noble mien tell me said the knight
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9467.mp3	didst thou see any one coming after me from the court
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9468.mp3	and to take from thee the goblet and thy horse and armor for myself silence said the knight go back to the court and tell arthur either to come himself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9469.mp3	and unless he do so quickly i will not wait for him by my faith said perceval choose thou whether it shall be willingly or unwillingly for i will have the horse and the arms and the goblet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9470.mp3	upon this the knight ran at him furiously and struck him a violent blow with the shaft of his spear
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9471.mp3	my mother's servants were not used to play with me in this wise so thus will i play with thee and he threw at him one of his sharp pointed sticks and it struck him in the eye and came out at the back of his head so that he fell down lifeless
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9472.mp3	verily said sir owain the son of urien to kay the seneschal thou wast ill advised to send that madman after the knight for he must either be overthrown or flee and either way it will be a disgrace to arthur and his warriors
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9473.mp3	therefore will i go to see what has befallen him so sir owain went to the meadow and he found perceval trying in vain to get the dead knight's armor off in order to clothe himself with it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9474.mp3	sir owain unfastened the armor and helped perceval to put it on and taught him how to put his foot in the stirrup and use the spur
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9475.mp3	and urged on his horse with a stick then owain would have had him return to the court to receive the praise that was his due but perceval said i will not come to the court till i have encountered the tall man that is there
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9476.mp3	to revenge the injury he did to the maiden but take thou the goblet to queen guenever and tell king arthur that wherever i am i will be his vassal and will do him what profit and service i can and sir owain
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9477.mp3	went back to the court and related all these things to arthur and guenever and to all the household
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9478.mp3	and he came to a lake on the side of which was a fair castle and on the border of the lake he saw a hoary headed man sitting upon a velvet cushion and his attendants were fishing in the lake
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9479.mp3	when the hoary headed man beheld perceval approaching he arose and went into the castle perceval rode to the castle and the door was open and he entered the hall
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9480.mp3	and the hoary headed man received perceval courteously and asked him to sit by him on the cushion when it was time the tables were set and they went to meat and when they had finished their meat the hoary headed man asked perceval
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9481.mp3	if he knew how to fight with the sword i know not said perceval but were i to be taught doubtless i should and the hoary headed man said to him i am thy uncle thy mother's brother i am called king pecheur
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9482.mp3	footnote the word means both fisher and sinner thou shalt remain with me a space in order to learn the manners and customs of different countries and courtesy and noble bearing and this do thou remember
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9483.mp3	if thou seest aught to cause thy wonder ask not the meaning of it if no one has the courtesy to inform thee the reproach will not fall upon thee but upon me that am thy teacher
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9484.mp3	while perceval and his uncle discoursed together perceval beheld two youths enter the hall bearing a golden cup and a spear of mighty size with blood dropping from its point to the ground
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9485.mp3	and when all the company saw this they began to weep and lament but for all that the man did not break off his discourse with perceval and as he did not tell him the meaning of what he saw he forebore to ask him concerning it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9486.mp3	now the cup that perceval saw was the sangreal and the spear the sacred spear and afterwards king pecheur removed with those sacred relics into a far country one evening
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9487.mp3	perceval entered a valley and came to a hermit's cell and the hermit welcomed him gladly and there he spent the night and in the morning he arose and when he went forth behold a shower of snow had fallen in the night and a hawk
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9488.mp3	had killed a wild fowl in front of the cell and the noise of the horse had scared the hawk away and a raven alighted on the bird and perceval stood and compared the blackness of the raven and the whiteness of the snow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9489.mp3	to the hair of the lady that best he loved which was blacker than jet and to her skin which was whiter than the snow and to the two red spots upon her cheeks which were redder than the blood upon the snow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9490.mp3	now arthur and his household were in search of perceval and by chance they came that way know ye said arthur who is the knight with the long spear that stands by the brook up yonder lord said one of them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9491.mp3	i will go and learn who he is
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9492.mp3	and who he was but perceval was so intent upon his thought that he gave him no answer then the youth thrust at perceval with his lance and perceval turned upon him and struck him to the ground
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9493.mp3	and when the youth returned to the king and told how rudely he had been treated sir kay said i will go myself and when he greeted perceval and got no answer he spoke to him rudely and angrily
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9494.mp3	and perceval thrust at him with his lance and cast him down so that he broke his arm and his shoulder blade and while he lay thus stunned his horse returned back at a wild and prancing pace then said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9495.mp3	surnamed the golden tongued because he was the most courteous knight in arthur's court it is not fitting that any should disturb an honorable knight from his thought unadvisedly for either he is pondering some damage that he has sustained
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9496.mp3	or he is thinking of the lady whom best he loves if it seem well to thee lord i will go and see if this knight has changed from his thought and if he has i will ask him courteously to come and visit thee
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9497.mp3	and perceval was resting on the shaft of his spear pondering the same thought
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9498.mp3	if i thought it would be as agreeable to thee as it would be to me i would converse with thee i have also a message from arthur unto thee to pray thee to come and visit him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9499.mp3	and two men have been before on this errand that is true said perceval and uncourteously they came they attacked me and i was annoyed thereat then he told him the thought that occupied his mind

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9606.mp3	she confided to jasper when once out of doors how else could they be pulled so tight and they look as hard as a drum i didn't investigate he said laughing i'll leave that to you polly well it's funny anyway she said
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9607.mp3	and those embroidered jackets over their waists and those caps and horrible pot hooks and long curls it's well that we've got so many pictures for the people at home would never believe our stories without them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9608.mp3	continued polly squinting up at a crooked row all colours green stripes and black stripes and o dear me jasper king just look at phronsie jasper followed the direction of polly's finger

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9610.mp3	sighed phronsie giving motherly pats to the stout little legs dangling down from her lap come children grandpapa emerged from the little old house we must hurry on else we sha'n't get through this island come phronsie goodness me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9611.mp3	begged phronsie staggering to her feet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9612.mp3	goodness me no child exclaimed grandpapa in horror put her down phronsie she's ever so much too heavy for you dear he put forth a protesting hand but the tears ran down phronsie's cheeks and fell on the baby's stiff white cap
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9613.mp3	at that old mister king was quite gone in despair phronsie polly bent over and whispered close to the wet little cheek don't you see grandpapa is feeling badly i'm afraid he will be sick phronsie if he is unhappy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9614.mp3	the roman and the persian empires drained of men and money and ravaged from end to end by each other's marauding armies sank down in exhaustion to heal them of their deadly wounds
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9615.mp3	never before had either power dealt its neighbour such fearful blows as in this last struggle in previous wars the contest had been waged around border fortresses and the prize had been the conquest of some small slice of marchland
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9616.mp3	had struck deadly blows at the heart of each other's empire and harried the inmost provinces up to the gates of each other's capitals the persian had turned the wild hordes of the avars loose on thrace
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9617.mp3	they were bleeding at every pore utterly wearied and exhausted and desirous of nothing but a long interval of peace to recover their lost strength precisely at this moment a new and terrible enemy fell upon the two war worn combatants
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9618.mp3	and delivered an attack so vehement that it was destined to destroy the ancient kingdom of persia and to shear away half the provinces of the roman empire
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9619.mp3	the politics of arabia had up to this time been of little moment either to roman or persian each of them had allies among the arab tribes and had sometimes sent an expedition or an embassy southward

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9621.mp3	events of world wide importance had been taking place in the arabian peninsula for the first and last time in history there had arisen among the arabs one of those world compelling minds that are destined to turn aside the current of events
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9622.mp3	into new channels and change the face of whole continents mahomet that strangest of moral enigmas prophet and seer fanatic and impostor was developing his career all through the years of the persian war
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9623.mp3	by an extraordinary mixture of genuine enthusiasm and vulgar cunning of self deception and deliberate imposture of benevolence and cruelty of austerity and licence he had worked himself and his creed to the front
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9624.mp3	the turbulent polytheists of arabia had by him been converted into a compact band of fanatics burning to carry all over the world by the force of their swords their new war cry that
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9625.mp3	god was god and mahomet his prophet

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9708.mp3	historians have given to the scheme of reform which he took in hand the name of the iconoclastic movement because of the opposition to the worship of images which formed one of the most prominent features of his action
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9709.mp3	for the last hundred years the empire had been declining in culture and civilization literature and art seemed likely to perish in the never ending clash of arms the old roman jurisprudence was being forgotten
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9710.mp3	the race of educated civil servants was showing signs of extinction the governors of provinces were now without exception rough soldiers not members of that old bureaucracy whose roman traditions had so long kept the empire together
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9711.mp3	not least among the signs of a decaying civilization were the gross superstitions which had grown up of late in the religious world
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9712.mp3	unnoticed and unguarded against by theologians who devoted all their energies to the barren monothelite and monophysite controversies image worship and relic worship in particular had developed with strange rapidity and assumed the shape of mere fetishism
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9713.mp3	slavs and bulgarians all of whom he beat back with great slaughter on the numerous occasions when they invaded the empire but in the minds both of constantine himself and of his contemporaries his dealings with things religious were the main feature of his reign

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9801.mp3	in explaining these intellectual realities one is obliged to express them by sensible figures because in exterior existence there is nothing that is not material therefore to explain the reality of the spirit
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9802.mp3	its condition its station one is obliged to give explanations under the forms of sensible things because in the external world all that exists is sensible for example grief and happiness are intellectual things
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9803.mp3	this is an intellectual or spiritual state to explain which you are obliged to have recourse to sensible figures another example you say such an individual made great progress
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9804.mp3	though he is remaining in the same place or again such a one's position was exalted although like everyone else he walks upon the earth this exaltation and this progress are spiritual states and intellectual realities
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9805.mp3	but to explain them you are obliged to have recourse to sensible figures because in the exterior world there is nothing that is not sensible so the symbol of knowledge is light and of ignorance darkness but reflect
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9806.mp3	is knowledge sensible light or ignorance sensible darkness no they are merely symbols these are only intellectual states
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9807.mp3	but when you desire to express them outwardly you call knowledge light and ignorance darkness you say my heart was gloomy and it became enlightened
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9808.mp3	now that light of knowledge and that darkness of ignorance are intellectual realities not sensible ones but when we seek for explanations in the external world we are obliged to give them a sensible form
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9809.mp3	then it is evident that the dove which descended upon christ was not a material dove but it was a spiritual state which that it might be comprehensible was expressed by a sensible figure
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9810.mp3	thus in the old testament it is said that god appeared as a pillar of fire this does not signify the material form it is an intellectual reality which is expressed by a sensible image
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9811.mp3	a simile a metaphor and is not to be accepted literally it is not a state that can be comprehended by man sleeping and waking is passing from one state to another sleeping is the condition of repose
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9812.mp3	and wakefulness is the condition of movement sleeping is the state of silence

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9814.mp3	or the earth was dead and the spring came and it revived these expressions are metaphors allegories mystic explanations in the world of signification briefly the holy manifestations have ever been
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9815.mp3	and ever will be luminous realities no change or variation takes place in their essence before declaring their manifestation they are silent and quiet like a sleeper and after their manifestation they speak and are illuminated

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9819.mp3	and of everything have we created two kinds that is to say we have created all the beings through pairing briefly they say a man without a human father cannot be imagined

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9943.mp3	in right can never remain fixed it is impossible in fact that it can ever become property every occupant is then necessarily a possessor
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9944.mp3	he is responsible for the thing entrusted to him he must use it in conformity with general utility with a view to its preservation and development he has no power to transform it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9945.mp3	to diminish it or to change its nature he cannot so divide the usufruct that another shall perform the labor while he receives the product in a word
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9946.mp3	an immorality born of violence the most monstrous pretension that the civil laws ever sanctioned man receives his usufruct from the hands of society
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9947.mp3	which alone is the permanent possessor the individual passes away society is deathless what a profound disgust fills my soul while discussing such simple truths
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9948.mp3	the amount occupied being measured not by the will but by the variable conditions of space and number property cannot exist
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9949.mp3	this no code has ever expressed this no constitution can admit these are axioms which the civil law and the law of nations deny
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9950.mp3	but i hear the exclamations of the partisans of another system labor labor that is the basis of property reader do not be deceived
