https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9952.mp3	there can be no nobler cause for which to work than the peace of righteousness and high honor is due those serene and lofty souls who with wisdom and courage
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9953.mp3	with high idealism tempered by sane facing of the actual facts of life have striven to bring nearer the day when armed strife between nation and nation between class and class
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9954.mp3	between man and man shall end throughout the world because all this is true it is also true that there are no men more ignoble or more foolish no men whose actions are fraught with greater possibility of mischief
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9955.mp3	to their country and to mankind than those who exalt unrighteous peace as better than righteous war the men who have stood highest in our history as in the history of all countries are those who scorned injustice
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9956.mp3	who were incapable of oppressing the weak or of permitting their country with their consent to oppress the weak but who did not hesitate to draw the sword when to leave it undrawn meant inability to arrest triumphant wrong
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9957.mp3	yet every man in active affairs who also reads about the past grows by bitter experience to realize that there are plenty of men not only among those who mean ill but among those who mean well
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9958.mp3	who are ready enough to praise what was done in the past and yet are incapable of profiting by it when faced by the needs of the present during our generation this seems to have been peculiarly the case among the men
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9959.mp3	who have become obsessed with the idea of obtaining universal peace by some cheap patent panacea there has been a real and substantial growth
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9960.mp3	in the feeling for international responsibility and justice among the great civilized nations during the past threescore or fourscore years there has been a real growth of recognition of the fact
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9961.mp3	and that in most cases war is an evil method of settling international difficulties but as yet there has been only a rudimentary beginning of the development of international tribunals of justice
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9962.mp3	and there has been no development at all of any international police power now as i have already said the whole fabric of municipal law of law within each nation
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9963.mp3	rests ultimately upon the judge and the policeman and the complete absence of the policeman and the almost complete absence of the judge in international affairs prevents there being as yet any real homology
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9964.mp3	between municipal and international law moreover the questions which sometimes involve nations in war are far more difficult and complex than any questions that affect merely individuals
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9965.mp3	almost every great nation has inherited certain questions either with other nations or with sections of its own people which it is quite impossible in the present state of civilization to decide
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9966.mp3	as matters between private individuals can be decided during the last century at least half of the wars that have been fought have been civil and not foreign wars there are big and powerful nations which habitually commit either upon other nations
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9967.mp3	or upon sections of their own people wrongs so outrageous as to justify even the most peaceful persons in going to war there are also weak nations so utterly incompetent
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9968.mp3	either to protect the rights of foreigners against their own citizens or to protect their own citizens against foreigners that it becomes a matter of sheer duty for some outside power to interfere in connection with them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9969.mp3	as yet in neither case is there any efficient method of getting international action and if joint action by several powers is secured the result is usually considerably worse than if only one power interfered
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9970.mp3	the worst infamies of modern times such affairs as the massacres of the armenians by the turks for instance have been perpetrated in a time of nominally profound international peace
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9971.mp3	when there has been a concert of big powers to prevent the breaking of this peace although only by breaking it could the outrages be stopped be it remembered that the peoples who suffered by these hideous massacres who saw their women violated
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9972.mp3	otherwise they would not have been massacred for if the jews in russia and the armenians in turkey had been armed and had been efficient in the use of their arms no mob would have meddled with them
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9973.mp3	yet amiable but fatuous persons with all these facts before their eyes pass resolutions demanding universal arbitration for everything
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9974.mp3	and their abandonment of their armed forces or else they write well meaning solemn little books or pamphlets or editorials and articles in magazines or newspapers to show
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9975.mp3	because it is expensive this is precisely like arguing that we should disband the police and devote our sole attention to persuading criminals
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9976.mp3	suppose that burglary highway robbery and white slavery are profitable it is almost useless to attempt to argue with these well intentioned persons because they are suffering under an obsession and are not open to reason
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9977.mp3	they go wrong at the outset for they lay all the emphasis on peace and none at all on righteousness they are not all of them physically timid men but they are usually men
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9978.mp3	from insulting or wronging the people of other nations but they always ardently advocate that we in our turn shall tamely submit to wrong and insult from other nations

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9980.mp3	in eighteen sixty one they should have peacefully submitted to seeing their country split into half a dozen jangling confederacies and slavery made perpetual if unwilling to learn from their own history

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/9982.mp3	of outsiders because it does not possess the power to fight japan stands on a footing of equality with european and american nations because it does possess this power china now sees japan

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10054.mp3	touched me with her hand i would perhaps faint away i ached to forgive and forget wash williams stopped and stood staring at george willard

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10167.mp3	it is done with it is broken it lies on the earth there is no longer any sceptre but make me a revolution against that little embroidered handkerchief which smells of patchouli i should like to see you do it try why is it so solid
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10168.mp3	because it is a gewgaw ah you are the nineteenth century well what then and we have been as foolish as you
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10169.mp3	i should be only too happy to re enter it which of you has seen the planet venus the coquette of the abyss the celimene of the ocean rise in the infinite calming all here below the ocean is a rough alcestis well grumble as he will
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10170.mp3	and arrange yourselves a nest for life pardi to love to be loved what a fine miracle when one is young
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10171.mp3	i too have had my dream i too have meditated i too have sighed i too have had a moonlight soul love is a child six thousand years old love has the right to a long white beard
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10172.mp3	methusalem is a street arab beside cupid for sixty centuries men and women have got out of their scrape by loving the devil who is cunning took to hating man man who is still more cunning took to loving woman in this way
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10173.mp3	he does more good than the devil does him harm this craft was discovered in the days of the terrestrial paradise the invention is old my friends but it is perfectly new profit by it be daphnis and chloe
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10174.mp3	manage so that when you are with each other nothing shall be lacking to you and that cosette may be the sun for marius and that marius may be the universe to cosette cosette let your fine weather be the smile of your husband marius
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10175.mp3	adore each other and snap your fingers at all the rest believe what i say to you it is good sense and good sense cannot lie be a religion to each other each man has his own fashion of adoring god
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10176.mp3	i would like greatly to get married if any one would have me
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10177.mp3	to idolize to coo to preen ourselves to be dove like to be dainty to bill and coo our loves from morn to night to gaze at one's image in one's little wife to be proud to be triumphant to plume oneself
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10178.mp3	and to take away from us and put back in his box
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10179.mp3	my children receive an old man's blessing the evening was gay lively and agreeable the grandfather's sovereign good humor gave the key note to the whole feast and each person regulated his conduct
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10180.mp3	there was a tumult then silence the married pair disappeared a little after midnight
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10181.mp3	here we pause on the threshold of wedding nights stands a smiling angel with his finger on his lips the soul enters into contemplation before that sanctuary where the celebration of love takes place there should be flashes of light athwart such houses
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10182.mp3	ought to make its escape through the stones of the walls in brilliancy and vaguely illuminate the gloom it is impossible that this sacred and fatal festival should not give off a celestial radiance to the infinite love is the sublime crucible
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10183.mp3	dazzled with voluptuousness and believing themselves alone were to listen they would hear in their chamber a confused rustling of wings perfect happiness implies a mutual understanding with the angels that dark little chamber has all heaven for its ceiling
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10184.mp3	when two mouths rendered sacred by love approach to create it is impossible that there should not be above that ineffable kiss a quivering throughout the immense mystery of stars these felicities are the true ones
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10185.mp3	there is no joy outside of these joys love is the only ecstasy all the rest weeps to love or to have loved this suffices demand nothing more there is no other pearl to be found in the shadowy folds of life
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10186.mp3	so far i have been dealing with our general outfit and shall now pass to the special equipment of the shore party the hut we took out was built on my property on bundefjord so that i was able to watch the work as it progressed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10187.mp3	it was built by the brothers hans and joergen stubberud and was throughout a splendid piece of work which did honour to both the brothers the materials proved excellent in every way the hut was twenty six feet long by thirteen feet wide
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10188.mp3	its height from the floor to the ridge of the roof was about twelve feet it was built as an ordinary norwegian house with pointed gable and had two rooms one of these was nineteen and a half feet long and was to serve as our dormitory dining room and sitting room
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10189.mp3	the other room was six and a half feet long and was to be lindstroem's kitchen from the kitchen a double trap door led to the loft where we intended to keep a quantity of provisions and outfit the walls consisted of three inch planks
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10190.mp3	for insulation we used cellulose pulp the floor and the ceiling between the rooms and the loft were double
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10191.mp3	the doors were extraordinarily thick and strong and fitted into oblique grooves so that they closed very tightly there were two windows a triple one in the end wall of the main room and a double one in the kitchen
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10192.mp3	for the covering of the roof we took out roofing paper and for the floor linoleum in the main room there were two air pipes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10193.mp3	there were bunks for ten men in two stages six on one wall and four on the other the furniture of the room consisted of a table a stool for each man and a lux lamp
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10194.mp3	the hut was tarred several times and every part was carefully marked so that it could easily be set up to fasten it to the ground and prevent the antarctic storms from blowing it away i had strong eyebolts screwed into each end of the roof ridge
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10195.mp3	and the four corners of the roof we carried six strong eyebolts a metre long to be rammed into the barrier between these bolts and those on the hut steel wires were to be stretched which could be drawn quite tight we also had two spare cables
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10196.mp3	which could be stretched over the roof if the gales were too severe the two ventilating pipes and the chimney were secured outside with strong stays as will be seen every precaution was taken to make the hut warm and comfortable
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10197.mp3	and to hold it down on the ground we also took on board a quantity of loose timber boards and planks besides the hut we took with us fifteen tents for sixteen men each ten of these were old but good
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10198.mp3	they were served out to us from the naval stores the other five were new and we bought them from the army depots it was our intention to use the tents as temporary houses they were easily and quickly set up and were strong and warm
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10199.mp3	on the voyage to the south roenne sewed new floors of good strong canvas to the five new tents all cases of provisions that were intended for winter quarters were marked and stowed separately in the hold
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10200.mp3	we had ten sledges made by a firm of sporting outfitters in christiania they were built like the old nansen sledges but rather broader and were twelve feet long the runners were of the best american hickory shod with steel
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10201.mp3	the other parts were of good tough norwegian ash to each sledge belonged a pair of spare runners which could easily be fitted underneath by means of clamps and as easily removed when not required
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10202.mp3	the steel shoeing of the runners was well coated with red lead and the spare runners with tar these sledges were extremely strongly built and could stand all kinds of work on every sort of surface at that time
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10203.mp3	i did not know the conditions on the barrier as i afterwards came to know them of course these sledges were very heavy we took twenty pairs of ski all of the finest hickory they were eight feet long and proportionately narrow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10204.mp3	i chose them of this length with a view to being able to cross the numerous cracks in the glaciers the greater the surface over which the weight could be distributed the better prospect we should have of slipping over the snow bridges
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10205.mp3	we had forty ski poles with ebonite points the ski bindings were a combination of the huitfeldt and the hoeyer ellefsen bindings we also had quantities of loose straps
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10206.mp3	we had six three man tents all made in the navy workshops the workmanship could not have been better they were the strongest and most practical tents that have ever been used they were made of the closest canvas with the floor in one piece
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10207.mp3	one man was sufficient to set up the tent in the stiffest breeze i have come to the conclusion that the fewer poles a tent has the easier it is to set up which seems quite natural these tents have only one pole
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10208.mp3	how often one reads in narratives of polar travel that it took such and such a time often hours to set up the tent and then when at last it was up one lay expecting it to be blown down at any moment
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10209.mp3	there was no question of this with our tents they were up in a twinkling and stood against all kinds of wind we could lie securely in our sleeping bags and let it blow the arrangement of the door was on the usual sack principle
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10210.mp3	which came from the estate of palsgaard in jutland and the material did all it promised these cases were one foot square and fifteen and a half inches high
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10211.mp3	they had only a little round opening on the top closed with an aluminium lid which fitted exactly like the lid of a milk can large lids weaken the cases and i had therefore chosen this form we did not have to throw off the lashing of the case to get the lid off
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10212.mp3	and this is a very great advantage we could always get at it a case with a large lid covered by the lashing gives constant trouble the whole lashing has to be undone for every little thing one wants out of the case this is not always convenient
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10213.mp3	if one is tired and slack it may sometimes happen that one will put off till to morrow what ought to be done to day especially when it is bitterly cold
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10214.mp3	the handier one's sledging outfit the sooner one gets into the tent and to rest and that is no small consideration on a long journey our outfit of clothing was abundant and more complete i suppose than that of any former polar expedition
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10215.mp3	we may divide it into two classes the outfit for specially low temperatures and that for more moderate temperatures it must be remembered that no one had yet wintered on the barrier so we had to be prepared for anything
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10216.mp3	in order to be able to grapple with any degree of cold we were supplied with the richest assortment of reindeer skin clothing we had it specially thick medium and quite light it took a long time to get these skin clothes prepared
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10217.mp3	first the reindeer skins had to be bought in a raw state
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10218.mp3	let me take the opportunity of thanking this man for the many and great services he has rendered me not only during my preparations for the third voyage of the fram
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10219.mp3	with his help i have succeeded in obtaining things that i should otherwise never have been able to get he shrank from no amount of work but went on till he had found what i wanted
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10220.mp3	this time he procured nearly two hundred and fifty good reindeer skins dressed by the lapps and sent them to christiania here i had great trouble in finding a man who could sew skins but at last i found one
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10221.mp3	we then went to work to make clothes after the pattern of the netchelli eskimo and the sewing went on early and late thick anoraks and thin ones heavy breeches and light winter stockings and summer stockings
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10222.mp3	we also had a dozen thin sleeping bags which i thought of using inside the big thick ones if the cold should be too severe everything was finished but not until the last moment the outer sleeping bags were made by mister brandt furrier of bergen
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10223.mp3	and they were so excellent both in material and making up that no one in the world could have done better it was a model piece of work to save this outer sleeping bag we had it provided with a cover of the lightest canvas
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10224.mp3	which was a good deal longer than the bag itself it was easy to tie the end of the cover together like the mouth of the sack and this kept the snow out of the bag during the day's march
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10225.mp3	in this way we always kept ourselves free from the annoyance of drifting snow we attached great importance to having the bags made of the very best sort of skin and took care that the thin skin of the belly was removed
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10226.mp3	as of course the cold penetrates more easily through the thin skin and gives rise to dampness in the form of rime on meeting the warmth of the body these thin patches remain damp whenever one is in the bag and in a short time they lose their hair
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10227.mp3	the damp spreads like decay in wood and continually attacks the surrounding skin with the result that one fine day you find yourself with a hairless sleeping bag
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10228.mp3	our burberry wind clothes were made in the form of anorak blouse and trousers both very roomy the others consisted of trousers and jacket with hood our mits were for the most part such as one can buy in any shop
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10229.mp3	we wanted nothing else in and around winter quarters outside the mits we wore an outer covering of windproof material so as not to wear them out too quickly these mits are not very strong though they are good and warm
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10230.mp3	besides these we had ten pairs of ordinary kid mits which were bought at a glove shop in christiania and were practically impossible to wear out i wore mine from framheim to the pole and back again and afterwards on the voyage to tasmania
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10231.mp3	the lining of course was torn in places but the seams of the mits were just as perfect as the day i bought them taking into consideration the fact that i went on ski the whole way and used two poles it will be understood that the mits were strongly made
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10232.mp3	we also had a number of woollen gloves which curiously enough the others greatly prized for myself i was never able to wear such things they simply freeze the fingers off me but most important of all is the covering of the feet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10233.mp3	for the feet are the most exposed members and the most difficult to protect one can look after the hands
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10234.mp3	and this is a sufficiently troublesome piece of work to make one disinclined to undo it again until one is turning in they cannot be seen in the course of the day and one has to depend entirely on feeling but feeling in this case often plays curious tricks
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10235.mp3	for if they had known it they could not possibly have let it go so far the fact is that in this case sensation is a somewhat doubtful guide for the feet lose all sensation
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10236.mp3	it is true that there is a transitional stage when one feels the cold smarting in one's toes and tries to get rid of it by stamping the feet as a rule this is successful the warmth returns or the circulation is restored
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10237.mp3	but it occasionally happens that sensation is lost at the very moment when these precautions are taken and then one must be an old hand to know what has happened many men conclude that as they no longer feel the unpleasant smarting sensation all is well
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10238.mp3	and at the evening inspection a frozen foot of tallow like appearance presents itself an event of this kind may ruin the most elaborately prepared enterprise and it is therefore advisable in the matter of feet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10239.mp3	to carry one's caution to lengths which may seem ridiculous now it is a fact that if one can wear soft foot gear exclusively the risk of frost bite is far less than if one is compelled to wear stiff boots in soft foot gear of course
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10240.mp3	the foot can move far more easily and keep warm but we were to take ski and to get full use out of them so that in any case we had to have a stiff sole for the sake of the bindings it is of no use to have a good binding unless you can use it in the right way
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10241.mp3	in my opinion on a long journey such as that we had before us the ski must be perfectly steady i do not know anything that tires me more than a bad fastening that is one that allows the foot to shift in the binding
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10242.mp3	i want the ski to be a part of oneself so that one always has full command of them i have tried many patents for i have always been afraid of a stiff fastening in cold temperatures but all these patents without exception are worthless in the long run
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10243.mp3	i decided this time to try a combination of stiff and soft foot gear so that we could use the splendid huitfeldt hoeyer ellefsen bindings but this was no easy matter of our whole outfit nothing caused me more worry
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10244.mp3	or gave us all more work in the course of the expedition than the stiff outer covering which we had to have but we solved the problem at last i applied to one of the leading makers of ski boots in christiania and explained the difficulty to him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10245.mp3	fortunately i had found a man who was evidently interested in the question we agreed that he should make a sample pair after the pattern of ski boots the sole was to be thick and stiff for we had to be prepared to use crampons but the uppers as soft as possible
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10246.mp3	in order to avoid leather which usually becomes stiff and easily cracked in the cold he was to use a combination of leather and thin canvas for the uppers leather nearest the sole and canvas above it the measurements were taken from my foot
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10247.mp3	which is not exactly a child's foot with two pairs of reindeer skin stockings on and ten pairs were made
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10248.mp3	they were exhibited in the bootmaker's windows i used to go a long way round to avoid coming face to face with these monsters in public we are all a trifle vain and dislike having our own shortcomings shown up in electric light
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10249.mp3	if i had ever cherished any illusions on the subject of a dainty little foot i am sure the last trace of such vanity died out on the day i passed the shoemaker's window and beheld my own boots
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10250.mp3	i never went that way again until i was certain that the exhibition was closed one thing is certain that the boots were a fine piece of workmanship we shall hear later on of the alterations they had to undergo before we at last made them as large as we wanted
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10251.mp3	for the giant boots turned out much too small among other equipment i must mention our excellent primus cooking apparatus this all came complete from a firm in stockholm for cooking on sledge journeys the primus stove ranks above all others
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10252.mp3	it gives a great deal of heat uses little oil and requires no attention advantages which are important enough anywhere but especially when sledging there is never any trouble with this apparatus it has come as near perfection as possible
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10253.mp3	we took five nansen cookers with us this cooker utilizes the heat more completely than any other but i have one objection to make to it it takes up space we used it on our depot journeys
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10254.mp3	but were unfortunately obliged to give it up on the main southern journey we were so many in a tent and space was so limited that i dared not risk using it if one has room enough it is ideal in my opinion
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10255.mp3	we had with us ten pairs of snow shoes and one hundred sets of dog harness of the alaska eskimo pattern the alaska eskimo drive their dogs in tandem the whole pull is thus straight ahead in the direction the sledge is going
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10256.mp3	and this is undoubtedly the best way of utilizing the power i had made up my mind to adopt the same system in sledging on the barrier another great advantage it had was that the dogs would pass singly across fissures
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10257.mp3	so that the danger of falling through was considerably reduced the exertion of pulling is also less trying with alaska harness than with the greenland kind as the alaska harness has a shallow padded collar
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10258.mp3	which is slipped over the animal's head and makes the weight of the pull come on his shoulders whereas the greenland harness presses on his chest raw places which occur rather frequently with the greenland harness are almost entirely avoided with the other
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10259.mp3	all the sets of harness were made in the navy workshops and after their long and hard use they are as good as ever there could be no better recommendation than this of instruments and apparatus for the sledge journeys we carried two sextants
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10260.mp3	three artificial horizons of which two were glass horizons with dark glasses and one a mercury horizon and four spirit compasses made in christiania they were excellent little compasses
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10261.mp3	i had drawn the maker's attention to this beforehand and asked him to use as pure a spirit as possible what his object was i still do not know but the spirit he employed was highly dilute
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10262.mp3	the best proof of this was that the liquid in our compasses froze before the spirits in a flask we were naturally inconvenienced by this besides these we had an ordinary little pocket compass two pairs of binoculars one by zeiss and the other by goertz
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10263.mp3	and snow goggles from doctor schanz
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10264.mp3	during the whole stay on the barrier i myself wore a pair of ordinary spectacles with yellow glasses of quite a light tint
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10265.mp3	how excellent these glasses are appears clearly enough from the fact that i never had the slightest touch of snow blindness on the southern journey
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10266.mp3	it will perhaps be suggested that i am less susceptible to this ailment than others but i know from personal experience that such is not the case i have previously had several severe attacks of snow blindness we had two photographic cameras an air thermometer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10267.mp3	two aneroids with altitude scale to fifteen thousand feet and two hypsometers the hypsometer is only an instrument for determining the boiling point which gives one the height above the sea the method is both simple and reliable

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10369.mp3	he's axtra fond o the feeshin was the reply for a that he's a foreign shentleman waiting till the boat had become a distant speck on the face of the waters gimblet made his way into the inn and entered into conversation with the landlord

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10393.mp3	what his object can be in acting thus in concealing himself after rendering us so many services i cannot understand but his services are not the less real
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10394.mp3	and are of such a nature that only a man possessed of prodigious power could render them ayrton is indebted to him as much as we are for if it was the stranger who saved me from the waves after the fall from the balloon
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10395.mp3	that it was he who lighted that fire on the heights of the island which permitted you to land that it was he who fired that bullet found in the body of the peccary that it was he who plunged that torpedo into the channel which destroyed the brig

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10397.mp3	we have contracted a debt and i hope that we shall one day pay it you are right in speaking thus my dear cyrus replied gideon spilett yes there is an almost all powerful being hidden in some part of the island

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10453.mp3	that spilett only felt it beat at long intervals as if it was on the point of stopping these symptoms were very serious herbert's chest was laid bare and the blood having been stanched with handkerchiefs it was bathed with cold water

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10455.mp3	but the heart asked harding the heart has not been touched if it had been herbert would be dead dead exclaimed pencroft with a groan the sailor had only heard the last words uttered by the reporter

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10457.mp3	pencroft was silent but a reaction set in and great tears rolled down his cheeks in the meanwhile gideon spilett endeavored to collect his ideas and proceed methodically after his examination he had no doubt that the ball
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10458.mp3	entering in front between the seventh and eighth ribs had issued behind between the third and fourth but what mischief had the ball committed in its passage what important organs had been reached a professional surgeon would have had difficulty in determining this at once
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10459.mp3	and still more so the reporter however he knew one thing this was that he would have to prevent the inflammatory strangulation of the injured parts then to contend with the local inflammation and fever which would result from the wound perhaps mortal
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10460.mp3	now what styptics what antiphlogistics ought to be employed by what means could inflammation be prevented at any rate the most important thing was that the two wounds should be dressed without delay
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10461.mp3	it did not appear necessary to gideon spilett that a fresh flow of blood should be caused by bathing them in tepid water and compressing their lips the hemorrhage had been very abundant and herbert was already too much enfeebled by the loss of blood
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10462.mp3	the reporter therefore thought it best to simply bathe the two wounds with cold water herbert was placed on his left side and was maintained in that position he must not be moved said gideon spilett
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10463.mp3	he is in the most favorable position for the wounds in his back and chest to suppurate easily and absolute rest is necessary what can't we carry him to granite house asked pencroft no pencroft replied the reporter
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10464.mp3	cyrus said he i am not a surgeon i am in terrible perplexity you must aid me with your advice your experience take courage my friend answered the engineer pressing the reporter's hand judge coolly
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10465.mp3	think only of this herbert must be saved these words restored to gideon spilett that self possession which he had lost in a moment of discouragement on feeling his great responsibility he seated himself close to the bed cyrus harding stood near
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10466.mp3	pencroft had torn up his shirt and was mechanically making lint spilett then explained to cyrus harding that he thought he ought first of all to stop the hemorrhage but not close the two wounds or cause their immediate cicatrization for there had been internal perforation
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10467.mp3	and the suppuration must not be allowed to accumulate in the chest harding approved entirely and it was decided that the two wounds should be dressed without attempting to close them by immediate coaptation and now
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10468.mp3	did the colonists possess an efficacious agent to act against the inflammation which might occur yes they had one for nature had generously lavished it they had cold water that is to say the most powerful sedative that can be employed against inflammation of wounds
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10469.mp3	the most efficacious therapeutic agent in grave cases and the one which is now adopted by all physicians cold water has moreover the advantage of leaving the wound in absolute rest and preserving it from all premature dressing a considerable advantage
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10470.mp3	since it has been found by experience that contact with the air is dangerous during the first days gideon spilett and cyrus harding reasoned thus with their simple good sense and they acted as the best surgeon would have done
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10471.mp3	compresses of linen were applied to poor herbert's two wounds and were kept constantly wet with cold water the sailor had at first lighted a fire in the hut which was not wanting in things necessary for life maple sugar medicinal plants
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10472.mp3	the same which the lad had gathered on the banks of lake grant enabled them to make some refreshing drinks which they gave him without his taking any notice of it his fever was extremely high and all that day and night passed without his becoming conscious
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10473.mp3	herbert's life hung on a thread and this thread might break at any moment the next day the twelfth of november the hopes of harding and his companions slightly revived herbert had come out of his long stupor he opened his eyes he recognized cyrus harding
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10474.mp3	the reporter and pencroft he uttered two or three words he did not know what had happened they told him and spilett begged him to remain perfectly still telling him that his life was not in danger and that his wounds would heal in a few days
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10475.mp3	however herbert scarcely suffered at all and the cold water with which they were constantly bathed prevented any inflammation of the wounds the suppuration was established in a regular way the fever did not increase
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10476.mp3	and it might now be hoped that this terrible wound would not involve any catastrophe pencroft felt the swelling of his heart gradually subside he was like a sister of mercy like a mother by the bed of her child
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10477.mp3	herbert dozed again but his sleep appeared more natural tell me again that you hope mister spilett said pencroft tell me again that you will save herbert yes we will save him replied the reporter the wound is serious and perhaps
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10478.mp3	even the ball has traversed the lungs but the perforation of this organ is not fatal god bless you answered pencroft as may be believed during the four and twenty hours they had been in the corral the colonists had no other thought than that of nursing herbert
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10479.mp3	they did not think either of the danger which threatened them should the convicts return or of the precautions to be taken for the future but on this day while pencroft watched by the sick bed cyrus harding and the reporter consulted as to what it would be best to do
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10480.mp3	at the moment he scaled the palisade had clearly seen some one of the convicts running along the southern spur of mount franklin towards whom top had sprung it was one of those whose object had been so completely defeated by the rocks at the mouth of the mercy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10481.mp3	and as he was a man to defend himself he must have been overpowered yes that is to be feared said the reporter then doubtless the convicts installed themselves in the corral where they found plenty of everything and only fled when they saw us coming
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10482.mp3	it is very evident too that at this moment ayrton whether living or dead is not here we shall have to beat the forest said the engineer and rid the island of these wretches pencroft's presentiments were not mistaken when he wished to hunt them as wild beasts
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10483.mp3	that would have spared us all these misfortunes yes answered the reporter but now we have the right to be merciless at any rate said the engineer we are obliged to wait some time and to remain at the corral until we can carry herbert without danger to granite house
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10484.mp3	he must not come returned cyrus harding quickly he would be murdered on the road it is very probable however that he will attempt to rejoin us ah if the telegraph still acted he might be warned but that is impossible now
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10485.mp3	as to leaving pencroft and herbert here alone we could not do it well i will go alone to granite house no no cyrus answered the reporter you must not expose yourself your courage would be of no avail the villains are evidently watching the corral
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10486.mp3	they are hidden in the thick woods which surround it and if you go we shall soon have to regret two misfortunes instead of one
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10487.mp3	it is now four and twenty hours since he has had any news of us he will be sure to come and as he will be less on his guard than we should be ourselves added spilett he will be killed is there really no way of warning him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10488.mp3	who had understood the engineer top can go where we cannot he will carry to granite house the news of the corral and he will bring back to us that from granite house quick said harding quick spilett rapidly tore a leaf from his note book and wrote these words
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10489.mp3	herbert wounded we are at the corral be on your guard do not leave granite house have the convicts appeared in the neighborhood reply by top
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10490.mp3	go go top bounded at these words he understood he knew what was expected of him the road to the corral was familiar to him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10491.mp3	top running among the grass or in the wood would pass unperceived the engineer went to the gate of the corral and opened it
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10492.mp3	top sprang forwards then almost immediately disappeared he will get there said the reporter yes and he will come back the faithful animal what o'clock is it asked gideon spilett ten
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10493.mp3	in an hour he may be here we will watch for his return the gate of the corral was closed the engineer and the reporter re entered the house herbert was still in a sleep pencroft kept the compresses always wet spilett
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10494.mp3	seeing there was nothing he could do at that moment busied himself in preparing some nourishment while attentively watching that part of the enclosure against the hill at which an attack might be expected the settlers awaited top's return with much anxiety
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10495.mp3	a little before eleven o'clock cyrus harding and the reporter rifle in hand were behind the gate ready to open it at the first bark of their dog they did not doubt that if top had arrived safely at granite house
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10496.mp3	the queen was receiv'd at babylon with all the transports of joy that could possibly be express'd for the safe return of so illustrious and so beautiful a personage that had run thro such a long series of misfortunes
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10497.mp3	babylon at that time seem'd to be perfectly serene and quiet as for the young prince of hyrcania he was slain in battle the babylonians who were the victors
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10498.mp3	who should gain it by a fair and impartial election they were determin'd that the most valuable post of honour in the world namely
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10499.mp3	and the sovereign of babylon should be the result of merit only and not be procur'd by any party factions or court intrigues a solemn oath was voluntarily taken by all parties
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10500.mp3	that he who should distinguish himself by his superior valour and wisdom should unanimously be acknowledg'd the sovereign elect a spacious list or circus was pitched upon surrounded with commodious seats
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10501.mp3	erected in an amphitheatrical manner and richly embellish'd some few leagues from the city thither the combatants or champions were to repair compleatly accoutred each of them had a distinct apartment to himself behind the lists
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10502.mp3	where no soul could either see them or know who they were they were to enter the lists four several times those who were so happy as to conquer four competitors were afterwards to engage each other in single combat
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10503.mp3	in order that he who should remain master of the field should be proclaim'd the happy victor four days afterwards they were to meet again accoutred as before
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10504.mp3	and to explain all such a enigmas or riddles as the magi should think proper to propose if their queries should prove too intricate and perplext for them to resolve they were to have recourse to the lists again and after that to fresh a enigmas
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10505.mp3	before they could be entitled to the election so that the tournaments were to be continu'd till one of the candidates should be twice a victor and shine as conspicuous with respect to his internal qualities as to his dexterity and address in heroic atchievements
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10506.mp3	the queen in the mean time was to be narrowly watch'd and allow'd only to be a spectator of both their amusements at some considerable distance and moreover to be cover'd with a vail
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10507.mp3	nor was she indulg'd so far as to speak one single word to any candidate whomsoever in order to prevent the least jealousy or suspicion either of partiality or injustice
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10508.mp3	to inform her lover of all the preliminary articles abovemention'd not doubting but that he would exert both his courage and understanding for her sake beyond any of the other competitors zadig accordingly set out for babylon and besought the goddess venus
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10509.mp3	not only to fortify his courage but to illuminate his mind with wisdom on this important occasion the night before these martial atchievements were to commence zadig arrived upon the banks of the euphrates
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10510.mp3	he inscrib'd his device amongst the list of combatants concealing at the same time both his person and name as the laws of the election required and accordingly withdrew to the apartment that was provided for him
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10511.mp3	according to his lot cador who was just return'd to babylon having hunted all egypt over to no purpose in hopes to find his friend zadig brought a compleat set of armour into his lodge by express orders from the queen
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10512.mp3	she sent him likewise one of the finest horses in all persia
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10513.mp3	which redoubled his vigour and his hopes the next morning the queen being seated under a canopy of state enrich'd with precious stones and the amphitheatres being crowded with gentlemen and ladies of all ranks and conditions from babylon
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10514.mp3	the competitors made their personal appearance in the circus each of them went up to the grand magus and laid down his particular device at his feet the devices were drawn by lot that of zadig was the last
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10515.mp3	one itabod by name immensely rich indeed and very haughty
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10516.mp3	exceedingly awkward and a man of no acquir'd parts the sycophants that hover'd round about him flatter'd him that a man of his merit couldn't fail of being king he imperiously replied one of my merit must be king
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10517.mp3	his armour was made of pure gold enamell'd with green the housings of his saddle were green and his lance embellish'd with green ribbands every one was sensible at first sight
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10518.mp3	by itobad's manner of managing his horse that he was not the man whom heav'n had pitch'd upon to sway the babylonish scepter the first combatant that tilted with him threw him out of the saddle the second flung him quite over the crupper
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10519.mp3	and laid him sprawling on the ground with his heels quiv'ring in the air itobad tis true remounted but with so ill a grace
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10520.mp3	the third disdaining to use his lance made only a feint at him then catch'd hold of his right leg and whirling him round threw him flat upon the sand the esquires who were the attendants ran to his assistance
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10521.mp3	and with a sneer remounted him the fourth combatant catch'd hold of his left leg and unhors'd him again he was convey'd thro the hissing multitude to his lodge where according to the law in that case provided he was to pass the night
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10522.mp3	and as he hobbled along said he to the esquires what a sad misfortune is this to one of my birth and character the other champions play'd their parts much better and all came off with credit
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10523.mp3	some conquer'd two of their antagonists and others were so far successful as to get the better of three none of them however except prince hottam vanquish'd four zadig at last
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10524.mp3	one after the other with the utmost ease and with such an air and grace as gain'd him universal applause as the case stood thus zadig and hottam were to close the day's entertainment in a single combat
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10525.mp3	the armour of the latter was of a blue colour mixt with gold and the housings of his saddle were of the same those of the former white as snow the multitude were divided in their wishes the knight in blue was the favourite of some of the ladies
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10526.mp3	the queen whose heart was in a perfect palpitation put up her secret prayers to venus to assist her darling hero the two champions making their passes and their volta's with the utmost dexterity and address
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10527.mp3	and keeping firm in their saddles gave each other such rebuffs with their lances that all the spectators the queen only excepted wish'd for two kings of babylon at last their horses being tired and both their lances broke
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10528.mp3	zadig made use of the following stratagem
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10529.mp3	he got artfully behind him and shooting with a spring on his horses buttocks grasp'd him close threw him headlong on the sand then jump'd into his seat and wheel'd round prince hottam while he lay sprawling on the ground all the spectators in general
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10530.mp3	with loud acclamations cried out victory victory in favour of the champion in white
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10531.mp3	incens'd to the last degree got up and drew his sword zadig sprang from his horse with his sabre in his hand now behold the two chieftains upon their legs commencing a new trial of skill where they seem'd to get the better of each other alternately
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10532.mp3	for both were strong and both were active the feathers of their helmets the studs of their bracelets their coats of mail flew about in pieces thro the dry blows which they a thousand times repeated they struck at each other sometimes with the edge of their swords
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10533.mp3	at other times they push'd as occasion offer'd now on the right then on the left now on the head then at the breast they retreated they advanc'd they kept at a distance they clos'd again
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10534.mp3	their swords struck fire almost at every blow at last zadig in order to recover his breath for a moment or two stood still and afterwards making a feint at the prince threw him on his back and disarm'd him hottam thereupon
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10535.mp3	cried out o thou knight of the white armour tis you only are destin'd to be the king of babylon the queen was perfectly transported the two champions were reconducted to their separate lodges as the others had been before them in conformity to the laws prescrib'd
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10536.mp3	several mutes were order'd to wait on the champions and carry them some proper refreshment we'll leave the reader to judge whether the queen's dwarf was not appointed to wait on zadig on this happy occasion after supper the mutes withdrew
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10537.mp3	and left the combatants to rest their wearied limbs till the next morning at which time the victor was to produce his device before the grand magus in order to confer notes and discover the hero whoever he might be zadig slept very sound
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10538.mp3	notwithstanding his amorous regard for the queen being perfectly fatigu'd itabod who lay in the lodge contiguous to his could not once close his eyes for vexation he got up therefore in the dead of the night stole imperceptibly into zadig's apartment
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10539.mp3	took his white armour and device away with him and substituted his green one in its place as soon as the day began to dawn he repair'd with a seemingly undaunted courage to the grand magus to inform him that he was the mighty hero the happy victor

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10543.mp3	the populace that were left behind in the circus hiss'd him every step he took they made a ring about him and treated him with all the marks of ignominy and contempt the most cowardly wretch breathing was never sure so sweated or hunted down as poor zadig
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10544.mp3	he grew quite out of patience at last and cut his way thro the insulting mob with his rival's sabre but he did not know what measures to pursue or how to rectify so gross a mistake it was not in his power to have a sight of the queen
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10545.mp3	he could never recover the white armour again which she had sent him that was the compromise or the engagement to which the combatants had all unanimously agreed thus as he was on the one hand plung'd in an abyss of sorrow
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10546.mp3	so on the other he was almost drove distracted with vexation and resentment he withdrew therefore in a solitary mood to the banks of the euphrates now fully persuaded
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10547.mp3	that his impropitious star had shed its most baleful influence on him and that his misfortunes were irretrievable revolving in his mind all his disappointments from his first adventure with the court coquet
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10548.mp3	down to his late loss of his white armour see said he the fatal consequence of being a sluggard
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10549.mp3	all the knowledge of books or mankind all the personal valour that i can boast of has only prov'd an aggravation of my sorrows he carried the point so far at last as to murmur at the unequal dispensations of divine providence

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10553.mp3	and it was he that owned the churches in the early days the king you see was the right sort he was the real boy and loved sport as he loved his life and hunting in particular and from the rising o the sun up he got and away he went over the mountains after the deer
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10554.mp3	and thinking of drowning himself that could get no diversion in life when all of a sudden turning round the corner

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10558.mp3	and how is it you make your money so aisy
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10559.mp3	is it a tinker you are says the king no says the saint i'm no tinker by trade king o'toole

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10561.mp3	with that the king whistled and down came the poor goose just like a hound waddling up to the poor cripple her master and as like him as two peas the minute the saint clapt his eyes on the goose i'll do the job for you says he king o'toole
https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10562.mp3	by jaminee says king o'toole if you do i'll say you're the cleverest fellow in the seven parishes oh by dad says saint kavin

https://tlk.s3.yandex.net/annotation_tasks/librispeech/train-clean/10566.mp3	honour bright says king o'toole holding out his fist honour bright says saint kavin back again it's a bargain come here says he to the poor old goose
